They went back to Mom's room after dinner to do some crafts. Dana's tired, I don't think she's going to be up much longer. I'm ready for bed myself. I'm tired from not sleeping well all week and then with this rainy weather... zzzzzzzzzzzz.

Another Long Day (But Not So Rough) It seemed like I slept better last night, but I've been tired and dragging all day. I slept until 7:30am, layed in bed for another 10 minutes, got up, had breakfast, shaved (no shower), and took the later bus in to work. I got there about 2 or 3 minutes late. I ran into Santana on the way and in talked to him for a minute. He asked if I was busy on Sundays (the day his band usually jams). I'd love to get some extra playing time in, but I have no way of getting myself back and forth from his warehouse. I got right to work after I got in, doing as much as I could with the material I had provided me. JP got in around 10-10:30am this morning and he figured out what the problem with the material was and I went and finished the reports. I had him get me another report to do later on and I did that one as well. I only had to look at my notes maybe once or twice today (I'm catching on to things ok). JP and I went out for lunch again today. We were going to go to Subway, but we wound up Carmelita's. I'd never been before but he had and liked it a lot. I had my usual Mexican restaurant favorite: Chili Rellenos, but this time I had it Con Carne, with shredded beef... mmmmm. Too good! The rice was real good too. I'll have to go back there again. We stayed for about an hour I'd guess. To make up for the long lunch, I stayed a little over an hour late today, til 4:15pm. More later, Mom and I are heading up to New Port Richey to pick up my niece.

Long, Rough Day I didn't sleep very well again, I have no idea how much sleep I got, but I'm sure it's less than 7 hours because I've been dragging all day. JP picked me up for work (he stopped here to drop off his equipment) and I got to work 3 minutes late. The first three hours of the day I did very little, but then JP had me learn how to do this one report (formatting it, doing formulas for the numbers and percentages) on Excel and the rest of my day was Hell. Well not entirely, the learning part was tough, but after I got the hang of it it was ok. Later though, I found problems with some of the reports (not my doing) and it got to be Hell again. I think I took a 45-minute lunch today. JP took me over to his ALF (Assisted Living Facility) and we ate lunch over there. We had what they called "Chicken Pot Pie" but it wasn't like any pot pie I ever had (no crust, too many veggies, a mushy biscuit topping). It really wasn't my type of food at all. Old people food. I stayed an extra 2 1/2 hours today and rode home from work with JP. I ate dinner (Mom made that killer fish, Tilapia, again) before I split for practice. I offered JP some, but he wanted Subway instead. Practice sucked. Al was the only one who rehearsed and learned the new songs we were supposed to work on ("I'm Tore Down", "Desire", and "What's So Funny About Peace, Love and Understanding"). We had to go outside several times to listen to the songs on CD. I think we almost have "I'm Tore Down", but the others are pretty rough. My playing was awful tonight. I just didn't have any gas. I lost my rhythm constantly, which is doom for me. I kept playing the most bland solos ever too... pretty bad stuff. I introduced a new song of mine tonight, a fast blues, and we jammed on it awhile. JP came up with some lyrics, but they weren't too great. We ran through some cover songs we hadn't done in a while ("You May Be Right", "All For You", "The Difference", "Calling All Angels", and "I Got Loaded"). We did a reggae version of "Calling All Angels"... just for the heck of it. It sounded ok, but it was just too slow, lifeless. Kind of like me tonight. I hope I get my sleep worked out soon, this 2-6 hours a night is killing me. I need at least 8. I'm already going to get less than 8 tonight, probably less than 7 again. *sigh* I guess it could be worse. I could have a kidney stone like JP. Oh... I thought I was going to get paid tomorrow but I'm not. I will get paid on Monday, which blows. I have my niece coming down to spend the weekend and I thought I'd have some spending money when she's down. I will have to borrow a bit from Mom (I sent out a check for $50 on Wednesday that needs to be covered A.S.A.P.). I'm not sure how many days I'll get paid for on this check either, it could more than two days, which would be wonderful, but then again, it might not. *sigh* Alright, I'm going to bed.

Productive Day I got about six hours of sleep last, not quite enough, but more than I had been getting. I got up about 7:20am, ate, shaved, showered, and got ready for work in time to catch the early bus. I got to work just before 8:30am this morning. JP came in late today (doctor's appointment), so I was stuck there by myself for most of the day. The first hour and a half I did nothing basically, just surfed the net and listened to my Black Sabbath "Masters Of Reality" tape. I was waiting on some files to arrive via email, it would have given me some work to do, but it never came. After a while I got bored and went to look for something to do, anything. I remembered that JP and I were asked to open up two rows of phone cubicles, making sure they were set up with working phones and headsets, so I went and did that. It took a while to do and was more work than it sounds. I did more than I was asked to do to, taking down the papers and leftover personal effects from the cubicle walls, switching out filthy mousepads for cleaner ones, and putting blue chairs in every cubicle. I showed JP after he got there and he said I shouldn't do extra stuff or they'll take advantage of me. Everyone said I did a good job though, so that was cool. Towards the end of the day I got a bunch of work handed to me and I managed to get it all done before I left for the day at 2:30pm. The stupid bus came at 3pm, so I had to wait at the bus stop and listen to some girl telling me her life's story. Yay. I threw in some cordon bleaus after I got home and ate a big lunch/supper around 4pm, while I watched "Judge Judy". I'm tired. And hungry again too.

A Very Monday-Like Tuesday I slept like crap again last night. I went to bed around 10:20pm and read for a little bit (Kurt Vonnegut's "Breakfast Of Champions") and then around 11pm, I got tired and tried to go to sleep. Didn't happen. Sometime around 2am it started raining and I thought maybe I'd get to sleep ok then, but it started to thunder really loudly. I think I got somewhere between 2 and 3 hours of sleep last night altogether. Somehow, I managed to get up and go to work. I had breakfast (oatmeal) but I didn't have time to shower or shave today (I was dragging). I got out the door at 8:05am, 10 minutes before the bus was supposed to be there. It was raining still and my bus stop has no cover, so I was none too happy. I got even less happier having to wait there for 45 minutes before my bus showed up. The first bus never showed up, or more likely, came way too early. The bus stop is behind the house two doors down from me, so it wasn't like I was late or anything. Fucking bus... I got in to work 5 minutes late, not cool, but I was much more productive today so that kind of made up for it (plus I stayed a little later too). JP had me do some new stuff today (burning CDs, gathering data from discs, etc..) and I even recorded messages for my voice mail... finally (JP had been after me to do that since Friday). I also got to burn a few copies of the demo of covers my band recorded Friday night. I have five extras to hand out now, but they're really more to serve a purpose than for listening pleasure. None of us were very happy with what we recorded, but it's good enough to hand out to club owners and bookers. I ate lunch at work today too. I went down to the cafeteria and got a grilled chicken wrap, which was pretty good. I'd been wanting to try their southwestern grilled chicken wrap, but they were out of the rice so I just had a regular one. I ate at my desk, by myself. I'm tired as hell. I'm going to eat dinner in a few minutes, much earlier than usual. I plan on going to bed around 9pm tonight... I don't know how I'm going to kill time and stay awake until then. (yawn)

Crappy Monday To Me! I had a hell of a time falling asleep last night, I went to bed at 11pm but I didn't fall asleep until a couple (few?) hours later. I got up at 7am, woke up just before the alarm went off. Whatever sleep I got... it just wasn't enough. I got up, got fed, got ready for work, and caught the early bus at 8:15am. I got to work around 8:45am. JP was arriving just as I was punching in. He brought in a copy of 5-song CD we recorded on Friday and it's not as bad as I'd thought. Dan, the engineer/owner of the recording studio, did a very nice job of cleaning the mistakes up and making us sound better than we were. Hopefully JP will be in tomorrow so I can make some copies. JP said he and Dan stayed until 1:30am mixing it and bullshitting. Shortly after JP got to work, he started to get his kidney stone pains again and wound up going home shortly after his day had begun. Since JP left so early on, I was stuck there doing whatever I could remember or figure out for myself. Needless to say, it was a boring ass, unproductive day. Luckily, I brought a case of tapes in with me today and that helped kill some of the boredom. I listened to Frank Zappa's "Joe's Garage" and stuff from Warren Zevon, The Band, Dio, Jeff Beck, and CSN & Y. I brought some batteries in with me too and checked out the portable CD players that were in a drawer there (that former employess had left behind). One didn't work, but one did so it's mine now. Last Friday I took home a cassette player (walkman type) that was there, but alas, it didn't work. I left work at 2:45pm today after my six hours were up, and took the bus home. I hadn't eaten lunch and was hungry so after I got home I cracked open a coconut that Mom had bought me (I'd been jonesing to try one) and proceeded to eat/drink it. Five minutes later, I was puking my brains out in the bathroom sink. Very nice. I don't know what happened, I mean, I love shredded coconut and have never had a problem with it, so why did real coconut kick my ass? Maybe it was the coconut juice... I don't know, but whatever it was, it definitely kicked my ass. Thus, my coconut experiment has ended.

Sunday Happenings I went to bed way too late last night, talking to my sister for a couple hours (very unusual) and staying up to watch "Real Time with Bill Maher". I didn't get to bed until somewhere around 2:15am, and then, after I was in bed, I just could not fall asleep. Grrr!! I was still awake around 5am. I got up around then and set my alarm for 11:15am, not quite enough sleeping time, but I didn't want to get up any later in the day or I'd totally screw my sleep schedule up all over again. I talked to my friend Rob for a while today. He'd called to tell me he bought that new Jimi Hendrix "Axis Outtakes" CD (for $25 from Vinyl Fever over in Tampa). I also talked to JP this afternoon and I told him I'd go and check out that new rehearsal studio near here that we've been thinking about trying out. After I hung up with him, I got showered and Mom and then I ran over there. It wasn't what I'd hoped. It was in an industrial type place, a couple rows of storage unit type buildings and the practice rooms were inside one of them. The first thing I noticed was that there is no sound-proofing... not good. If two bands were in their together, it'd be a sonic mess. In fact, the guy who runs it was mixing a tape of some death metal band in an opposite room and it came through quite clear in the practice room I was standing in (with the door closed even). Secondly, it wasn't set up very well. It's a small rectangle-shaped room, and they had the drums against one of the small walls along with one PA cabinet, and along the longer walls was a bass amp, a small combo amp, and another PA cabinet. The PA head was in the corner. It would have been awkward playing that way, with the drummer in the rear, Al and I almost on the side and JP to the front. It would have made more sense to put the drums against one of the longer walls with a PA cab and an amp on either side of him and the singer in front. Also, the drums didn't sound much better than the ones at Circle and the room was muchg smaller, so basically, the place really had nothing going for it. Pretty disappointing. On the way home, I asked Mom if we could stop at Wendys so I could talk to Barry, one of my old managers there. I invited him to the March 13th gig. I hope he comes, but I doubt he will. After we stopped there, we went over to Goodwill. I'm really glad we did. Books were on sale today 3-for-$1 (paperbacks and hardcovers) so I grabbed a whole bunch. I got six different Anne Rice books: "The Queen Of The Damned", "Servant Of The Bones", "The Mummy", "Vittorio The Vampire" (hardcover) and ""Memnoch The Devil" (hardcover). I also found another Sherlock Holmes book "The Complete Adventures And Memoirs Of Sherlock Holmes" by Arthur Conan Doyle (hardcover), "Alfred Hitchcock Presents: Stories To Stay Awake By" (a hardcover anthology), Tim Allen "Don't Stand Too Close To A Naked Man" (hardcover - I have the paperback of this already, but I loved the book and wanted a nice hardcover). I also got two S.E. Hinton books "Rumble Fish" and That Was Then, This was Now". I remember reading them in school (a long, long time ago) and wanted to re-read them. I figured my sister, niece and/or my older nephew might read them too. I also picked up the unedited version (1,141 pages) of Stephen King's "The Stand". I loved the regular normal version of that book, can't wait to see what got left out. I also found "We Were Soldiers Once... And Young" (the book the movie "We Were Soldiers Once" was based on). I picked up a James Bond book, "Casino Royale" by Ian Fleming. I've never read any James Bond books, nor seen any of the movies all the way through. I picked up a book on speaking German ("Conversational German" for my niece (she took it in school and liked it). Lastly, I pickedup a Consumer reports Buying Guide for 2000 (I needed one more book for the 3-for $1 deal... should've grabbed "Viva MAD" instead). Besides the books, I picked up a padded cassette case for $2 (looked like new), a sealed cassette tape (Little Village's self-titled debut... John Hiatt and Ry Cooder's band) for $0.50, and a wooden paddleball paddle for $0.50 (I broke one when me and Jess played in the "snow" the last time he was down). The total damge for all of that: $8. 57. Not too shabby! I was planning on listing stuff on eBay tonight, but my lack of sleep is catching up to me. I guess I'll list some stuff on Tuesday instead, unless I have band practice that night. Oh! Some more good news for me: when I talked to JP earlier, he said he'll go ahead and let me work 30 hours a week instead of 25... sweet! That's an extra $200 a month! He leaves early tomorrow, so I hope I do ok without him there. He's going to bring in a copy of the CD we recorded Friday night and he said he'll burn me a few copies. I'm going to bring in some cassettes to listen to tomorrow. Everything's going really well for me lately, almost too well... it's scary. I guess I'm just not used to good things happening for me.

Lately I've Been... Listening to: Right now I have Styx's "Caught In The Act" tape on. This week I finally played my new Big Head Todd & The Monsters CD, "Sister Sweetly" (a great album). I've also been rocking out to Black Sabbath's "Master Of Reality" tape (I just got 5 Sabbath tapes in). I couldn't get "Sweet Leaf" out of my mind all day yesterday, killer song. Watching on TV: Not much the last few days, been too busy. Earlier in the week I watched "Everybody Loves Raymond", "Seinfeld", and "King Of Queens", plus "Fear Factor" on Monday. Downloading: Nothing. Reading: I started Stephen King's "Night Shift" about a week ago, but I haven't picked it back up yet. Jamming: We went into the studio last night (and I played horribly) and we're due to practice sometime next week. We may try out that new rehearsal studio around the corner from here (the one that looks like it's in someone's house). I guess we're going to try and line up a gig for February since we have a gig booked for March already (March 13th). With the demo CD done, maybe we'll start playing two gigs a month. Working: Finally! I started a new job working with my longtime friend and bandmate, JP (he's my boss now), and it's going pretty well so far. A lot to learn, but I am willing and able, so it should work out ok. I worked 2 full shifts Thursday and Friday (Thursday with no sleep at all) but next week I'll go down to part-time hours, 5 or 6 hours a day (not sure which yet). Buying: Nothing this week. There were a few auctions I missed due to my sleep problems and some I let go because of financial uncertainty. But, me being the shop-a-holic I am, there are about 30 auctions I'm watching (tape lots and clothes mainly). Selling: I didn't list any auctions last week, but I'm going to list some this week to help me get by until I get a real paycheck on or around Feb.15th. Eating: Mom is on that Atkins diet and that works for me (less "bad stuff" around the house for me to eat). I haven'y drank any soda for a week or so, been drinking a lot more water and my beloved Arizona Ginseng tea. I've been eating oatmeal for breakfast everyday (Maple) and I've been eating a reasonable lunch in the afternoon. For dinner, I skipped it altogether one night and last night just had a small bowl of chili and some crackers. One night Mom made fish (Tilapia) and shrimp, and another night she made pork and rice. We've both been eating better lately. I hope it stays that way, but we always go off track somewhere down the line. Me, I'm pretty set now. I have a band now that plays out in front of people so I have a good reason to want to get healthier and lose weight. I've always been depressed and lonely and not given a shit about myself and it shows. Feeling: Right now, a little tired, slight headache, but ok. Mentally I feel much better. Things are looking more and more up for me and that's a pleasant change. Planning: In February, my main plans are to pay Mom and JP what I owe them (Mom $500, JP $50). Then, in March, I plan on buying an amp, preferably a Fender Hot Rod DeVille 4x10 or maybe a Marshall 2x12 combo. After that, I plan on paying Mom a couple hundred each month again and laying away a 2nd guitar for me (another strat). I need to get my stereo speaker fixed, buy some more work clothes, and get my strat worked on somewhere along the line too.

A Non-Busy Saturday Shortly after I wrote the previous post I went and laid down on the couch. That was around 11am. I got comfortable and wound up sleeping on the couch until about 2pm, a nice little (and much needed) nap. My legs and feet were still sore form all that standing last night at the studio and with working and all (they haven't seen much action in the last several months). Also, during the night, I kept waking up with charlie horses in my calf muscles (both legs) so they were pretty darn sore. I was planning on going up to my sister's today (to watch my nephew's basketball game and pick my niece up), but that got scrapped. We'll have to get together next week. My sister is talking about her and the kids coming down, so that's cool. Hopefully I'll have a paycheck and some money in my pocket then too. I'm thinking we can pick my niece up on Friday night and then she can go back home with my sister on Saturday or Sunday, whenever she comes down. I'm probably going to go and clean my room in a few minutes, it really needs it. But I may just do nothing. It's that kind of day.

A Busy Friday Friday started off pretty bad. I went out at 8:15am to catch the bus that, I thought, went by at 8:30am and I wound up missing it. I saw it coming before I made it to the stop so I started running towards it, waving my arms at the driver, but the asshole went right on by. How do you not see a big running fat guy waving his arms at you from 30-40 feet away? I thought he'd come way too early and hoped he was just way too late and that there'd be another one coming in a few minutes, but neither was true. It seems the one I saw go by at :30 after the other day was a fluke, he was way too early or way too late. I had to walk back home, call JP to tell him I was going to be late... on my second day... and went back out to wait for the next bus. It came around 8:50am and, somehow, I managed to clock in at 9:02am. I think the timeclock must be off a little. I worked by myself most of the day, JP wasn't with me very much. I remembered how to do most everything and only needed to go to him for help a few times, mostly about using Excel, which I've never really used before. It took a while, but I think I have the hang of it... at least for doing the things I needed it to do this day. At lunchtime, JP and I walked down and bought lunch at the cafeteria (I had the BBQ pork sandwich w/ hash browns and coleslaw... the BBQ pork was awesome) and then we split to our own offices again. I ate and looked at eBay then I went back to work after my half hour was up (I had to punch out for lunch today). We left work around 5pm and went to my place to pick up my equipment and studio money ($30) and then we took off for JP's place, loaded his equipment, and then we headed for the recording studio. We got there before anyone else, including Dan, the studio owner. After he arrived, we brought everything inside and started setting up. Al arrived next, followed by Jimmy. I thought we'd be eating dinner at the English pub next door or at least having a drink there, but we didn't. I was hungry for some fish and chips too, but we just didn't have the time. The studio itself was really nice and Dan did a great job of making us sound better than we actually were (he really knows his stuff). The only thing I didn't like was the "room" I was in, which was really a small closet. There was no A/C in the closet and then I had lights shining down on me... I felt like a rotisserie chicken. It was hot, cramped, and uncomfortable. I think that had a part in why I was playing so awfully, which I was. My hands started sweating a lot, I was stumbling back on the mic stand for the amp, and at one point, my wrist started hurting badly. I was making mistakes I never make, ever, on almost every single song we did. Same with all of the other guys... it was weird. My rhythm is usually rock solid, but I went out of rhythm several times, during solos even. I wasn't real happy with most of what I played, I definitely could've done better, but with the time constraints and the recording costs and all, I had to let it go, after all, it's just a demo of covers for club owners to hear. We did "Feelin' Alright", "Stuck In The Middle", "Wild Night", "Love The One You're With", Cold Shot", "Steal My Kisses" (which I think Dan chucked), and one of JP's originals, "Sleeping Forever". I think we all were pretty unhappy with most of what we played, but like I said, Dan cleaned a lot of it up in the mix, so overall, it sounded ok. I left around 11:30pm with Al, Jimmy split then too, and JP stayed behind with Dan and his assistant, Hank. I think we only paid for 7:30-10:30, so Dan stayed late and worked on the mix for us free of charge, which was really nice of him to do. He never said anything about and and and actually seemed to be enjoying what he was doing, so that was cool. I was hoping to have a CD to take home with me, but no luck. I'll have to get a copy from JP on Monday. Al and I talked about music all the way home. Mom was still up when I got in. I sat in front of the PC for a while, then went and had a bowl of chili, my dinner, around Midnight. I hit the sack shortly after, laying in bed figuring out how I'll spend my paychecks, from January to June. JP said I may be working 30 hours a week rather than 25, which would be great. A bit later, I fell asleep.

Sleepworking My last-minute plan to stay at home today didn't pan out. I called JP this morning to tell him that I hadn't slept last night and that I didn't want to start work until Monday now, but he told me he already told his boss I'd be starting today, and since I didn't want to make him look bad with his boss, I went in and worked from 9 to 5. Well, more like 9:15am to 4:45pm (JP was late picking me up and we left early). It was a hectic day there, they were having a lot of phone problems, technical stuff and there was a loud buzzing in my office all day. Other than that, it was a pretty easy day. The work isn't hard, but there is a lot, and I do mean a lot , to learn. It's totally different than any job I've ever had before. I was always used to working hard, staying busy, but there was a lot of sitting and waiting today. JP assured me that the more I learned the busier I'd be, which is good for me (makes time go by faster). I work in my own little office there, complete with two desks and two computers. I share office space with PC and phone connections for the whole company but they're pretty much out of my way. I'm really the only one in there, which is just fine with me, though JP was with me most of the day today. I don't know how long he'll be doing that, a while I'd guess (since there's so much to learn still). We went out for lunch together too, on the clock (he told me not to worry about punching out). We went over to this decent Chinese buffet on East Bay where they have some awesome Crab Rangoon. I was going to eat a baloney sandwich for lunch today, but because I decided I wasn't going to work today, I never made one (and then I went into work anyway). We ate and talked about the band and the job. It was cool. I worked until 4:45 today, so Mom picked me up on her way home. I'm supposed to work late tomorrow too, and then JP and I are heading to the recording studio right after work. We'll be there til at least 10:30pm, probably later, so I'd damn well better get some sleep tonight. I think I'l go insane if I don't... for real. Last night was just too much, just too frustrating.

Self-Sabotage I'm supposed to be sleeping right now, but I'm not. I went to bed at 10:30pm last night, and here it is 7 hours later and I still haven't been asleep yet. My mind just won't shut down, I keep thinking about the new job, about money, about time, and to make matters worse, I have that Outkast song, "Hey Ya", stuck in my head, playing over and over. I also had a problem getting comfortable again, tossing and turning all night long, and feeling way too warm, especially my head and neck (I need a Chillow). I'm a fucking mess. JP is supposed to pick me up at 8:30 this morning and I don't know if I should call him and tell him I won't be able to start today or wait until he gets here. I'm going to tell/ask him to start me on Monday, so I'll have enough time to get into the habit of going to bed early and getting up early. He won't be happy, and understandably so. He's already doing me a huge favor by giving me the job and I'm re-paying him by being a pain in the ass. I don't want to start off a new job by going in on my first day without any sleep, especialy if I'm going to work a full shift, which I haven't done for several years now. I think it'd be a bad idea and a bad way to start off there. I'm pretty pissed off about this. I mean, there was no reason for it. I did it to myself, for no reason whatsoever. I went to bed early enough, I was tired, but I just could not shut myself down and fall asleep. It's extremely frustrating. I wanted to scream a few times just from the pure frustration of it all. So... my plan now is to just stay up all day today, tire myself the fuck out, and go to sleep at a normal time like a normal person. I figure if I can get up on Friday at 7:30am and go to be before 11pm, and do the same all weekend, by Monday I'll be back on track and the insomnia problem should be lessened some because I've started a proper sleeping pattern. The stress of starting the job should be off me for a few days too, which should help in getting to sleep at night. I have nothing else planned for today anyway, so I guess it'd be as good a day as any to try and do it.

In Other News... Since JP's feeling better, we're going to proceed into the studio on Friday after all. That'll be another first for me and I'm looking forward to it a great deal. We're just going to cut a demo of covers so we'll have something to give club owners, but it's still pretty exciting to me. The place we played the other night booked us again for mid-March. We're going to play two 45-minute sets that night for $200. That's what we got paid for the 1-hour set and we brought in a lot of people that night (over 50), many of whom had very large bar tabs. It seems like the owner is being cheap with us, JP thinks so too, so we're going to be looking for different, hopefully, better-paying, venues to play. It'd be different if we didn't bring a crowd with us, but we do, and he makes a lot of money off our crowd, so there should be some reciprocation. Yes, I said "reciprocation".

Tomorrow I talked to JP this afternoon, he's feeling better, so I will start work tomorrow. He said he'll probably keep me there for a full shift the next two days because of the lost time this week. That'll be good for my paycheck though I don't know how well I'm going to hold up (not having worked a full shift for several years ). Plus, I'm still not sleeping well at night still (I went to bed around Midnight last night but didn't fall asleep until sometime after 4am), so I'll likely be pretty tired too. He's going to pick me up for work tomorrow, but then I will start taking the 8:30am bus to work. He said I answer to him there and he doesn't care if I am a few mninutes late for work every now and then. I'd told him that I wasn't sure how close I'd cut it with that bus because of having to cross the road (a very busy, congested road) and then having to walk a block or two to work. We'll see how it goes. If it doesn't work, I'll just take the earlier bus or ride with Mom. It looks like I'll need to take a lunch to work too. I'll make a baloney sammich and maybe some chips. A Long Night, But A Good One Well, the gig went very, very well. We brought in about 50 people and those people drank a lot, so we got paid $200 for the gig. My sister and brother-in-law (Danny) came and they brought 4 people with them, including Richard (Danny's step-brother) and his wife. My sister got drunk and became super talkative. I wish I could've left with her and Danny, they were heading over to another bar and she said she was going to do karaoke! I would have loved to have seen that! Before we went on, I got to say hi to an old friend, Jim Fagan, from way back. I used to jam with him when I was first starting out on guitar. He drums for the band that we opened for. After we were done, while he was setting his kit up, he told me that we sounded good, which was very cool of him to say. It meant a lot to me because he played with me when I wasn't very good. I also got to hang out a little with my friend Rob after our set. He didn't get there until the band that followed us was on (he worked late). It was his 50th birthday tonight. I was looking for one other person tonight, who never showed up, and whose ass I shall now have to kick. Here's the setlist we played: Love The One You're With The Old Apartment Promise You The Moon (an original) Steal My Kisses Hanging By A Moment Circle (an original) Had A Girl (an original) Feelin' Alright Cold Shot Sleeping Forever (an original) Stuck In The Middle Wild Night Rock This Town I Wanne Be Sedated Encore: You Can't Run (an original) I was worried bigtime going into the gig tonight because my guitar wouldn't stay tuned at practice (I'd put new strings on it). I had to tune up between almost every song. I think we did pretty good overall though, we were definitely a lot looser than last time and it was more fun. I made a few boo-boos here and there, nothing major though. The crowd was great, they were really there for us, dancing and everything, and being very vocal. In fact, they were so vocal, that after we finished our set and the club owner was thanking us, the crowd wouldn't chill out until we were allowed to play one more song. One guy yelled "let them play one more song you asshole!" Too funny! Everyone said we sounded great and we got a ton of compliments. In fact, too many compliments. I'm not used to that at all. I said "thank you" and "that's good to hear" a lot. I guess I need to work on small talk more, because after I've said "thank you" and "that's good to hear", and the person is still standing there, waiting, it gets kind of awkward. One sucky thing about tonight, when the owner paid us, he mentioned something about how the place cleared out after we finished, like it was a reason not to pay us more. We did our job, got the people in there and drinking and kept them throughout our set. I thought the band we opened for was supposed to draw an even bigger crowd or at least hold the crowd there (they're a very popular band around here and they usually have quite a following). JP was not happy about what the owner said, not at all. He thought we should have gotten $250 for the gig. I've decided, for the most part, to stay out of the financial arrangements, since I would play for free, so I'm happy with what I got. After we cleared out of there, JP wanted to go over to New York, New York, where his wife went after we finished. I thought it'd be best if he took me home first, but he headed on over there anyway. His wife wound up getting shit-faced drunk and had to be taken home immediately. I wound up riding with them up to their place, stopping for puke breaks along the way (hers). After we got there, she crashed on the couch and wouldn't move. JP wanted to watch DVDs with me (I was going to crash there), but she had the couch in front of the TV. He decided to take me home after a little while. I felt bad about that. I hate not having a car and I hate inconveniencing people because of it. I finally got home about 3:30am. "The Shining" I've seen the movie version of Stephen King's "The Shining" many, many times over the years (I even own the DVD now) and it's always been a favorite (the Jack Nicholson version, I haven't seen the other yet). Since I liked the movie so much, I've been wanting to read King's book (for a while now), and last night, I finally finished reading it. I enjoyed reading the book, but having seen the movie so many times, it was eaier to pick out faults I found with the book. For one, there are some things that I found almost silly, like the animal-shaped hedges that move and attack, but also the whole premise of the actual hotel itself trying to kill people just seemed like nonsense to me. Also, I thought the whole "Horace Derwent" element was very anti-climactic and I didn't think it was reasonable for "Wendy" to let her son go off with a strange man she'd just met an hour before and sit in his car with him for 5-10 minutes. Seemed out-of-character to me, but I guess that's just nit-picking. More nit-picking: I really couldn't visualize the characters in the book as they were written, because of the movie. For instance, "Wendy" is supposed to be a blonde, but I saw dark-haired Shelley Duvall the whole time. And Nicholson, and Scatman Crothers, and the kid from the movie... On the bright side, the characters in the book are much better defined, you get more pre-hotel insight into their lives, Danny is expanded upon even more (as is Tony) and is made to be the central figure in the story, as he should be. The book held my attention throughout, was never boring, and there were several parts of the book that actually sent chills up my spine too, which is rare for a book. I think I like the movie ending better, with the chase through the maze (which wasn't in the book), but the first half of the book is better (where you learn more about Jack's past and it's focused more on Danny). I'd highly recommend this book to anyone who hasn't seen the movie yet.

About 3/4 of the way through the book, I felt like King went off track with the story (the part where Johhny Smith meets Jimmy Carter was especially lame to me), though he did get back on track with the last part. I thought the movie did a much better job of keeping things clear and focused throughout. I also thought the book handled Frank Dodd's death better; the movie had him jam a pair of scissors into his mouth... seemed like a pretty stupid and unlikely way to die (it was the one false note I felt with the movie). I don't know if I'd recommend this book or not. It is pretty good, but it wanders a bit too much.

Tuesday Happenings After Midnight, Monday night, I started reading Stephen King's "The Dead Zone" in bed. I got through 3 or 4 chapters before I tried to crash (around 2:15am). Instead, I wound up tossing and turning a lot and didn't fall asleep until very, very late (or very, very early, depending on how you look at it), probably around 5 or 6am. I thought I'd wind up sleeping all day to make up for it, but I was up by 11:30am. Needless to say, I've been tired and dragging all day. I made a "to do" list last night before I went to bed and I tackled most of it today. I did my laundry (still have to fold it), started getting my eBay mailings ready (I need to package them tonight), I cut up some of the cushion/pillows on the couch outside and got it out to the curb, I tried changing the latch on the porch door (the new one doesn't fit, I need to try something different tomorrow), I changed the cat litter, and I practiced guitar (off and on all day, probably got about 2 hours in). While practicing, I finally settled on the way to play "Feelin' Alright" (my own rhythm style) and I also came up with a different way of playing the rhythm on "Steal My Kisses". I think they went over well (no one complained). It wasn't a very fun practice tonight, we really didn't do any jamming (that's what I consider "fun"), but we got a lot done. We ran through the set list JP and I put together last night (after the first one I put together got rejected) and then we worked on some of the individual songs, tightening up parts, getting on the same page with things. We wound up cutting one of the songs from the set list, and then after practice, after Jimmy had a problem with the newest set list, we sat around and re-wrote it again. We're good to go now. We're going to practice next Friday before our gig, and then, the following Friday, we are going into the studio to record a demo (5 covers for club owners/bookers). It's good to see things progressing like they are. It's been a long time since I started playing and it's good to be on the right track after all these years.

urlLink Monday Mission 4.0 (The End) 1. In the last week, what happened that made you feel loved beyond your wildest dreams? Not a damned thing. 2. What was the last audio CD you paid money for? "The Essential Bruce Springsteen", a 3-CD set. 3. Has someone you know ever told you they had a terminal illness? What was it like for you when you found out. How did that change your relationship with them? Luckily, that hasn't happened to me. 4. Do you have an accent? Are there any phrases or words you say that tip folks that you aren't from around these parts? I used to when I first moved down here (from Pennsylvania), but I was put in speech classes in elementary school and they eliminated it. Like most of my family from PA., I'd say "wooder" instead of "water", stuff like that. 5. What's the difference between being a Father, and being a Daddy? Nothing, it's just semantics. The word "father" seems to refer more to someone who is stern, distant, less loving, and the word "daddy" seems to refer more to someone who is easy-going, friendly, and loving, but they really mean the same thing. 6. What is the most recent thing guilt has motivated you to do? Guilt? I don't think I've done anything motivated by guilt. I can't even remember the last time I did. 7. How do you feel about tips and tipping? Do you feel obligated to tip even if your service is bad because you know the servers don't get paid much? If you've ever relied on tips for your income, how do you feel when you don't get any? I think tipping is stupid. I hate the practice. Restaurants should pay their employees the same as any other businesses. Why should the customers, who are already paying for their meal or room or whatever, also have to pay the wages (or part of the wages) of the employees of the restaurant, bars or hotels? It doesn't seem fair to the customer. And yes, I do tip. Just because I don't agree with the practice doesn't mean I ignore it. Bad service will get you a smaller tip, horrendous service will get you none.

We played Badminton for a long time, until it started getting dark out. Me, my sister and Sean played against the other kids, but we didn't keep score or anything (none of us knew the rules), we just played for fun. Jess and Austin kept arguing the whole time. Jesse was the problem, not letting Austin take a swing and just acting up and not listening. He had been just fine the whole time he was alone with Mom and I, but as soon as his family showed up, he started being a baby. After it got dark, we cleaned up the yard and went in to eat (Mom had ordered pizza and wings). Jesse started complaining about the food right off the bat. It's like he's not happy unless his Mom is yelling at him. Austin was being jerky all day too, but in a differnt way. He's sniffing and snorting like he has a terrible cold or sinus problems, which he doesn't have. He's doing it for attention and/or sympathy and it's extremely annoying. I think he and Jess are basically doing the same thing. After dinner, I tried playing with Dana's puppy, but Austin wouldn't let me. He had to have the dog's attention too. Soon, he and Jess started playing with him together and then the arguing started up again. Dana had enough of it and went in, I followed after a bit too, after I'd told them that they're acting like idiots. As I was going in, Austin followed, which I thought was odd, and then I heard Jess crying on the porch: Austin had thrown a tennis ball at his face and hit him in the eye. I went in and scolded Austin, again. They're ridiculous. They should be having a fun time, instead they act like assholes. I don't get it. No Rest For The Wicked I slept like crap again last night. My mind just isn't shutting down and going into "sleep mode" like it should. Thursday Jam I slept horribly last night, so when it came time to get up, I just wasn't ready. I re-set my alarm to get an extra 15 minutes of sleep, but then Mom called for me to get up right as I was drifting off again. I still made it in to work as usual though. Work was fairly uneventful. I stayed busy and got as much done as I could. There were a few things I was waiting for that never arrived, so I'll do those tomorrow, no biggie. I rode with JP over to the Egg Platter to get lunch today. I got the Steak Caesar salad and some onion rings... it was awesome! They give you a big portion too. I'll have to eat there again sometime. I left around 3:45pm, got home around 4:15pm, and was in bed, trying to nap around 4:30pm. I never did get any sleep, and I got up at 6:15pm feeling totally unrefreshed. I ate dinner and waited for JP to arrive. he got here late, at nearly 7pm, the time we're supposed to be at band practice. Practice went well tonight, for the most part. My lead playing sucked pretty bad. I just feel like my lead playing is weak, too repetitive, and I'm just so freaking slow... I really need to start practing again, daily. I haven't even picked up my electric guitar since last Thursday's practice. It didn't help any that the amp I used tonight (the Randall) sounded shitty (too much bottom end). I couldn't even get feedback when I wanted it. We ran through the newer additions again tonight ("What's So Funny About Peace, Love, & Understanding", "Desire", "I'm Tore Down"), as well as going over some older songs, originals ("There For Me", "Everyday", "Sleeping Forever", etc..) and covers ("Authority Song", "The Way", etc..). We also jammed a few times tonight, some long ones, some short ones. One of the longer jams was basically "I'm Tore Down", but a little different. We jammed on that one mainly to get JP used to playing the Blues (he needs help with his Blues rhythm playing). We jammed on a reggae-like tune and a disco (!) tune too. After we played "Authority Song", I suggested trying that one reggae style (mostly as a joke, but I thought it could actually work). It sounded pretty good, believe it or not. We may do it half and half the next time, start it normal and then end it reggae after the acapella part. A little later, from out of nowhere, Jimmy suggested trying "Badge". Al knew it, showed me and JP the chords, and we ran through that once or twice. It sounded pretty good. It looks like we will be adding that one on to our set list too... sweet! And I didn't think Jimmy even knew any Cream! I am really beginning to enjoy the covers we're choosing as of late. We are going to work on "The Breakup Song" and "Should I Stay Or Should I Go" next. In fact, we ran through "The Breakup Song" tonight to see how much of it we actually knew (very little, unfortunately). It was a very loose, fun, productive practice. We're booked again for next Thursday. If I'm lucky, I will have my new tuner (Boss TU-2) by then (which I'm going to buy this weekend on eBay).

A Semi-Sucky Day As usual, I slept like crap again last night. I just can't get the temperature right; it's either too hot or too cold in my room. I can never find "just right". I laid there in bed, with the alarm/radio blasting , for 40 minutes this morning. I managed to catch the bus and get to work on time (well, almost: 9:01am). Unfortunately though, I had no time for a shower. JP was in today and he gave me another project to work on, which wound up taking almost all day to do (and I'm still not completely finished with it). At some point in the day, I wound up in his office arguing with him about his wife and the t-shirt situation. The way he sees it, the band isn't entitled to any profits off the shirts unless the band helps pay for the shirts. I explained that the shirt seller, in this case, his wife, makes back the cost of the shirts in the price of the shirts along with a profit that should be split between the seller and the band (for using the band's name and image to sell the shirts)... a basic liscensing agreement. He doesn't see it that way at all. It got pretty tense after a while. We agreed to discuss it further with the other guys, to see how they felt about it, so tomorrow night should be interesting. I also let JP know that we'll probably have to stop using the image we've been using on flyers, t-shirts and on my CD cover designs. The photographer, I discovered, has his photos in galleries and is a real artist, making art for art's sake, so I doubt he'd grant us usage to promote our band. JP may try and contact him and ask anyway. I guess it wouldn't hurt. In the same vein, we decided that we need to copyright the band's name or logo, or look into it and see what we can do. I don't think we can actually trademark a name though, and if we do, who is the copyright holder? I came up with the name for the band, but JP has used it the longest. This brings up even more questions. For example, do the other guys in the band have a right to the name? What if we copyright it with all four band members and one leaves; does the departing member still have rights of usage? It's all pretty complicated. It's also stuff we really don't have to worry about too much right now, I mean, we've only played out a few times together, but it will be stuff we will have to figure out down the road. After the arguing died down, we decided to go out for lunch... at Carmelita's! JP's wife met us over there and we took a long ass lunch (about an hour and twenty minutes). I had the Chiles Relleno Con Carne w/ Rice again... a little spicier than last time, but very, very good. No soda this time though, just water (I haven't had a soda since last Thursday). After we finished eating, JP brought up the t-shirt issue, tip-toeing around it and not really pointing fingers, but it was clear that it was going to be a sore spot with his wife. She just doesn't believe that the band's name is worth anything, but it has to be if she expects people to buy the shirts. I hope the other guys actually care about this issue, because it's driving me batty, and frankly, I'd like to see it end being an issue in my life. Who needs extra bullshit in their lives? I stayed later to make up for the long lunch and didn't get out of work until 4:45pm. Tomorrow is going to be a busy day too. I usually have a post-it page full of stuff to do the next day, but today I have two pages full of stuff, plus a pile of stuff on the side. Whew!

Alone Again I slept like crap again last night. The T-Shirt problem (JP's wife is planning on selling my band's T-Shirts at our shows and keeping all of the profit for herself) has been weighing heavy on my mind, making it hard for me to settle down and fall asleep. I was planning on talking to JP about it at work today, but he never came in (he's still dealing with kidney stones). Unfortunately, that meant I was left alone again to deal with even more problems that I haven't been trained to handle yet. It's always something, every single day, with the sales floor. The manager over there panics too much. He tells me that suddenly all of the phones are no longer working, that they can't get an outside line, and so I have to try and figure out how to fix the problem. Turns out, they can never use an outside line on the sales floor to call local numbers, it's a rule they have to prevent people from chatting with friends instead of working. The manager should have known that, but instead of stopping and thinking, he panics and calls for help. Right before that he had another problem, a computer problem, and he calls me to fix it (like the less than two weeks of training I received on doing reports and other paperwork has made me a master programmer). I had to get the computer tech guy to fix it, which the sales manager could have done himself, rather than getting me involved. I guess the guy I replaced knew a lot about phones and computers, but for crying out loud, give me a chance to learn before you start throwing everything at me! I did get a lot of work done today though, so that's good. I caught up several daily reports, learned how to do a new one (JP called me this morning), and I even finished mapping the offices/going under tables to get numbers off of phone/computer connections. My knees and back aren't happy about it, but at least it's done with. I've really earned my pay the last couple days.

A Rough One I wanted to call in sick very badly today. I didn't sleep all that well last night, my legs were still aching, and my tongue, ears, and head still hurt too. But I went on in anyway, dreading the day. The first thing I did was to finish going under the tables in the sales area, getting numbers off the phone box. She said there was no report for Friday because we made no calls that day, something JP should've known. That's the second time he's made me call someone and I wind up looking like an ass. Sunday, So Far I woke up this morning, cold, thinking I'd slept past Noon, possibly even after 2pm, but it was only around 10:45am. My legs are still very, very sore. I also need to take out the trash and change the cat litter, clean the kitchen and dining room, vacuum the house, break down the old couch in the yard and put the pieces in the trash, clean the porch, fix the screen on the porch, fold and put away my clothes, clean my bathroom, and cut the cat's nails. But I don't feel like doing anything but sleeping, and as I said, that is the one thing I should not be doing. Sundays...

Soreness Rough day at work today. I had to crawl under about 100 different tables today to get ID numbers off phone jacks. Band Practice Well, I laid down for a nap, but I never got one. By the time I was actually ready to sleep, the alarm went off. I guess the short rest I got was enough though, because I played pretty well at practice, which was a lot looser, and better, than last week's. We ran through the new songs we're adding to our setlists, "What's So Funny About Peace, Love & Understanding", "Desire" (which turned out really well), "I'm Tore Down", and "I Got Loaded". The first two turned out really good, but the last two need work, mainly JP's rhythm guitar playing (he's never really been schooled in Blues/Rythm & Blues playing). I finally figured out the guitar part to the Costello song, which had been confounding me for a while now. We also ran through ELO's "Don't Bring Me Down" and the Clash's "Should I Stay Or Should I Go", both of which may be added to our setlists eventually. I'm really liking the direction we're heading with the covers we're choosing, avoiding the more obvious covers. We jammed a little bit as well, and Al put a bass line to my old-time blues song that I came up with at the studio last month. We did a couple of JP's originals and I changed part of the bassline, drums and structure of his song "We Don't Need Much". It sounds much tighter and alive now. Everyone seemed to think so too. We still need to figure out a better intro to the drum solo though. We practice again next Thursday, and I think JP and/or Jimmy is going to look into getting us in at Boomers for open mic night. They think it may help us get booked there, which, they say, would be a very good thing. I've never been there, so I don't know much about the place. I got home around 10:40pm, ate a salad for supper (I don't think I've ever done that before), and typed out this post. I'm going to bed now. It's late and I have to up at 7:30am. Mom picked me up some Nyquil tonight, so hopefully I'll sleep well.

Waiting On My Ride Whew! Yesterday was hectic at work. I wound up staying late too, until 6:15pm. It's supposed to be pretty rough today too. Strange Days Man... things are going good for me, almost too good, and it's freaking me out. I'm just not used to success in any way, shape, or form. I keep thinking something's gotta give, the good times can't last forever... can they? Right now, I have a good job, paying me more money per hour than I've ever made at any other job... ever. I enjoy the work and I'm learning a lot of useful stuff, plus it's very stress free and laid back. I have a band that is actually doing something. We had a paying gig in January, and are booked for another paying gig in March, plus we recorded a demo in a real recording studio last month. We'll also be heading into the studio again, within the next few months, to record a full-length album. By June, I should have my own amplifier (a real one, not a practice amp like I have now), a second guitar (a nice new one which may have a Floyd Rose tremelo installed on it), my gateway bill should be paid off entirely, and I won't owe anyone but Mom and the Student Loan folks. By June, I should be beginning to pay off extra on both of those. I can't believe how well things are going for me. My life has never been so good, it's really strange to me. Not that I'm not glad that things are the way they are right now, I'm very glad, but I'm also worried that it's all just a fluke, that it isn't going to last. I'm trying like hell to make sure I don't sabotage it myself, like I usually do. I'm getting up and going to work even when I'm tired from not sleeping at night and I'm staying at work even when I don't feel very well. I'll be damned if I'm letting the good times go without a fight. The only thing that doesn't seem to be going my way is my weight, which I'm still struggling with. However, I am eating better (and less) than I was this time last year, drinking more water and less soda, so I am trying. Only time will tell if I'm actually making any progress there. I guess Jim Morrison said it best when he sang: "I've been down so goddamned long, that it looks like up to me". I'm just not very familiar or comfortable with happiness, but I'm trying to befriend it and I'm hoping it won't go away anytime soon.

Full-Time Today I officially started working full-time at my job. I haven't had a full-time job for about four or five years. It's been a long, long time. It'll be nice to have benefits and 40-hour paychecks again. Heck, I may even get a little bit of overtime here and there. I didn't sleep real well last night and I wound up staying in bed too long this morning. I missed my bus again and got in to work about 20 minutes late. It was ok though, no one ever says anything about tardiness and I always make up the lost time by staying later. I've always been hit and miss in the punctuality department but I've always had bosses who were sticklers for being on time, so this is a nice change for me. It's not all nice though, for instance, the communications at my job are awful. I spent a lot of time the past couple of weeks looking for the best deals on headsets, doing research on the internet and dealing with vendors. I finally got the best deal available, $60 each, which includes shipping costs (they sell for as much as $125 not including any shipping costs). I filled out the requisition form like I was supposed to do and I turned it into my supervisor (JP) and he turned it into his supervisor only to be told that they can't afford to buy them right now ("try us again in a month"). It would have been nice to have known that they weren't interested in buying anything beforehand, but nobody bothered to pass that on to JP or me or to the managers out on the sales floor who keep asking for new headsets almost every day. I guess with that place, the key is just to adapt and go with the flow, which is tough for me because I would rather get things running right rather than to continue doing things wrong just because it's easier. It's a bit of a dilemma for me. I got a lot done today, all my usual stuff, plus I had to hook up headsets for one of the "departments", and later on, I spent a couple of hours cleaning, testing, and logging phones. I have enough to do all week, plenty of phones left to clean, test, and log, but I'll bet that by next week, I'll be spending a couple hours a day just reading manuals. Pretty boring stuff. At least I have pleanty of music to listen to there. I brought in about 42 more tapes today. I have over 100 tapes on my desk (in 4 cases). I need to buy a nice player for them. I'm using an old one-speaker Panasonic tape pleyer right now. I spent a little time organizing my tapes today, I have more to do tomorrow (trying to alphabetize them all). I got my 80-tape lot in today too. Most are ok, but there are about 8 that have the felt pice off or missing. Some were tapes that I'd really wanted, like Pete Townshend's "All The Best Cowboys Have Chinese Eyes". Dammit. I have about 100 tapes set aside that need that felt piece now. What a pain in the ass job that is. "Fear Factor" is coming on now, so I guess I'm going to go watch that. Speaking of TV, last night's episode of "The Sopranos" was pretty darn good (I'm disappointed Feech is gone though, they always get rid of the best characters), but next week's looks like it's going to be awesome! I can't wait!

Tiredness I didn't get to sleep last night until sometime after 4am. I had gone to bed long before that, but then I started getting an upset stomach and wound up sitting in the bathroom for a while. Surprisingly, I was out of bed before Noon. The boys were already up when I got up, Mom had gone to church. We were all pretty sore and tired from yesterday. We just sat around watching TV for a bit, then, after we ate, we went to my room, layed in bed, and looked at pictures in my book on North America wildlife (plants and animals). After that, we headed outdoors again. We played badminton some, but it was pretty hot out there and we didn't last too long. We went back inside again and I hooked up my old Nintendo and the boys played "Super Mario" for a while. After they got bored with that, we went out back and shot the BB gun at a grapefruit. After they got tired of that, we played with the football for a while, and then after they got tired of that, we played catch with those plastic hai alai-type plastic ball and scoop things. We started getting hungry, so we went inside to see if Mom could take us to Checkers. I wound up arguing with her for putting on Veggie Tales while the boys were here (her way, I think, of putting some Jesus in their lives... just what they need). We all rode over to Checkers and we decided to eat there. The highlight of that trip was watching some guy pick his nose. He'd pulled up into the parking lot and started going to town on his nostrils. Because the dining room windows were tinted, he couldn't see that we were sitting there watching him the whole time. The boys were laughing their asses off. After we got back, Jesse went back to Mom's room, got on her computer and started drawing and painting stuff. Austin sat out here with me and wanted me to show him and teach him stuff about the universe. I drew out a diagram of our solar system and explained how it worked and then I showed him how galaxies were made up of solar systems, and explained that the universe was made up of galaxies. I tried to show him how vast the universe is, how there were more planets out there than the 9 (or 10) in our own solar system, and how far everything is from here. I think he understood a lot of what I was saying, which was cool. They both just headed home with their grandma about 15 minutes ago. It was a fun weekend, but man, am I beat! I think I'm going to lay on the couch and chill out the rest of the night. I'll watch "The Sopranos" at 9pm, and then I'll probably head to bed after that. That's the plan anyhow.

Birthday Stuff I got up early, around 9:20am, and immediately resumed cleaning house. I vacuumed my room and bathroom, cleaned the kitchen floor and cat litter area, cleaned my bathroom, took out more trash, cleaned off the kitchen table a bit, swept the porch clean and then washed the table and chairs out there. All this, and all the cleaning I did all week, mainly because I was expecting my friend Sue over and I wanted the place to be comfortable and presentable for her (seeing that she's a chick and chicks tend to like cleanliness). Anyhow, that worked out real well... she never showed. I'm not real happy about that either, not only because I didn't get any kind of communication saying "I guess I'm not going to make it after all", but also because my sister went and bought extra steaks and stuff because I told them she and JP (my two best friends) would be joining us. Grrrr!!!!!! To make matters worse, my sister showed up three hours late herself, and then JP didn't show up until almost dark, long after dinner, but at least he did come over. Hell, he even stayed until almost Midnight. So... the day got off to a rocky start, but it did get better. My sister, her husband, and the kids got here right around 2pm. Danny (my brother-in-law) brought his gas grill with him (he gave it to us) and I helped him unload it, then him and my sister helped me set up the badminton net. Mom had been busy cooking all day. She made a ton of food: potato salad, rum cake, pineapple upside-down cake, deviled eggs, baked beans, etc... and a little after everyone arrived, she and my sister ran out to the store, Danny left to visit some friends in the park, so I took the kids outside and we played badminton for about 45 minutes then we went in for a water break and a rest. It was hot out, but there was a nice breeze blowing all day which made the heat semi-bearable. While we were inside, I remembered to check an eBay auction I was watching and I just caught it before it ended. Luckily, I got my bid in on time and I won it, another huge ass lot of cassette tapes, 268 in all, plus it comes with three 100-count Napa Valley wooden storage cases, which sell on eBay for around $20-$30 each by themselves. I got everything for a total of $62.01. Some of the better tapes in the lot are: AC/DC "Live" (2-tape set), "Let There Be Rock", "Powerage", "Highway To Hell", "If You Want Blood You Got It", "'74 Jailbreak", "Flick Of THe Switch", "Blow Up Your Video", & "Ballbreaker", Alice Cooper "Billion Dollar Babies", Black Sabbath "Black Sabbath", "Sabbath, Bloody Sabbath", "Vol. 4", "Paranoid/Heaven and Hell" (2-on-1), "Sabotage", and "Mob Rules", Dio "Holy Diver", Deep Purple "When We Rock We Rock And When We Roll We Roll", The Doors "L.A. Woman", "Morrison Hotel", "Strange Days", Eagles "Hotel California", Faith No More "The Real Thing", Iron Maiden "The Number Of The Beast", "No Prayer For The Dying", "Piece Of Mind", "Fear Of The Dark", & "Killers", Jethro Tull "Minstrel In The Gallery", "Thick As A Brick", & "Aqualung", KISS "Love Gun", The Kinks "The Kink Kronikles", "One For The Road", & "Tired Of Waiting For You", Led Zeppelin "The Song Remains The Same" (2-tape set), Metallica "Master Of Puppets" & "Ride The Lightning", Nazareth "Hot Tracks", Ted Nugent "Double Live Gonzo", Ozzy Osbourne "Bark At The Moon", "The Ultimate Sin", "Diary Of A Madman", & Ozzy Osbourne/Randy Rhoads "Tribute", Robert Plant "Pictures At Eleven", Pink Floyd "The Dark Side Of The Moon" & Wish You Were Here", Pantera "Cowboys From Hell", Tom Petty "Into The Great Wide Open", The Ramones "Ramones Mania", Scorpions "Best Of Rockers And Ballads", Twisted Sister "Come Out And Play" & "Stay Hungry", T Rex "Electric Warrior", The Who "Meaty Beaty Big & Bouncy", Yes "The Yes Album" & "Close To The Edge". Wow! Great titles! And those are just the ones I need, there are a ton that I will take to work too (more AC/DC, more Led Zeppelin, more Iron Maiden, etc...). I can only hope that they'll arrive in great condition though, there was no scan and the seller didn't describe condition much more than a few cracked cases. I won't be able to pay for them until next week though (because of my screwed up payday), so, sadly, it'll be a few weeks before I actually get them. We wound up playing my "Who wants To Be A Millionaire" PC game for awhile, then, after everyone came back, Danny started cooking the steaks (huge, and I mean HUGE porterhouse steaks plus a couple delmonicos), burgers and hot dogs, and we all played badminton some more, until the food was ready. Mom taped some of the "game" with her new video camera (the one JP sold her). We all chowed down... big time. My steak was marinated with Stavros' sauce (Mom got some extra last time she was there) and it was awesome. I was stuffed. I also had some potato salad and some baked beans. Some Pepsi too, a rarity anymore. We've got a ton of leftovers, so I know what I'll be eating all day tomorrow. After dinner, we all went back outside and played badminton some more. Jesse kept hitting the birdie up on the roof and Austin kept hitting it over the fence, so there were several trips up on the roof and over in the neighbor's yard throughout the day. In fact, one of my good birdies is over in her back yard right now. They need to get it tomorrow, before she throw it in the garbage. She wouldn't think to just throw it back over the fence, she never has done that, which is why, long , long ago, she earned the nickname "Haggy". Eventually, the sun started heading down and it got nice and cool outside and everyone was having a really fun time playing badminton. It was nice. JP finally pulled up around then. He'd called twice today, both times saying he'll be over soon, but by the time he'd gotten there, we'd already eaten and it was getting dark out. He joined us playing badminton and then after it was dark out, the game got much more difficult to play, but we had fun trying. Danny turned his heasdlights on and that helped out a little, but finally, we had to give it up for the day. We played football instead. JP and Austin vs. Danny and Jesse with me quartebacking for both teams. We played that for a really long time, stopping for water a couple times along the way. I guess it was around 9pm then, and my sister started talking about going home soon, so we came in and had cake and I read the cards that the kids all made for me. They each got me a box of Samoas as well, and Mom gave me the Chillow she'd ordered for me. I wasn't expecting anything from them, so that was very nice. Mom's rum cake turned out awesome and she bought vanilla ice cream to go with it (I didn't have any ice cream myself). After we had cake, my sister, her husband, and my niece went home and the two boys stayed here. JP, the boys, and I played football some more, for quite a while, taking water breaks here and there. It was fun. While on our last water break, we decided to go over to the ice skating rink and have a snowball fight (behind the rink, they dump the shaved ice from the zamboni and it's soft like snow). JP and I wound up fighting against the boys. Jesse was nailing us left and right, but we almost never hit him. Austin, we nailed plenty. I got pooped after a while and I watched them play. We were there for hours. By the time we were done, we were soaked and tired. Our feet were sore as hell from being water logged (wet shoes & socks) so the walk home took extra long and we stopped to sit down for a few minutes on the way. JP wound up having to carry Austin p[art of the way home, which is rough when you're exausted yourself (I know because I had to carry him *all* the home from there once). It felt really damned good to get home and kick off the shoes and socks, I will tell you that. Poor JP had to drive all the way home in his wet shoes and socks. As I said before, he split around Midnight. He'd had fun playing with the kids too and was about as worn out as I was/am. After he left, I sent the boys in to take a bath. After that, we sat back in Mom's room and watched TV a while. I can tell they were both worn out too because when I told them I was going to get ready for bed, there was no begging to stay up later or anything, just "goodnight". It was a very good night, and, for the most part, it was a very good day as well. Definitely a day we'll all remember forever, which is what I really wanted for my birthday more than anything else. It's really late and I am completely wiped out. I'm going to bed now.

Middle-Aged Man Just like that Mike Myers sketch on SNL. I've just turned 35, so it's official: I'm middle-aged. I don't feel like much of a geezer yet, mentally anyway. Physically, I'm well past that, way over the hill. I took my time getting up and getting to work today. I just didn't feel like being there at all. Upon arriving, I got a very unpleasant surprise: I don't get paid on Monday this time, but on Thursday. Of ocurse, I only budgeted til Monday, so I'm going to have to borrow money from my sister until payday. It was ok though, Mom picked me up a Publix sub on Thursday, so I had food to eat. The only good news all day was when I talked to Mom and she said my 300+ tape lot had come. Sweet! I paid $65 for them all and I'm not quite sure if it was worth it or not: a lot of goodies, but a lot of crap too. We're going to play some outdoor games (badminton and horseshoes) and have a cookout (steaks, burgers, hot dogs, maybe even some fish, plus Mom's potato salad) and later on we'll have some cake (I think Mom's going to make Rum cake after all). Jam Night I slept crappy last night (I kept getting short-sheeted all night long) and went into work about 15 minutes late today. I was waiting on JP but he was late again so I had Mom drive me in. Hopefully it will also mean I will get more training. I've gotten training on how to do the various reports I do and with Excel, but that's about it. I left around 3:45pm today, half an hour later than planned, and when I got home, I goofed off on the PC rather than taking my usual nap. I did lay down for about 45 minutes though, and I think it must have helped, because I was pretty fresh at practice tonight. Al had a friend of his come and watch us and he seemed to enjoy what we played. It was a very loose, fun practice. It was a very enjoyable evening, and now, I'm off to bed.

Long Monday I slept horribly last night. I went to bed later than I should have and then once in bed, I just could not fall asleep. Needless to say, I didn't get up good either. I have no idea how we're supposed to pay or who make the payment. I asked JP and he said I would be the person who does that, but with what money, and how? The lack of clear and informative answers is frustrating. Somehow, I wound up staying even later than I'd planned, until 5:45pm. Time started flying by late in the day. The extra hours will definitely help make up for missing work last Monday, so that's good. The best thing about it though, was the bus ride home. When I leave at my usual time, somewhere between 3:30pm and 4pm, the bus is usually pretty packed. Sometimes I have to stand all the way home becaue there just aren't any seats left. Today, I was the only passenger on the bus for most of the ride home. Ahhhh... very nice. When I got home today, I had three packages waiting for me. One of them contained the two Jimi Hendrix CDs Mom ordered for my birthday... on Friday night! How in the hell do they ship so fast? Wow! Unfortunately, the other two packages were pretty damned disappointing. One was a book I've been wanting to read for a year now, "Live From New York". Instead, I watched TV: "Everybody Loves Raymond", "Seinfeld", "Fear Factor" and then a new "Everybody Loves Raymond". I guess I'm heading off to bed now, I could use a good night's sleep.

This Just In... JP called me tonight to let me know we're booked for a "Battle Of The Bands" show at Boomerz next month! I think he said it's on the 18th, but I'm not 100% sure because he said it was on a Saturday and the 18th is a Sunday. Either way, it could be an important gig for us since the prizes include a shot at going to a state-level contest and possible prizes like 20 hours of free studio time and a potential record deal (yeah, riiight). We've been wanting to play at Boomerz anyway, trying to get a foot in the door there, so this helps us with that too. If we get nothing else out of it, potential bookings at Boomerz would be worth it. We'll be playing a half hour set, so we should be pretty darn tight. The following week, on Saturday the 24th, we are booked at another club (G.A.) to do two 45 minute sets. We'll have some new songs for that gig, so that should be fun. We'll need to work on our stage presence, I suppose. We had a few negative comments about that from the last gig. We're not a real high-energy group to begin with, and JP doesn't really work the crowd much (plus he's busy playing guitar during most of the songs), so I'm not sure how we're going to change that. When I'm onstage, I want to play really well, that's my main goal up there. I want to hit the right notes, I don't want to screw up, so I focus in on my guitar playing. I can't really do that if I'm jumping around the stage acting like I'm hopped up on goofballs or something. Besides, I'm too damned fat to be jumping around onstage anyway, I'd look like a moron. I suppose I could play the guitar behind my head or something, but hasn't that been done enough? Isn't that considered "hack" anymore? I don't know what I'm supposed to do about my "stage presence". Isn't rocking people's asses off enough? That last line was a joke, by the way. I'm really not that vain.

Thursday: Sleepy & Jamming I'd been sleeping a little better lately, but last night I regressed: very rough night, very little sleep. I stayed in bed until 8:25am before I finally got up. JP was supposed to pick me up for work (he had to come over to drop off his equipment anyway), but he was really late arriving. I didn't get to work until about 9:40am (I'm supposed to be there at 9am). Even though he's my boss and I don't get into any trouble for being late, I don't think I'm going to ride in with him anymore. I'd rather be on time so I can leave at my normal time. I left at my normal time today anyway. It was another rough day at work. I got most of my stuff done early but then I wound up having to wait on a few people before I could finish my work. Only one of the three people came through before I went home, so I never did get to finish a few reports. That means I will have to do even more catching up tomorrow, but I plan on staying late tomorrow anyhow, so... whatever. I got home from work before 4pm and went straight on into bed. I tried to take a nap, I spent about two hours in bed, but I don't think I slept at all... just like last night. Very nice. On the upside, while I was laying there, I won an auction for 11 different Rush tapes ($9.95 total). Sweet! JP arrived as I was getting up. He wanted to show my Mom how to use the Sony videocamera she's buying from him ($200, includes Dazzle). Meanwhile, I ate my leftover piece of Salmon for dinner and got ready for practice. We arrived there about 20 minutes late too. Al was already there, Jimmy arrived even later than us. It was a very loose, very enjoyable practice tonight. We ran through a bunch of covers mostly, jammed a bit, and even started a new song. Some of the covers we did were: "Should I Stay Or Should I Go", "Willie & The Hand Jive", "Blue Suede Shoes", "I Got Loaded", "Roadhouse Blues", "Calling All Angels", "Voodoo Child (Slight Return)", "How Many More Times/Bring It On Home" (which turned into a lengthy jam complete with JP on harmonica) and "Fell In Love With A Girl" (which we did much slower and bluesier). We also ran through JP's "Promise You The Moon" for his friend Mike, who showed later in the evening. It was kind of like old times for me and JP, when we used to jam all night long at the old pawn shop building we had access to. We'd go from covers to jams/improvisations to songs in progress, just like tonight. It was great to be able to play like that again.
