Long Day Rocking I got up sometime around 11am this morning, after my cats started coming in to visit me. I felt like sleeping some more, but I couldn't fall back asleep, so I got up. I should've stayed in bed longer. I got up, played on the PC awhile (the damned thing took 20 minutes before I could do anything with it... I need a new one), mailed out my checks, and waited for my Mom to get home (she spent the night at my sister's). She got home around 2pm, brought home some groceries, a Blimpies subs, some goodies she found at some yard sales, and two new cassette storage cases for me (I owe her for those). At the yard sales she found two more cassette storage cases ($2 each), different brand the ones I use, so she can put those back in her rooms to replace the crappy ones she has now (freebies I got with auctions I won). She also found a wooden CD rack ($3), which I may keep for myself or use as a DVD rack. I can't believe she found so much of that type of stuff, I can never find stuff like that! After we ate our subs, we watched a DVD she brought home from my sisters, "School Of Rock". It wasn't as good as I was hoping. I mean, I laughed at some parts, but overall, it was pretty weak. Jack Black pretty much hammed his way through it and Sarah Silverman... I think Sarah Silverman is hilarious, but she really wasn't very good in this movie. Her acting seemed so... fake. I hope the special feature stuff will be funnier. I'll probably watch that tomorrow. After the movie ended, I got showered, got packed, and after JP got here, we headed out to practice. Practice went really well, even with the changes I made to some of the songs (I'm notorious for changing music right before gigs, fine tuning them). Everybody seemed to like what I did though, so it was all good. We went from practice right on to the club. There was almost no one there, it was so quiet and empty. That was good because it gave us time to set up and do a soundcheck without any rush. My Mom, my sister, and my niece, Dana, got there first. I got to sit with them and we laughed and joked for awhile. I was pretty tired already. Dana's uncle and his wife came too, but they split during our first set for some reason. dana's new boyfriend, JT, also came. I'd never met him before, so to thoroughly embarrass my niece, I pretended to be really, really gay. I gave him a limp handshake and told him he looked "fabulous". I finally told him "Don't worry, I'm not gay... Dana is". It's good to be an uncle. Only one person from me and JP's work showed up, my friend Rob didn't show like he said he would, and no Sue (but at least she told me she probably wouldn't be there). We had over 50 people there, but I thought for sure we'd have more this time. We were supposed to start at 8:30pm, but we got pushed to 8:45pm to accomodate the people who were arriving late. Our first set was: "Love The One You're With" (which sounded really good), "The Middle" (which sounded ok, I hit a questionable note during the solo), "Promise You The Moon" (an original, turned out ok, but I had a problem adjusting to some of the changes I made to this one), "The Way" (turned out ok), "We Don't Need Much" (an original, I fucked up a few times during this one, hitting the wrong chord a few times, which I'd never done any other time I've ever played this song), "Yesterday's Girl" (an original, turned out well), "Cold Shot" (turned out ok), "Wild Night" (turned out ok, I hit a wrong note during the solo though), "Circle" (an original, tunred out ok, still needs just a little more fine tuning), "What She Loves" (an original, I was too distorted on this one), and "Desire" (which was great except for one of the times I hit the wah and it didn't click on). In between sets, JP's wife drew names for free band t-shirts, four of them. The 4th one selected was my sister's! Sweet! Our second set was a little rushed. We had to cut two songs off the set. Here's what we played: "Opportunity Knocks" (an original, turned out real well), "(What's So Funny About) Peace, Love, & Undertstanding" (I came in just a tad late, and my solo was pretty weak), "Something More" (an original, turned out well), "I'm Tore Down" (turned out ok, but I took a wrong turn during my solo), "Had A Girl" (an original, turned out well), "Steal My Kisses" (turned out ok), "Sleeping Forever" (an original, turned out really well), "Stuck In The Middle" (we played it just a little too fast, but it sounded good anyway), "You May Be Right" (turned out well, better than usual), and "Rock This Town" (ok, until I started soloing too soon, during a verse). None of us were thrilled with what we played, it was an ok performance. Everyone pretty much felt the same, tired. We all agreed that we practiced too long before the gig (2 1/2 hours). And then, with the loading and unloading and loading and unloading of equipment, it just made us even more tired. Plus Al, our bassist, just got back from Ireland (yesterday?), and he was dealing with jet lag. For only our second "official" gig, we didn't do half bad. We got paid (I finally paid JP back for the CSN ticket from last year with my share) and we got booked for April (the 24th, a Saturday), so all is good. All of my people split after our set so I hung out with Josh (from work) and we watched the Greg Billings Band play for awhile. You know, Billings pissed me off last time I saw him, and I was ready to hate him still, but man... that fucker can rock ! He's just so good and so fun to watch. I'm over being angry and back to being in awe. I was hoping they'd do AC/DC's "Poblem Child" (he did it the last time I saw him and tore... it... up) but instead they did "Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap", which was awesome! Later, from out of nowhere, they played Johnny Cash's "Folsom Prison Blues"... unreal! Unfortunately, I had to leave and take care of band business with the guys, so I missed most of his show. Neither me or JP had eaten since 2pm, so on the way home, we stopped off at McDonald's. I haven't eaten at McDonalds but once or twice all year, and I haven't had a soda for over a month, but I did both tonight. I got some Chicken McNuggets and an orange soda to take home. they screwed up and gave JP two strawberry milkshakes, so I got one of those too, though I haven't touched it yet ("yet" being the key word there). Well, it's about 3:35am, I'm tired and I need to go to bed. I guess I've unwound enough typing all of this shit out... twice . That's right, I typed a different entry here about 20 minutes after I got home (around 1am) and then I lost everything when I tried to post it and I had to re-write everything all over again. Thanks, Blogger! OK. I'm outta here.

Sign O' The Times Same shit, different day: some more corporate slimeballs getting even richer at the expense of working men and women... Kraft bonuses: $10M amid layoffs Food maker has to lay off 6,000 workers and close 20 plants, but execs still got paid big bonuses. March 6, 2004: 5:22 PM EST CHICAGO (Reuters) - Bonuses totaling more than $10 million were paid out to five Kraft Foods Inc. executives at the end of 2003, even as the giant food maker made plans to lay off thousands of workers. In its annual proxy statement released on Friday, Kraft said the biggest payout, a $3.7-million bonus, was made to chief executive Roger Deromedi. Former co-CEO Betsy Holden got $3.5 million, sweetening her demotion to global marketing chief in December. Other payments were $1.3 million for North American President David Johnson, $900,000 for international boss Hugh Roberts and $1.2 million for global supply chain Executive Vice President Franz-Josef Vogelsang. The maker of Velveeta cheese, Ritz crackers and Maxwell House coffee has struggled to meet Wall Street expectations lately, hurt by a lack of attractive new products and by cheaper competition in some sectors. In January, Chicago-based Kraft said it would cut about 6,000 jobs and close 20 plants as it tried to restore growth. An experiment in joint leadership, with Deromedi in charge of Kraft's international operations and Holden running the North American business, ended on Dec. 16. The bonuses paid by Northbrook, Illinois-based Kraft were made under a three-year incentive plan covering 2001 to 2003. Kraft said the plan aimed to focus executives on the achievement of long-term financial and strategic goals that have a positive impact on stockholder returns. Kraft shares closed at $34.12 on the New York Stock Exchange Friday, up 1.8 percent but far below its 2002 high near $40.00. Kraft shares fell 17 percent in 2003, even as the Standard & Poor's index of large-cap food stocks rose more than 5 percent. So... they put 6,000 people out of work, close down 20 plants, help the company lose value on the stock market, and then they go and give themselves a huge monetary pat on the back? For what? For running the company so poorly? That deserves rewarding nowadays? OK... job well done, you incompetant fucking vermin. I would suggest boycotting any and all Kraft products, but you what? A successful boycott would only hurt the remaining workers, who'd likely lose their jobs. The greedy bastards, "higher-up-the-chain", already got their money, they've been paid, quite handsomely, thank you very much. They're just about untouchable. And that's another problem with these leeches: even if you fire them, they get to walk away with their "golden parachutes", a few million more to tide them over until they find another company to bleed. Corporate America sucks.

JP didn't seem very into playing tonight, he walked off a couple times (dealing with the work situation, I think), so me Al and Jimmy played a little on our own, doing "Dear Mr. Fantasy" and playing a little on an old acoustic song of mine (a Jimmy Page-like one in G). We're looking at late May to play there, the sooner the better though. Billy never showed up either. I didn't think he would, really, I certainly wasn't counting on it. I guess I need to go to bed soon, it's going to be a hectic day tomorrow and I can't show up late; unlike today, all the bosses will be there tomorrow and they won't be in a very good mood).

Gig Night I stayed up until 4am last night (Friday night), went to bed, and slept horribly. I was up around 11am, stayed up for a while, ate lunch, got my equipment ready for the gig, played a little bit, and then sometime around 1:30pm, I went back to bed. I stayed down until 5:30pm, but I'd slept very little again. I got up, played my acoustic guitar a little (I'd picked it up repeatedly all night and day while in bed, even started a new song). I showered, ate, changed clothes got my equipment out to the car, and around 7:35pm, we (Mom and I) headed to the club. We were the first ones there, Jimmy and Al arrived shortly after, then we started moving our gear in. It was really nice not having any pressure to set-up quickly. We did a sound check and even got to play through one song ("Promise You The Moon"). My sister and niece showed up before the first set, as did my friend, Rob. He invited a neighbor of his, Patty, and she showed up later in the night (during the second set), which was cool. Overall though, we got nowhere near the crowd we usually pull in. With us being the only band to playing, it was pretty disappointing. We only had maybe 25-30 people show up (we usually bring in around 50) and several of those were Moms and Dads who got in for free. I'm thankful for the ones who did show up though, their presence meant a lot. It wasn't a full house by any means, but it was a friendly crowd. We were waiting for people to show up, so our first set got pushed back to 9:30pm. Only a few more showed, but we went on anyway. I could tell it was going to be a long night. Here was our first set: "Sunshine Of Your Love" (turned out ok), "Steal My Kisses" (turned out well), "Promise You The Moon" (an original... turned out ok), "The Difference" (turned out well), "I Got Loaded" (we had a problem... JP launched started the last verse in the middle of my solo... a miscommunication), "Something More" (an original... turned out well), "Fell In Love With A Girl" (turned out ok), "Yesterday's Girl" (on original... turned out well), "The Middle" (turned out well, I think... we started having sound problems with the monitors around here, so it was hard to tell), "Love The One You're With" (same thing), "Tore Down" (not too good, I tripped over some of my lines), "Had A Girl" (went over well, I think, but I could barely hear Al), and "Rockin' In The Free World" (we played it ok, but it didn't seem to go over great... by then, everything seemed extremely loud onstage). We took a 15 minute break and I went over and sat with my sister, niece, mother, and my friend, Rob. I talked with JP's mom and dad a while too, and drank a whole bunch of water. I drank water all night long, except for a coke I had before the first set. It was so freaking hot up there it was insane, just wicked humid. I was sweating my ass off up there, I'll tell ya. I felt like I got a real work-out. While I was sitting there, I told my sister she should order Mom a Margarita (she always talks about ordering one when we go out to eat but never does) and she did! Mom took one sip and started turning red! She nursed that drink all night long, in fact, I don't think she ever finished it. I tried a sip myself (I'd never had one before) but I just could not stand the salt around the edge... ick! Here was our second set: "What's So Funny About Peace, Love & Understanding" (turned out real well... the sound was much better), "There For Me" (an original... turned out well), "American Girl" (turned out real well), "Stuck In The Middle" turned out real well), "Before You Accuse Me" (turned out ok... I fumbled some leads again), "Opportunity Knocks" (an original... turned out ok), "Wild Night" (turned out well), "Sleeping Forever" (an original... turned out well), "Go Your Own Way" (I started out on the wrong chord again, like I did at practice...ugh! otherwise, it went ok), "You May be Right" (the sound started going crazy here, the rhythm guitar disappered from the monitor's mix, so I was trying to comp a rhythm guitar that wasn't there... I have no idea how this one went as it was such a struggle to play), "Rock This Town" (much sloppier than usual, went over ok though), "You Can't Run" (an original... turned out well), "Hangin' By A Moment" (turned out ok), "Better" (a new original, first time played out, a bit rough still, but it got a decent reception), "I Wanna Be Sedated" (turned out ok, but there was a problem with the breakdown part), and "Desire" (ugh. JP hit some bad notes and my channel switching pedal started feeding back for some reason... it had been a pretty strong set up until then). I planned this set to be our most upbeat set, to get people on the floor dancing, and that worked out just as I'd thought. I planned this set to be a bit longer than the others because I figured most people would split after the second set and sure enough, they did. I knew our crowd wasn't a "late-night" bunch. They are primarily people with day jobs and families, so I knew they'd wouldn't stay for the whole show. Before we got onstage for the last set of the night, there were only about 15 people around the bar and two or three in the seats. My sister and niece were among those who split after the second set. My Mom sat outside while I was out front talking with Rob, but then she wound up staying out there the rest of the night. I'm not sure why. Rob stayed the whole time though, as did his neighbor, so that was cool. By the third set, all of the band guys were pretty much wiped out. Between the heat, the sound problems, and the late hour, we were beat. It was in this atmosphere that we kicked off the last set: "Cold Shot" (went well), "Feelin Alright" (sound problems a plenty... all I could hear through the monitor was my guitar, so I kept turning down and it didn't help... I have no idea how this sounded to the audience... very frustrating), "Crazy Little Thing Called Love" (sloppy, but it was ok), "All For You" (a quieter song, went over ok, but my solo sucked ass), "The Way" (same thing: my solo sucked ass... probably because I'd turned down so much that I lost gain and it hurt my playing), "Circle" (turned out ok), and "Old Apartment" (turned out ok). JP ended the set there (we'd skipped over 6 songs), I guess he had a bad headache and was done. As he was saying goodbye, we got several people pleading with us (literally) to play more. I launched into "The Authority Song" and that went ok, but JP was done after that and left the stage. I kicked into one of my jams and the band tore into it. We sounded alright, even though I was pulling most of it out of my ass, we were all just winging it. A lot of people dug the hell out of it though, which was very nice to hear. Whew! And so, the gig was over. I talked to some of the people who stuck around to hear us (Rob, Patty, Josh from work, and some new people), and had my first and only beer of the night: a nice cold Heineken. Al said he'd give me a lift home, so Mom finally split. She said she could hear us outside. Maybe we were too loud for her, I don't know. Eventually, we got paid ($75 each, we didn't make our bonus) and we just hung out, chillin', for a while. It was a long, sweaty night and I am beat. Bedtime.

Lately I've Been... Listening to: I had Fleetwood Mac's self-titled CD on at home a couple times and I listened to most of the new Clapton CD ("Me And Mr. Johnson") at work (JP brought in his copy). Mostly, I've just been jamming out to tapes at my desk though: Warren Zevon, Black Sabbath, AC/DC, The Who, The Doors, etc... I brought in about 20 new tapes from home (from that huge lot I just got) and swapped them out with less-rocking tapes I already had there. I have a shitload of Sabbath and Zeppelin there now and I'm loving it! I'm still enjoying Al Franken's (streaming) radio show as well (I try to catch it every work day, Noon-3pm). Watching on TV: Sundays: "The Sopranos"; Mondays: "Fear Factor"; all week long: "The Simpsons", "Everybody Loves Raymond", "Seinfeld", and when I can catch it, "The Dave Chapelle Show". I went to bed early almost every night this week, so I wasn't watching much TV. Downloading: Nothing. Reading: Almost nothing (I've been half-reading an SNL book in the bathroom). Jamming: I had band practice Thursday, but unfortunately, it was all business (rehearsing for tomorrow's gig). We play 3 sets tomorrow night, our longest gig yet, from 9-12:30am. We don't quite have everything together, so it may be a rough one. Oh, I tried out my new wah at practice and the sweep is incredible, great sounding wah (even has some boost to it), but it's a bit too wild for me right now. I'll probably just use my old one until I get a better handle on the new one. Working: I worked about 39 hours this week. I started at 9:30am all week, but JP wants me to go back to 9am starts, godammit, for no good reason at all. he said he doesn't want any trouble with his boss, but the time I start has no bearing on anything except how late I leave. In reality, the later I'm there, the better it is for the people I'm supposed to be supporting, so whatever. There's all kinds of weasel behavior going on there. I need to just do my job, collect my pay, and forget about the rest of it (eerily reminiscent of how I felt near the end of my run at my last full-time job). Buying: I bought some index cards, an index card holder, some printer ink, and a video ("A Fish Called Wanda") at Office Depot tonight. I knew it beforehand, but they have a special deal going on right now: if you bring in an empty ink cartridge, they give you a ream of paper for free. Of course, being a dumbass and all, I forgot to bring in my empty. Mom will probably do that tomorrow. Selling: I actually sold about 13-14 cards this week, stuff from my eBay store that I listed last year. Totally unexpected. I really need to start stocking that bitch up. Eating: Today I went out to lunch with JP and I used my Chili's gift card. I had a steak fajita, which I've never had before, but I wasn't very impressed with it. I liked the southwestern eggrolls (that I had as an appetizer) much, much better. Tonight, I had pork chops and green beans (with bacon and onion) for dinner. No sodas still. That'll probably change tomorrow; I have a feeling I'll be needing some Mountain Dew (high in caffeine). I didn't eat burgers as much this week, but I had french dips instead, which also come with fries, so it wasn't much better for me. Lunches are my bad spot still. I need to find a lunch I can take to work that's good for me *and* that requires no cooking or preparation. Good luck, huh? Feeling: Mentally, a bit frustrated. Part of the problem is my job. I'm glad to have it, but some things aren't going as well as I'd hoped. JP wants me full-time, his boss thinks my position is unnecessary because businesss ran the same after my predecessor left, so I'm in a rock and a hard place. I definitely do not feel I have any kind of job security, especially since JP isn't training me the way I thought he would. He learned everything on his own, so I think he wants me to do the same, but he doesn't take into account that he had several years of schooling on computers. I don't have any such advatage. Also, I thought I'd get a raise when I finally got the full-time position (to make-up for the money I'd lose when I start paying for benefits), but that ain't going to happen. I'm actually going to bring home less money now that I'm a full-time employee, which is killing me financially. I just got in my emergency room bill ($756.00), I have a bank loan to pay back (over $1,000.00 due), and I just layed away a guitar (I have $668.00 left to pay), so this is a very bad time to be bringing home less money. I'm also a bit frustrated with the band situation. We're still not doing any of my music, and when I throw some material out there at practice, it gets jammed on and then we move on. We never stop to work on any of it. We also don't do any Hendrix songs yet, which is bothersome to me. I'm also bothered by the fact that the other guys are considering taking some upcoming gigs where we'd play nothing but covers. I'm not playing for the money, I'm playing to get our music out there and heard, so it seems like a step backwards to me. One other thing is troubling me as well: our rhythm section, primarily the drumming. Jimmy's just not latching on, rhythmically, to a lot of what I'm throwing out there. Tough situation. Physically, I'm struggling with "the Big D" at the moment and hoping it's gone by showtime tomorrow night. The backs been ok, but I hadn't been sleeping well all week. Last night was an improvement though. Planning: Too much. I'm a bit overwhelmed at the moment, to be honest. I need to focus on the gig tomorrow night, first and foremost, but I've got so many other things going on, so many distractions... ugh!

Tired & Hassled I went to bed early last night, around 9:30pm, but I still got very little sleep. I tossed and turned all night long again, but did wind up getting at least a couple hours of sleep, which is more than I've gotten all week. I felt bad for Stevie, the cat that likes to sleep in my bed. Just about everytime he got settled down, I'd start tossing and turning and he'd have to re-adjust to me. This went on for hours. I also had to keep knocking him off me every time he tried to sleep on me. He doesn't weigh much, but it was enough to bother my lower back. I was going to go in on time today, but that didn't work out very well. I wound up taking the late bus again, getting in at 9:30am. From there on, until the time I left, it was a problem fest. Problems with reports, problems with phone codes, problems with phone lines, problems with my full-time status, computer problems, CD burner problems, problems, problems, problems. Ugh! Today was a real pain-in-the-ass. JP went to the boss to get the ok for me to go full-time and it didn't quite go how either of us expected. He gave the ok, but he also jumped on JP for having me working full time already without his permisson. The boss man wants me to work between 32-40 hours per week with *no overtime*. Oops. I had about 15 minutes worth last pay and I'm in danger of having an hour or so of OT next pay. I'm now eligible for benefits, but I don't think I'll take any except for the health insurance, maybe the dental too. It doesn't make any sense joining a 401K plan if they're going to lay me off me go in December (every year, they lay the person in my position off from December until January), and right now, I don't see any thing that tells me they're not going to do it (that's why I need to start saving money as soon as I can). Anyhoo... enough of that crap. JP talked to the booker for the club we're playing on Saturday night and he wasn't able to find another band to play after us, so, we're doing three 3-hour sets, from 9:00pm to 12:30am. I'm not thrilled about that. I don't think we have enough material to do it. We'll have to stretch songs out or else try and fake our way through songs we haven't played in ages. It could get ugly. We still need to come up with a set list too, three of 'em. The pressure is on...

The Sleeplessness Continues I went to bed around 10:30pm last night, hoping to get a decent night's sleep. I barely slept the night before, so it looked very promising. If you know me, you know where this is going already. After a long time laying there without sleep, time spent tossing and turning from one side to the other, going from one pillow to another, I gave in and looked at the clock. It read "1:59am". That's right, three and a half hours in bed and not a wink of sleep. It didn't get much better after that. I was up around 6:30am to take a leak, and at that point, I had only slept a little bit... maybe an hour? By the time I was supposed to get up, I couldn't. I laid in bed until I had almost no time to get ready for work. I made it to work on the late bus, looking like Hell and feeling like shit, trudged into my office, and got started on my daily work. After I finished the majority of that, I started on the project JP gave me yesterday. I had to go back over phone records from last June until now and track how mant times every state had been called. After a few hours of doing that crap, I had some inspiration. The records I was going through are handled by a company we still deal with and so I called JP to ask him if he had asked them if they had a similar report already on hand. He hadn't, so I called them up and they said they could send me the report. I hope to see it tomorrow, and if it's done in an accessable way, it will have saved me more than a week's worth of work. That was good news, and as usual, it was quickly followed up with some bad news: I still had to track all the calls made from late 2001 until mid 2003 that came from another company they'd used. The files were on discs, zipped up, so I had to copy them into a file and unzip them, then I was supposed to get them ready to go into a datbase. Well, not knowing how large these zip files were, I used up all of the disc space on my hard drive and so I had to copy them over to another drive, one with ample space. Of course, in my tired state of mind, I didn't realize that that the files would take up all of the space on that drive as well. Finally, I tried to delete the files from one of the drives (my PC was running extremely slow) and I wound up deleting everything. At least five hours worth of work...gone. Oh, I talked to our HR person and with JP and he's supposed to ask his boss to ok me for "full time" so I can start getting benefits finally. I'd been working full time hours for quite a while now, so it's about time. I stayed until 5:45pm today, bussed it on home and found a package waiting for me on the steps. It was my Teese Real McCoy (RMC-1) wah pedal. It looked to be like new, hopefully it plays that way as well. After dinner, another package I'd been waiting on arrived as well, the 268 tape lot with the 3 wooden storage racks. It was packed extremely well. The tapes look used, but in pretty decent shape... a lot of newer ones in clear shells. I need to order some more cases for them though, they're filthy and many are cracked and broken. There's a lot of stuff in there I can sell pretty easily too, death metal stuff that I wouldn't listen to, so that's really cool. Not a bad buy! Well... I took the trash out already, I'm about done blogging for the night, so I am taking my ass to bed. It's not even 8:30pm yet, but what the hell, I'm wiped out.

Dead Man Waking I think I slept maybe an hour last night... maybe. My sinuses got bad, my room was too warm, and after I realized how late it had gotten and I still hadn't slept, I kept thinking about that. Ugh! To matters worse, when I got up this morning, my back was aching again. This time it was the left side of my lower back, it felt like it was going to give out on me. I would've called in sick for any other job (or on any other boss), but I just couldn't do it. I've already missed five days in the three months I've been here, I don't need to miss more. On the way in to work, I ran into Santana. His band played Sunday, at the same place we played on Saturday, same contest too. He said his band "took it". I thought that meant they won, but he said they didn't stay for the judging, so I don't know what he meant. He also said they played for an hour, which both JP and I found pretty hard to believe. The lady that ran the contest was pretty adamant about the amount of time each band was allotted (half an hour, maybe a couple minutes over, but no more than 35 minutes or they'd pull the plug on you and you'd be out of the contest), so I don't know what to believe. Oh yeah, some good news: JP called last night and it looks like our band will have a place to practice... for FREE! His brother-in-law has a club that is no longer in use and he said we could play there. It's air-conditioned, has a stage, and we can leave our equipment there if we want (JP will have a key). Sweet!

Lately I've Been... Listening to: I listened to some of the Fleetwood Mac CD I bought recently, but mainly I've been listening to tapes (primarily at work). I've listened to tapes by the Steve Miller Band, ZZ Top, The Presidents Of The United States, Men At Work, and others. I also caught the O'Franken Factor" several times this week. Watching on TV: This week I watched some shows I normally don't watch: "The Howard Stern Show", "The Osbournes", and "The King Of Queens", plus I watched my usual TV fare: "The Simpsons", "Everybody Loves Raymond", "Seinfeld", "The Sopranos", "Fear Factor", and a lot of CNN. Downloading: Nothing. Reading: I'm not really reading anything at the moment. Jamming: We practiced last Friday and played a gig on Saturday. We will practice next Thursday and we have another gig next Saturday. Sweet! Working: I worked about 40 hours last week, give or take a half hour. Buying: I bought some stuff at thrift sores and a yard sale today (see post below). Other than a couple of dinners, that's about it. Selling: I sold three cards today for $5.50. I'm lazy, I really need to load up up my eBay store. I could have money coming in daily if I did it right. Eating: Burgers and fries, subs, pizza, Cooladas, Samoas, lunchables... too much crap. We've been eating out a lot more often too, going for steaks, mexican food, etc.. Not exactly the kinds of foods I should be eating. I need to start drinking more water again too. Feeling: Mentally, I'm doing ok. Maybe a little anxious about the future: next Saturday's gig, the hospital bill that's due in, a couple of eBay auctions I won that haven't arrived yet, but otherwise, I'm ok. Physically, my back problems have gotten much better. I haven't had to take my medicine as much and that's made me less groggy, less sleepy, so that's good. I'm still very unhappy with my weight problem, but that's not going to go away anytime soon. Planning: I need to get my ass in gear and start practicing at home a lot more. I need to get myself familiarized with all of our covers and originals again, and I have to do that within the week (because we may do a 3-hour set next Saturday). Ugh!

My Sunday Crime/Shopping Spree I slept ok last night, woke up tired still though. The good news: my back felt alright. I thought it'd be bad again, after all of the activity and heavy lifting last night, but it wasn't bad. I took my pills and after a bit, it didn't bother me at all. When Mom came home, sometime around Noon, I suggested going out and she was agreeable to that. The first place we stopped was a well known thrift store and I bought three tapes there (Jackson Browne, Sheryl Crow, and Journey) for $0.50 each. The tapes are supposed to be marked at $0.50 each, that's how much all of their other stores charge and that's how much this one usually charges, but some moron/s in the back recently started putting various prices on them, seemingly at random too, because it made no sense how they were priced. Two of the tapes I had in hand were priced at a buck each, which is more than I would be willing to pay since, quite often, the tapes I buy there don't work when I get them home and try to play them. The last time I was there, I asked the lady at the checkout about the pricing and she said they should all be marked at $0.50 each, so... I asked one of the ladies in the store today (a different lady) and she said "I don't know... I guess they cost whatever they're marked". Grrrr!!!! Normally, I would have just put the tapes back and passed on them altogether, but for some reason, I took the tapes back over to the area where the tapes are (spread out all over several bins mixed in with other junk) and I switched cases so that all three of the tapes had a $0.50 tag on them. I know... it was a petty, lame-ass thing to do, but I was annoyed at the stupid way they do things there and the unwillingness of the lady I'd asked to find out for sure how much they cost, since she obviously wasn't sure. It wasn't the $1 I saved that motivated me, it was the principle of the matter. Nonetheless, I suppose I'm a criminal now, since , technically, it was stealing. On the way out, I saw someone who looked like a manager there, and she seemed to be following me out, but after I got outside, I didn't see her again. Maybe it was my imagination, I don't know, but I won't be doing that again. It was very unlike me to do that in the first place. After we left there, we were trying to decide where to go for lunch. I was jonesing for some sweet iced tea, so we wound up over at the Lone Star Steakhouse. I had some jalapeno poppers, some chili, and a Texas Ribeye (with rice). It was a very good meal, except I had to send my steak back to be cooked a little more, which was annoying. Since I got paid this week, I treated ($46 altogether). After we ate, we went to a couple of yard sales (I spent a dollar and bought a stupid romance book for my sister and a bag of glow-in-the-dark stars) and then went to another of those well known thrift stores . There, I bought a badminton racket for $1 (a nice one made by Spalding), 4 tapes that cost $0.50 each (Tower Of Power, Men At Work, Billy Squier, and the Smithereens), and a large softcover Steven King book, "Wizard And Glass" (the fourth Dark Tower novel), for just $0.75. Mom bought a baseball glove (a Wilson) and a "Who Wants To Be A Millionaire" PC game for my niece and nephews (they were $2 each). From there, we headed home, stopping off at Dunkin' Donuts on the way, where I finally got me a Strawberry Coolada. For those of you keeping score at home, that's 4 visits, 1 Coolada.

Friday/Saturday I went to work on the bus on Friday, caught the later one, and got in around 9:20am. I had all of my work done by about 3pm and that's with a very long lunch (about an hour and 20 minutes... me and JP went over to the chinese buffet). The rest of the afternoon, I sat in JP's office while he edited video from his family reunion. Not exactly a rough day at work. We had band pratice after work so we left together, came here, hung out a little, then we packed up our equipment and headed to practice. Practice was pretty rough, for me anyhow. I was still groggy from my medication so I wasn't playing up to par. Plus, hauling equipment back and forth didn't help my back any. When I left there, I was pretty nervous about the Saturday night gig. I made myself stay up later on Friday, til about 1am. I watched two episodes of "The Howard Stern Show" (he had Uma Thurman on and was trying to impress her with his awards, books, etc... he even brought in a little kid to thank him for helping him with his cancer...nice!) and then I watched two episodes of "The Osbournes". I woke up around 9am on Saturday, not feeling very refreshed or energetic. This didn't make me feel any better about the gig. I ate breakfast and then, sometime around Noon, Mom and I headed out to a yard sale here in the park. The lady had a ton of Stephen King hardcovers for just $1 each, but they looked pretty "grody" (there's a word I haven't used in ages) and I passed on them. We went over to Sam Ash next. I wanted to make sure exactly which guitar I had layed away last week (I wasn't thinking very straight because of the back pain). Dan, the guitar guy there, went back and pulled the guitar for me so I could look it over. I was happy with it. It's a sunburst, like I thought, but it was the new style with the new style Fender bridge and the rolled fretboard and everything. It looked nice. In fact, it had never been out of the box until then. Nice case too. I have about $688 left to pay on it and then it's mine all mine! Sweet! We were going to hit some yard sales after that, but my back started feeling sore again, so I cut the trip short. I didn't take any medicine all day becasue I didn't want to be groggy for the gig, so I had to deal with the strain the best I could. We went on home and I took a nap for two hours. Well, I tried to take a nap. Stevie came in and jumped on me and after I finally got him to sleep down by my feet, I couldn't get comfortable because I didn't want to roll over on him. I should've just booted him out, but alas, I did not. After I got up, I showered, got dressed and then worked on my tone a bit. I decided not to use my Captain Coconut pedal at the gig, going with my amp's distortion instead (it came with a footswitch). Instead of the Coconut's Univibe sound, I used my MXR Phaser. I was pretty cool with the sound I got and I wrote down the amp settings and all. I still think I can get a better tone out of my gear. I need to work on that. JP arrived around 5:15pm to pick me up. He loaded my gear up while I finished getting ready to go, which was really nice of him to do, and then we headed out to the club. It was pretty disorganized there, no one knew anything, and the person in charge hadn't arrived yet. Me and JP got there first, followed shortly after by Al, and later by Jimmy. Eventually, the lady that ran the show finally got there and she took everyone outside to lecture us about what to do, what not to do, etc... She tallied up how many tickets were sold and then came back with the roster. We thought we did pretty good with about 22 tickets sold, but most of the other bands sold more. We wound up going on 2nd, the 7:45pm slot. We knew then that we had no chance of winning the contest and I think that may have helped us (it took the pressure off). Al and I went to the sports bar next door and grabbed some burgers. Al insisted on paying for both meals, which was very nice of him, so I left the tip. JP's dad came by and said "hello" while we were eating. After that, we went out back to load the equipment in as soon as the first band finished, but JP had already brought my stuff in with his. I couldn't believe how much he was helping me out (because of my back). Very cool. After the first band finished (some industrial duo with a rhythm machine), it was a rush job to get on stage and get set up. We got set up pretty quickly though, we even had 4 minutes leftover. I kicked the set off with "Love The One You're With" (which went really well), then we launched into "Stuck In The Middle" (another one that went very well), then "Opportunity Knocks" (an original... went fairly well), then "The Old Apartment" (went fairly well), then "You Can't Run" (an original... went really well), then "Sleeping Forever" (another original... went really well), then "Circle" (another original... had some trouble here), and then, finally, "Desire" (which went really well). Short but sweet. The stage there was really nice, high off the ground, and the sound system was really good too (though I thought my volume was a bit low). As soon as we finished, we had to rush everything off the stage, no time to soak in the applause or anything. The sound guy said we played well and the band that followed us said the same thing. I played pretty well for the most part. I had trouble on "Circle" though. I played the wrong chords two or three times (I tried playing the chorus a little differently and I kept forgetting which chord I was on... ugh). Afterward, we talked to the lady in charge (after we loaded everything back into JP's car... Al carried my amp halfway, very cool of him to do) and she said she wanted us to make a demo CD for some label she's affiliated with (Koala?). Her and the sound guy both recommended us for another gig, but I forget the name. It's in St. Pete, near the beach (I think). Al said the place is always packed on the weekend, even without our crowd showing up it'd be a full house. The only thing about that one though is we'll have to do a lot more covers, which, in my mind, is a step backwards. There's another gig we were offered last week, a Sunday afternoon deal out on the beach, but again, cover-heavy. The other guys are for it, I'm not. After the last band finished, they did the voting. It went about how I thought: the first band on got the least cheers, the last band on got the most, winning the "Battle Of The Bands". I went backstage and congratulated two of the guys from the band that won (kind of a heavy ska band with a trumpet player... they were really good). JP, Al, Mike (JP's friend), two of Mike's friends, and I stood outside talking for a bit (Jimmy had left before the voting). Al took off and shortly after, then the rest of us hit the road too. JP and I stopped off at a Dunkin' Donuts on the way home. I was hoping to get a Strawberry Coolada but they ran out of the strawberry mix. That makes three Dunkin' Donuts I've hit in the last week that were unable to serve me my damn Strawberry Coolada. How pathetic. So... I got nothing there, even though I was dying of thirst. I got home sometime around 11:20pm. We brought my equipment in (JP carried my amp in, which was cool of him to do again), talked for a few mintues, and then JP hit the road. Since then, I've been typing this out and half-watching TV (SNL, Comedy Central). It's been a long day. I think it's going to be a long week too. We may have to play a three-hour set next weekend at our usual monthly gig. The other band cancelled and if they can't find another band to go on after us, we'll play for three hours. We don't have much more than that in our repertoire, and we haven't played many of those songs for months. We'll all have to practice like hell at home all week long. We could always do some extended jamming too, but I don't know how well that would go over. It'll be mostly our crowd, family and friends, so it should be a low-pressure fun gig.

Almost Over I went to bed early again last night, just after 8pm. I didn't sleep very well though, I awake off and on all night, and I got out of bed late because of that. Mom was taking me in again, which was probably a god thing too because I would have overslept. I only had a little bit of time to get ready, but I made it in to work about 10 minutes early. I thought I had about two hours extra this week (because I'd been coming in early and leaving late all week), but the payroll lady said I only had about 45 minutes. I don't know how she got that number, but I'll bet I will wind up with an hour of OT somewhere down the line (OT which they will no doubt bitch at me for having). I was pretty groggy all day today, probably from the medicine I've been taking. JP brought me in the rest of his, so now I may not have to go to the doctor's after all. He also brought in his Danelectro Daddy-O distortion pedal for me. He wants to sell it and I told him I'd like to check it out. I got most of my work done today, all of the important stuff anyway. There are some reports I was waiting most of the day for that didn't arrive until close to quittin' time, another never showed up at all. I was going to go to the bank today (today was payday), that's why I chose to leave early today, but I never made it there. I stood there waiting for the west-bound bus for about 15-20 minutes, so I figured it must have come early and I missed it. I crossed the road to take the east-bound bus home, but as is my luck, I was stood there for no more than a minute when I saw the west-bound bus pass by. D'oh! I got home and shortly after, ordered a pizza for dinner. I need to get back on track with my eating habits. I was doing good for a long while. I'm glad this week is almost over. I'm just as glad that my back pain is going away. It's been a rough week for me.

Early To Bed, Early To Rise... Tuesday was am lot like Monday, just shorter. My back still hurt, I took pills, Mom drove me back and forth from work, I took more pills, and I nearly fell asleep at my desk. However, instead of going out for mexican food (like we did on Monday), we ordered in from Bradford Pub. I had 2 Reuben sandwiches (they're small) and Mom had wings. As soon as I got home from work, I took a nap until the food arrived. Shortly after dinner, I went to bed for the night. That was sometime around 7:15pm. Very, very early. I got up around 3:30am to take pills again, but then went right back to bed. I really didn't sleep too well. Mom woke me up this morning (I had been sleeping through my alarm) and said she'd take me in to work again. I got up got dressed, found my long lost keys (in a pair of pants in my laundry basket), grabbed my drinks and food, and we left for work. My back is still bothering me. It's especially bad when I stand. This has me worried because I have a gig in 3 days ansd I will have to stand for at least a half an hour. Plus, I will have to lug around equipment on Friday (the night we practice) and Saturday (gig night). I'm not looking forward to that. Hopefully my back will be better by then, but if not, I'm going to be in a world of pain all over again. Oh, and I only have enough Vicodin for today and tomorrow. I may have to go see my regular doctor in a day or two. More guitar money down the drain. Grrrr!!! I stopped downstairs for a large cappucino and ate half of my Publix sub for breakfast while I worked. And so the day begins...

Sleepy Monday I knew, since I slept almost all day Sunday, that I was going to have a problem getting to sleep at night. Sure enough, I did. I neglected to turn the air on before I went to bed, figuring it would be cool enough with the rain and all, but I wound up sweating my ass off. I got up around 3am to turn the AC back on. While I was up, I also took some some pills. I slept off and on throughout the night, never steady. Mom woke me up around 7:45am and told me she'd take me to work if I was ready by 8:30am. It was raining outside still and I didn't feel like sitting in the rain if I didn't have to, so I got up, got ready, and was out the door by 8:30. It was a slow, boring day at work today. I received only one phone call all day, had just one email that had to be answered, and didn't have a single person knock at my door all day. I could have slept at my desk the whole time and no one would've known. Of course, I'd never do that. I worked like I was supposed to and I got everything caught up (except for one report that the database won't accept for some reason). I even had time left over to work on my Access skills. I started putting together a music datbase there too (using the list from my "Music Collection" page). My back is still pretty sore, the sitting all day didn't help any. I took my medicine along, but I decided not to take any Vicodins (because of the drowsiness they cause). My back was aching bad by late afternoon and I relented. After a bit, I started nodding off at my desk. I nearly fell asleep. Like I said before, I very easily could have slept at my desk, but I didn't. Mom offered to pick me up today (which is unusual), so I stayed a little late, until 5:10pm. I arrived about 8:40am this morning, so I have about half an hour of extra time now. On the way home, Mom and I were trying to figure out what we were doing for dinner and I suggested Carmelita's. Mom was ok with that, so we headed on over there. It was nice, we were the only customers in the whole restaurant. I liked that. I had my usual (Chiles Rellenos Con Carne) and drank some raspberry iced tea with it (they didn't have any sweet tea). I'm not a fan of raspberry tea. I couldn't finish everything there, so I took half of it home. It lasted maybe an hour at home before I finished it off. Good stuff! I think I'm going to be going to bed early tonight. I may stay up until 9:30pm to watch "Fear Factor" and then "Everybody Loves Raymond". We'll see how long I last (I'm ready for bed now).

Lately I've Been... Listening to: I bought a couple of new CDs on Friday and got 40 tapes in yesterday, but I haven't listened to any of them yet. I don't think I've listened to anything since Tuesday, the last day I worked. Well, music anyhow. I did listen to urlLink Al Franken's radio show on urlLink Air America a few times this week. Good stuff. Watching on TV: I watched some "Judge Mathis" while I was home from work, but that's about the only daytime show I paid any attention to. I watched "Everybody Loves Raymond", "Seinfeld", "South Park", "Chappelle's Show", and "King Of Queens" throughout the week and weekend. I'm still watching "The Sopranos" every Sunday and "Fear Factor" every Monday. I bought myself the Spinal Tap movie on DVD, but I haven't put it on yet. Downloading: Some "oldies" from when I was a teenager: Planet P Project ("Why Me?"), Tony Carey ("Fine, Fine Day"), Saga ("Wind Him Up" & "On The Loose"), The Tubes ("Talk To Ya Later" & "She's A Beauty"), Thomas Dolby ("One Of Our Submarines"), Peter Gabriel ("Solsbury Hill" & "Games Without Frontiers"), and Joe Walsh ("The Confessor"). It's been a long time since I've heard most of those. Reading: I've been "reading" album guides in bed and in the bathroom, but that's it really. Jamming: I missed band practice on Thursday due to my back problems, we practice again next Thursday and have a gig that Saturday. Working: I missed three days of work this past week because of my back, but I should be good to go for tomorrow. I have a lot of catching up to do and I may catch some flak for not calling in to anyone on Friday. Buying: On Thursday, I won a Jimi Hendrix box set on eBay. On Friday, I bought a new amplifier, 2 CDs and a DVD. I also won a 2-CD set and a new wah pedal on Friday as well. Today, I won 2 Rush tapes on eBay. Selling: I sold one card from my eBay store, for $1.50. Eating: This weekend I've been really bad, eating "comfort food" rather than what's good for me: Hershey bars, eclairs, McDonalds burgers and fries, strawberry cooladas, sodas, steak and cheese hoagie, etc... Feeling: Mentally, I'm pretty angry about my financial situation. Losing three days of work and then having to go to the Emergency Room last night (I can't wait to see that bill), and then having to pay for my prescriptions, has really hurt me a lot. I had my next paycheck pegged as the one where I'd buy a new guitar (I put $50 down on a new one on Friday), but that's not going to happen now. Physically, my back problems have been killing my ass (see post below). Otherwise, I'm fine. The medicine I'm taking (Ibuprofen, Vicodin, and a muscle relaxer) has been making me sleepy as hell. I slept almost all day today, literally. I got out of bed a few times to get a drink (the medicine made my mouth dry) and to take more pills, but I didn't get out of bed (to stay up) until 6:30pm. I just hope that doesn't keep me from sleeping when I try to go to bed tonight. Planning: Firstly, to get back to normal. To get back to work and get back into the routine that my back problems have pulled me out of. Secondly, I need to get practicing big time. We have a gig next Saturday and one the following Saturday as well and only one band practice before each gig. Other than playing a little while I was checking out my amp, I haven't picked up my electric guitar for a couple of weeks now.

Just Another Saturday Night In The E.R. I slept terribly again last night (due to the back pain) and didn't get up until 11:30am, almost too late for yard-saling. About 15 minutes after I was out of bed, we were out the door. My back felt worse today than it did the day before, but I decided to go out and try and be active anyway (hoping it would help). We wound up stopping to eat before we stopped at any yard sales. We went to the Pickel Barrel and I bought lunch for us. Mom had shrimp salad and I had a steak and cheese hoagie. Mine was ok, but wasn't exactly what I'd wanted. I guess Mom felt the same because we wound up swapping meals in the end. From there we hit just a few yard sales before I had to call it a day. The pain from my back was intense and getting in and out of the car was killing me. I didn't find anything for myself, but I found a CD burner for Mom (for just $20). I'll hook it up when I'm feeling better. On the way home, we stopped at Walgreens and I bought some Doan's backache pills and a couple Hersey bars. After that, we stopped at Dunkin' Donuts and I bought a strawberry Coolada and 2 eclairs. I don't know why I wanted all of that junk food, it's unusual for me. Shortly after I got home, I went to bed. I tried to read in bed but couldn't get comfortable at all. Eventually I got tired and tried to nap. I must have slept a little, but for the most part, I just kept turning from side to side, and from my back to my belly. No matter what position I got in, the pain would start coming on right away or within a few moments. I finally got up around 7:30pm and tried to lay on the couch, but the results were the same: intense pain no matter which way I tried to settle. Besides dealing with the pain (the Doan's did nothing to help it), I was getting frustrated and angry. After awhile, it got to be just too much. I was wrenched with pain, in real agony, and crying. I thought Mom would have come out to help or to try and soothe me or something, but she sat back in her room, basically ignoring me, which upset me even more. I told her I needed to go to the hospital, but she continued ignoring me. I finally went back and yelled at her, telling her "I wouldn't do that to you" if she were going through what I was and then she finally got up and started helping me. By then, the pain was so bad I couldn't even put on my own shoes and socks, she had to help me do that. We headed to for the hospital as soon as I was dressed and ready. We went to the one in Countryside thinking it'd be less crowded than the others. It was, but that still didn't prevent a 2 1/2 hour wait before I finally saw the doctor. I was in pain the whole time and I didn't like that they left me out there in that condition. They could've offered me a pillow or something, you know? After I finally got the call to be seen, I got put in a room and a nurse came and took 4 vials of blood from me. Shortly after, the doctor came in and looked me over for a few minutes. She said all she could do for me at this time was to give me some painkiller and some muscle relaxant. She said to try not to sit for extended periods of time (that's pretty much all I do at my job and at home) and to get some bed rest. She left and then the nurse came back in and medicated me. They gave me Morphine for the pain and I did not like that at all. It felt really weird. It seemed like it kicked in fast and I felt all flushed and anxious with pressure on my neck and head. Very weird feeling. After that, they had me lay in bed for awhile (I guess to make sure I didn't have a bad reaction to the Morphine). I watched Saturday Night Live on the TV in the room. Janet Jackson was hosting. Unfortunately, the Morphine didn't do much for me: I still felt the pain. Another nurse came in later and I told him I still felt pain. He said I shouldn't feel anything at all, but then he left and the other nurse came back few minutes later said I could go home. I was hoping they'd give me something else to kill the pain, but that didn't happen. We left around there around Midnight. We stopped off at McDonalds on the way home (I hadn't eaten since about 2pm) and then we came home and ate. I knew I shouldn't have had McDonalds, I feel crappy now. I am still feeling a lot of back pain too, maybe not entirely as intense as before, but it's still very present. Mom just went out to drop off my prescriptions at Walgreens. I don't know if she's going to pick my meds up tomorrow or if she's going to get them tonight. The sooner I get them the better. I need to go to bed, but if I have the same pain I did earlier, it's going to be a real struggle.

Friday Night Shopping Spree I went to the bank, signed for my loan, and then waited over at Atlanta Breads for Mom. After she arrived, we went over to Durango's and had dinner (she bought this week). I don't know if I'll go back there again. I had a big ribeye steak and the steak was great, but the rice that came with it was kind of bland, the Firecracker Shrimp we shared for an appetizer was a little too hot to enjoy, the caesar salad dressing was a little on the sour side, plus, they don't have any sweetened iced tea there! Sheesh! Between my back problems and complaining about my food, I'm really starting to sound like an old man, aren't I? Oy veh! After dinner, we stopped off at Pawn Depot but they had nothing worthwhile except for a couple pairs of Bose speakers and a couple of guitar pedals. I should go back and check out the speakers next week (after I get paid). I'm tired of listening to my stereo out of one speaker. The pedals they had were a Boss TU-2 tuner for $51 (a decent price) and a Heil Talk Box for $149. I've always wanted a talk box, but this one was missing the tubing and directions and I wasn't sure whether the price was very good or not. I asked if they could give me a better price and the guy said no. That place sure has changed. I used to be able to go in and get some killer deals from John and Gene, but not anymore. After there, we went on to Sam Ash and I bought my amp. It's still new in the box. I got it for a grand total of $781, a little less than I'd expected, which was nice. The sales guy was really friendly and helpful. He let me put $50 down on a new strat (rather than the usual 20% down). It's a beautiful sunburst Fender American Standard strat with a maple neck and it comes with a case. I think I got confused and laid away the wrong guitar though. I don't really like the bridge on the one I officially laid away. Maybe I'll have them order me a different one. I really like the neck on that one though. I guess the morale here is "don't go shopping while you're in severe pain because it's hard to think straight". After we left Sam Ash, we went to Best Buy and I bought the "This Is Spinal Tap" Special Edition DVD, and I also bought Fleetwood Mac's "Fleetwood Mac" and Television's "Marquee Moon", both remastered. We went home from there. During the day, I also made a few other purchases on eBay: a Teese RMC1 Wah for $149, and Ben Stiller and Janeane Garofalo's 2-CD audiobook (still sealed), "Feel This Audiobook", for just $7.99. I wanted to pick up Saga's "Worlds Apart" CD (remastered), but I missed bidding on it and they didn't have it at Best Buy. I guess I'm going to chill out tonight, go and rest my back up (it needs it especially after carrying the amp in). We may go out yard-saling tomorrow morning, we'll see how I'm feeling. At this point, it may be best to just stay at home and rest. I still may need to go to the doctor's tomorrow too (I held back enough money to do that if I had to). It's a "wait-and-see" situation.

Pain, Pain, Go Away Three days of missed work now and my back still feels no better. I may have to go to the doctor's tomorrow, which means I lose even more of my guitar money. Nice. I didn't call in to anyone either. I don't know how that's supposed to work when JP's not there (he's off today). More than half the company is off today so I don't think I'll get into trouble over it, though missing three days in a row is never good. I'm supposed to go out to the bank shortly to finalize my loan, and then Mom and I are going to stop at a couple of music stores to see if I can get a better deal on the amp I want than the one Stevie B's offered which was about $750. The most common price I see on them is $769, so $20 off is not a "great deal", no matter what they say. Plus, that price doesn't even include sales tax (making it over $800). Hell, I can get a lightly-used one on eBay somewhere in the $550-$650 range. I'm not 100% sure I want a Hot Rod DeVille either. It's a nice sounding amp and all, but it is so freaking heavy, and with my back problems, I think I might be better off with a lighter amp. I probably need to check out different amps rather than settling on the one I've used before. I may have a new amp in hand when I return tonight, but I might not either.

Still Hurting Last night was simply awful. I didn't go to bed until 5am, I couldn't sleep so I worked on Access awhile (trying to learn more). And then, after I finally made it to bed, I could not get comfortable enough to fall asleep. The sun was coming up this morning, I could hear Mom getting ready for work, and there I was, still lying awake in bed. Eventually I fell asleep, but not for very long. By 10:30am, I was out of bed again. I called JP to make sure he knew I wasn't coming in. I wasn't sure if got my message or not because his equipment wasn't here but the band money was gone. He called me back after a bit. He got the message I'd left on the door, he took the band money I'd left (he told me it wasn't necessary, but still, he took it), and he wanted to work on the upcoming set lists. My back was getting aggravated again from standing and sitting (I needed to go lay down again) but he wasn't taking the hint very well. He kept me on the phone for quite awhile. I've been sitting way too much today, mostly working on Access on the PC or surfing the net and buying things on eBay again. I really don't want to lay down though, it'd be beter for my back and all, but I know I'll fall asleep and that'd just screw me up when it came time to go to bed later tonight. I plan on going in to work tomorrow still, but it's still not definite. I told JP I wanted to go in tomorrow, but didn't know if I could. Losing two days of work, now, of all times, right when I need all the money I can get for my equipment, is just plain bad. Losing three would be a disaster.

Continuing Pain I missed yesterday due to back pain and now it looks like I'm going to miss another day of work (today) as well as my band practice (tonight). It doesn't even look good for Friday at this point. I don't know how well JP is going to take the news. I know it makes his job more difficult when I'm not there doing mine, but I hope he understands that I'm not taking calling in sick lightly. I'm having some heavy duty back spasms right now. Hell, I can't even stand up without having pain shoot through my lower back. Plus, it's about 3am and I still haven't slept either. Grrrr!!!! I knew things had been going too well, something bad was due to happen and sure enough, it did. I lost the hours that would have given me some spending money out of my next pay, and now, by missing work today, I lose out on some of the money that was to go toward my new guitar. I may have to wait a couple more weeks before I can finally buy my new guitar... *sigh* Before I go back to bed, I will need to write JP a note and leave it on the front door. Hopefully, I will be sleeping around the time he comes by to drop his equipment off. I just hope he's not a dick about it. I will leave him my share of the practice money too, just in case I'm not feeling better by then (it's too late for the band to cancel now). I repeat... life is wonderful.

Pain I knew I should have taken yesterday off from work (I wanted to but we had that repairman coming and I had to be there) because not doing so made my back much worse. Last night, trying to sleep was pure torture; no matter what position I'd lay in, even if it wasn't painful at first, the pain would soon come. I wound up barely sleeping all night long, then when it came time for me to get up, besides being half-asleep still, it was a physical struggle to move. I eventually made it out to the phone and called in for work. I went back to bed and I stayed in bed until maybe fifteen minutes ago. It's a little bit better now, still painful, but at least I was able to get out of bed and stand up without shooting pains. I'll need to eat lunch (I didn't have any breakfast) and then I guess I'll be laying back down again, resting up all I can today. I need to, because I really can't afford to take tomorrow off too. I need all the hours I can get at work right now due to the big musical equipment purchases I'm planning on making this week and next, so I really don't want to miss another day. I wish I didn't have to miss this one, now I won't have any spending money next payday (for CDs, DVDs, eating out, yard sales, Goodwill, movies, etc..). I should probably start listing stuff on eBay again this Saturday to help with that. Ahhh... life is wonderful.

Tuesday News First off, my goddamned back is freaking killing me. I don't know what I did to it, but as soon as I got up today, it started kicking my ass. The pain was so intense, I bent over to tie my shoes this morning and could only do one of them before I had to sit down. I've taken about 6 Aleves today (so far). Because of how slow moving I was, I wound up having to take the late bus in again (I got here about 9:25am). Not long after I got in, the repairman was here working on the computer that handles the phone lines. He was here until about lunchtime. After he left, I got caught up on my work and went down for some chow (another burger & fries). After lunch, I called my bank about the loan I was hoping to get (to buy musical equipment with). Good news: I got my bank loan approved and will have an extra $1,000 to use towards my amp and guitar... sweet! I have to go and sign for the loan on Friday afternoon and then I should be able to go and pick up my amp and a new wah pedal on Friday night. I'll have to wait until next payday to buy my guitar though, but I'll still have it in time for our gig on the 17th. Very cool! I had them make the loan a 6-month plan, they offered a 12-month plan, but I want it paid off as soon as possible since there's no telling how steady this job is. I guess I have to start looking for the best prices on everything now. Stevie B's had everything I wanted, but they're an official Fender dealer now so I don't think they're allowed to sell for much less than the list price. I'll have to check out Sam Ash and eBay as well (for the wah and amp, I'd never buy a guitar online). The bank loan was good news for sure, but I also got some bad news today as well: the whole sales floor has been given Friday off, however, I will still have to come in anyway, which really sucks because my job is supporting the sales floor. JP took Friday off too, so, yet again, there will be no training for me either, other than what I can figure out on my own. I'm going to be bored shitless. Grrrrr!!! I'm going to leave early though (to take care of my loan), so it won't be a full day of boredom, just about 6 1/2 hours worth.

A Crazy Day I went to bed early again last night, but still wound up not getting to sleep until about 1am. It was too warm in my room again. In the morning, I stayed in bed with the alarm going off for more than a half an hour. By the time I was supposed to leave for the bus stop, I was busy looking for my keys. It was obvious I wasn't going to make it out there on time, so I went in on the later bus and got to work around 9:30am. First off, JP called and said he wouldn't be in today because his kidney stone problem returned yesterday. He had me do some work for him over the phone, meanwhile, I noticed there were some PC problems and the clocks on the phone needed to be changed still. The PC problem was companywide, but one of the servers in my area (the phone room) is an important one that does all the reporting on phone statistics and it went wacko. I had to run back and forth between my room and the computer room asking for help all morning. I rebooted the PC, that didn't help, then they rebooted the PC and the result was the same. I thought they were going to come back and work on it, but they never did. It looks like the program was working out on the floor, but the display in the phone room was screwed up. Hopefully, all of the data is safe or it'll be a mess tomorrow. The other PC problem they had, the companywide one, was with the network. We couldn't print or access email for a while, which pretty much put me out of business. Luckily, they had that fixed by Noon, so I was able to get all of my work done by 3pm. I made a call and got a code to change the times on the phones, so that wasn't as big a thing as JP had led me to believe (he said I had to make back-ups of our servers and then shut down the phone switch and then boot it back up). All I did was put the code in, change the "9" to a "10" and hit enter... much easier. Later, after things mellowed out, I sat and listened to "The O'Franken Factor" from Noon til 3pm while I worked and ate lunch (taco salad). Later, Santana came by and we talked for about 30-40 minutes. His band is going to be playing the same Battle Of The Bands show we are, but on the following night. I spent the last couple hours of the day learning Access, practicing along with the book JP lent me. It's nice getting paid to learn. Oh, I received a late birthday present from the company today, a $25 gift certificate for Chili's. Pretty cool! Mom picked me up from work today (since I was locked out of the house) and she cooked salmon (pinwheels stuffed with crap) and rice for dinner. It was pretty good. I guess I'd better go, I need to do laundry and look for my keys. Time is whizzing by tonight.

Ahhh... Now I Remember! Now I remember why I hate this time of year: Daylight Savings Time. I don't have enough problems with sleep, now I get to lose an hour as well. Daylight Savings Time... who are the geniuses that came up with that concept? Thanks a bunch, you assholes! I got up around 11:30am this morning, which, in a sane world, would have meant I slept until 12:30pm. I played around on the PC for awhile, ate lunch, and played around on the PC awhile. Then, Mom came home from shopping and I carried the groceries in. Apparently, this caused a mini-adrenaline rush, because after I carried the last bag in, I went out and put a new clasp (the thing the door latches onto) out on the front porch. It's a really nice day out (nice and breezy) so I stayed out on the porch and organized all of the yard toys (badminton stuff, frisbees, baseballs, horseshoes, etc...) and then swept the porch off. After that, I let the cats come outside onto the porch. They're still out there enjoying themselves. I saw Jimmy chasing after a fly that was running around on the ground (after I'd flicked it off the screening) and Stevie was playing with a plastic golf ball last I checked. I still need to get the screens re-done and one of the grates needs to be patched so that they'll be safe (from escaping) out there. I don't know what I'm going to do with the rest of the day. I still need to fold and put away three loads of clothes and I still need to wash another load or two. So much for just "sitting at home and vegging out" the rest of the weekend.

Lately I've Been... Listening to: Nothing but tapes. I got two new Hendrix CDs for my birthday, but I haven't even opened them yet. At work, I've been listening to tapes by Blondie, The Cars, Alice Cooper, The Who, Lyle Lovett, Black Sabbath, Jeff Healey, Stevie Ray Vaughan, and others. At home, I listened to David & David today, as well as some Sheila E and Axe (anyone remember them? I didn't). That's what I like about getting all of these tapes, I listen to stuff I ordinarily wouldn't and I get to discover new music (even if it's old music). I guess I've been listening to the radio a bit too, but online. Everyday lately, I've been listening to urlLink Al Franken's radio show on urlLink Air America at work from Noon 'til 3pm. I especially enjoyed their live "coverage" of the Queen's drum solo the other day ("She's gone to the toms... very nice"). Great stuff! Watching on TV: "The Sopranos", "Fear Factor", "Everybody Loves Raymond", "Seinfeld", "Chappelle's Show", and some documentaries on the History Channel about Ancient Egypt. Downloading: Nothing still. Reading: Nothing still. Jamming: We practiced last Thursday and we practice again next Thursday. Saturday Stuff Well, I didn't go to bed early last night like I thought I would. I had been waiting for Mom to get home since she was stopping off at Walgreens and said she'd pick me up some tape storage cases, but she didn't get in until a little after 11pm. After she got in, I organized tapes in my room until sometime after Midnight, then finally went on to bed. I got up this morning around 9:45am. I had to get up to pee real bad, otherwise I would have stayed in bed longer. I was super congested this morning, coughing like crazy and nearly puking. My sinuses/allergies are awful right now. Not long after I got up, Mom was getting ready to go out (to the fabric store), and I wanted to go out too, so I got dressed in a hurry and we both went out. We stopped at a "yard sale" here in the park on our way out. It was an unusual yard sale in that everything was free . I picked up a walkman cassette player (Philco brand, looks ok, but I haven't tested it yet), an incense holder (a long wooden box), some extension cords (my band is talking about getting our own warehouse, so they may come in handy), and a brand new purple shower kit for Mom (still in the plastic). Pretty cool! We hit a bunch of yard sales in Clearwater, along Belcher, Keene, and Starkey, but I didn't buy much. I don't think Mom bought anything at all. I found a used baseball for a nickel, an Anne Rice book, "Taltos", for a quarter, a cassette storage case filled with loose tapes (no covers or cases) for $3, and I think that's it. A pretty weak haul, if I may say so myself. We were going to go over to our usual pawn shop but Mom suggested going to Salvation Army since she said they had a lot of tape stuff there. I found 3 tapes I wanted for $0.50 each: Rodney Dangerfield "No Respect", Boz Scaggs "Some Change", and INXS "Kick". I also found two more storage cases for $2 each. I was hungry and didn't really feel like going to the pawn shop right then, so we went to Red Lobster and chowed down. We split the appetizer, Mom had the scallops and I had the stuffed mushrooms and fried clams. They didn't have sweet tea, so I wound up having coke instead (my first since last weekend). I had a shrimp cocktail with my Caesar salad and for the main course, I had steak and lobster. My lobster was undercooked (again) and I had to send it back to cook some more. I hate that. After dinner, I had a frozen drink, a "Sunset Passion Colada". It had Malibu coconut rum and strawberry juice in it... it rocked. I could have had several more of them. The whole meal cost me about $85, a little more than I'd planned on spending, but what the hell. When I have money, I normally don't worry about how much stuff costs, which is good in some regards and bad in others. After our Romanesque feast, we went over to Goodwill and I bought 15 tapes (Barry White, Sting, several from Chicago, Alanis Morrisette, Billy Joel, Diana Ross & The Supremes, Maceo Parker, and others) for $0.50 each and I picked up 2 or 3 Stephen King softcover books and a Disney guide for $0.75 each. We headed home after that, it was getting too damned hot out. On the way, we stopped at Dunkin' Donuts and I got a Strawberry Coolada, which wasn't too bad. I've been working in my room, re-organizing tapes and stuff (I bought another new tape case at Walgreens while we were out today). I still need about 3 or 4 more new cases. They'll have to wait until next pay or the pay after that though, I'm pretty much tapped out. I keep wanting to list cards or tapes on eBay or else have a yard sale, but I keep putting everything off. I guess I'll do that stuff when I feel I need to . I don't really need to right now. I guess I'm just going to be sitting at home and relaxing the rest of this weekend. That , I need.
