In Limbo I finally talked directly to my sister about my nephews coming down and it looks like I'll have Jesse (my older nephew) for the whole week and Austin (my younger nephew) will be down just a few days (Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday). Of course, I don't know exactly when I'll be getting Jess. She said maybe tonight, maybe tomorrow. It sure would be nice to know ahead of time, but I guess that's asking too much. When I had her on the phone, trying to get a definite answer from her, she said she'd call me back. That was an hour ago, so I'm still waiting for an answer. I'm going to have to find things to do with them away from here. It's been hot as Hell in the house lately now, even with the A/C on. After last night, I thought I'd be sleeping in most of the day today, but by 2pm, I had to get out of bed because I couldn't stand the heat anymore. I didn't sleep too well. After I got up, and after Mom got home (she was out running errands), I asked her if she wanted to go out for lunch, my treat (like I have plenty of money to spend). We went over to the Lone Star steakhouse. I had an order of jalapeno poppers (cheddar & bacon) and a bowl of chili (which was awesome), with some sweet iced tea to drink, and was in heaven. Mmm-mm good! I was about full just from that, but I'd also ordered a Flat-Iron Peppercorn Steak with a Caesar Salad and fries. I'd never had that kind of steak before, it was really good, better than I'd expected. By the time I finished my steak, I was so stuffed that I couldn't even finish my salad or my fries. We thought about going to Goodwill, but I said "nah". Even though I spent almost $50 on lunch for us today, I'm still actually concerned about my finances and am trying to spend as little as possible. I don't know how I can justify spending that much on a meal when I refuse to spend $15 on a CD I want. I guess it's because I can buy a CD anytime, but I won't always be able to share a meal with my Mom. I'm really big on spending quality time with the people that matter most to me, family and friends, since I really don't expect to live a long, full life. Which is another anti-religion argument I brought up with JP last night (we argued over religion for a good half hour), that people would be much happier if they lived for today, rather than some afterlife that may not even exist. Maybe people would value each other more if they knew that the life they have before them right now is the only life they will get. Anyhoo... so that's where I'm at right now.

Stolen Money JP arrived to pick me up around 5:30pm tonight but I wasn't quite ready to go yet. We didn't leave here until 6pm (even though the gig wasn't until 8pm). Good thing too, because after we got unpacked and started setting up, JP and Al discovered that JP's P.A. head had pretty much up and died on us. We tried using the one they had there, but it didn't work either. Luckily, JP had just bought an amplifier for his monitors, so we used that instead. It saved our asses, but it also meant that we couldn't use the monitors anymore, and not being able to hear each other very well... well, that lead to a lot of problems. The bar had quite a bit of people there, at least 30 regulars, and Jimmy brought in another 10-15 people. It was a pretty small place, so it was actually a pretty decent crowd. We started playing around 8:20pm, after we waited for a few more people to arrive. We played: "Love The One You're With", "Stuck In The Middle", "Something More", "The Breakup Song", "Hanging By A Moment" (I came in alone, with heavy chorus, but JP didn't follow me and basically we had to start the song from the beginning, went ok otherwise), "Yesterdays Girl" (I played pretty sloppily on this one, as a matter of fact, I was pretty sloppy throughout the night), "The Middle", "Badge" (Al completely forgot the bass intro, I had to walk him through it onstage), "Opportunity Knocks", "American Girl" (I was a bit sloppy on this one), "Crazy Little Thing Called Love", "The Curtain Falls" (started off pretty messy, never really got any better), "Blister In The Sun" (JP's acoustic was way too low, all night actually), "Before You Accuse Me" (Jimmy didn't end it in the right spot and it got extended even longer than usual, which is just too long), "The Difference" (I completely blanked out on the main riff to this song, it's like it disappeared from my memory altogether... pitiful), "Promise You The Moon", "Wild Night", "Feelin' Alright", "The Authority Song" (Jimmy didn't end it quite right, drug it out too long too, otherwise, it was ok) and "Desire" (JP wanted to skip this one, but Jimmy and I wanted to do it, which was a mistake... JP skipped section before the solo, which I, of course, went into before realizing that he'd skipped it... ugh!). Most of the songs went over pretty well, but we weren't real happy with what we played (obvious from my notes). We had people dancing a few times, but JP followed my set list straight through, instead of moving songs around to fit the mood, so we kept losing the crowd when we could've kept them into us. I guess that's something that'll come with experience. My Mom, her friend from work, and her friend's husband showed up somewhere between "The Difference" and ""Wild Night". I sat with them between sets. Some drunk dude there kept coming over, talking to us. He wound up buying them all drinks! My favorite part of his visit was when he started talking about having been in a "fucking gang" (a motorcycle gang, actually) in front of my Mom. I'll bet she really enjoyed that... not! We got back up after a prolonged break (about 30 minutes), and we played "Happy Birthday" (there were two or three birthdays). For some reason, the crowd really didn't participate as much as we thought they would. After that, we launched into our second set: "Old Apartment", "You May Be Right", "We Don't Need Much", "Circle", "Cold Shot", "Should I Stay Or Should I Go" (I broke a string at the very end of this one so I had JP play "Everyday" while I quickly put a new one on), "Sleeping Forever" (I wasn't quite ready yet, so JP played the intro over and over, ad nauseum, while I finished putting the string on and tuned up), "Safe In My Arms" (I played it in the key I wrote it in, but not the key we normally play it in... d'oh!), "All For You", "I Got Loaded" (JP got lost during the solo section again... it was pretty bad), "The House Is A-Rockin" (JP walked off so I had to improvise several more solos, some ok, some not, not knowing when he'd be jumping back in... it didn't make me happy), "Rockin' In The Free World", "I Wanna Be Sedated" (really damned sloppy, all around). We definitely were not playing as well as we're capable of. It was pretty embarrassing. We were all fucking up here and there. Strangely, everyone was telling how good we sounded and complimenting us a lot. That stuff's hard to figure out. Mom and her friends split between these sets. We took another long break before we went into our last set. Most everyone had cleared out by then, or were getting ready to go. We played: "(What's So Funny 'Bout) Peace, Love & Understanding", "Come On Let's Go" (JP forgot to sing the chorus after the solo so we didn't know where to end because he added that part in again later), "Steal My Kisses" (Jimmy forgot to go to the cymbals for the choruses), "The Way" (very sloppy), "Sunshine Of Your Love" (sloppy, then I aborted the jam at the end, which threw everybody off), "Better", "Fell In Love With A Girl" (I started this before realizing that JP hadn't switched guitars yet, then he didn't sing the section after the solo, and again, added it in later, after the rest of us had ended the song!), "I'm Tore Down" (sloppy), "Rock This Town" (Jimmy played this one faster and/or jazzier than usual... I played terribly on this one), "You Can't Run", "Go Your Own Way" (this one started off ridiculously bad; Jimmy came in on the wrong beat, completely out of sync... we actually had to stop the song and start all over again... pathetic). JP skipped over a couple of songs from this last set. He had a migraine again and I guess he was ready to go. It'd been a long, trying night (which I taped). Musically, it wasn't a very good gig, one of our worst actually. Not having monitors really crippled us. Surprisingly, we got asked back. They want us back next month. Unbelievable. And, we got paid, $75 each. On top of that, one of the customers there gave Jimmy $20 to split with the band. He said he tried to give it back but the man refused, so we actually ended up with $80 each. The people there were great. Like I told Al, I feel like I just stole the money. It certainly doesn't feel like I earned it. Now, you'd think, after a gig like this, that we're going to go and practice even harder, right? Nope, not us. The guys wanted to take next week off because we'd played twice this week. That sucks ! I guess I'll have to do some practicing on my own. By the way, we're still trying to get the next dates confirmed with our "usual" club, so at the moment, we don't have anything definite lined up. On the way home, JP and I stopped by my old workplace so he could drop off his P.A. equipment. For some reason, we wound up arguing about religion all the way to my house. I think having a baby is making him re-think a lot of things. I just don't think instilling religion in a child, especially when you don't even believe that stuff yourself, just to establish some kind of "moral base", just isn't right. It's lazy parenting. Why allow a church to tell your children what is right and wrong when you can do that yourself? Besides, it's like I told him, what's wrong with telling a child "I don't know"? What's so wrong with telling them the truth, that no one knows and anyone who says they do is just fooling themselves? Is it really better to ignore facts in favor of a system of "beliefs"? And what's so wrong with giving the child a chance to grow up first, to let them decide what is real and what isn't, when they're old enough to reason for themselves, rather than having religion embedded into their minds while they're at their most impressionable? Isn't the whole concept of being "saved" supposed to based on "freewill"? Where's the freewill if a child is taught all along that "this is the way"? I guess I shouldn't be surprised, hypocrisy is nothing new when it comes to religion.

I watched TV on and off all day and night. I didn't really watch much of anything though. Mostly I was busy doing stuff around the house. I also cleaned the computer area, the kitchen counter, the dining room table, and the litter box. I even took out the trash... twice. Not too bad for a slacker. I guess that'll be my next post, the rundown on how the gig went.

Band Practice I slept in really late today, until nearly 4pm. I had gone to bed late last night (around 4:30am) and then I started reading after I got in bed (Stephen King's "Night Shift"). I got up, watched "Judge Judy", cooked dinner, and then went in and practiced on guitar a bit. After that, I took a shower and waited on JP. After we got packed up, we headed out to practice. He was playing a CD in his car that sounded really good. It was by a band called Audioslave, which I knew nothing about (I'd thought they were some kind of techno dance band). I couldn't even tell it was Chris Cornell singing, his voice sounds so much better than I'd remembered. It was a real productive practice, mainly because we didn't do any jamming or anything. We ran through a lot of songs tonight, including these covers: "The Breakup Song", "Come On Let's Go", "Should I Stay Or Should I Go", "Desire", "Hanging By A Moment", "Badge", "Crazy Little Thing Called Love", "The Authority Song", "The Difference", "Feelin' Alright", "I Got Loaded", "The House Is A-Rockin", "Fell In Love With A Girl", "I'm Tore Down", and "Rock This Town". We also ran through these originals: "Opportunity Knocks", "Something More", "The Curtain Falls", "Safe In My Arms" (the new one I wrote), "Had A Girl", and "Better". We also ran through The Beatles' "Birthday". There's supposed to be a birthday party going on with some of Jimmy's friends, so we wanted to do a birthday song. It sounded ok, but without the vocal harmonies (a weakness with us), it came out a bit flat. We'll probably go with "Happy Birthday" instead. After practice we talked about the gig and compromised on the set and break lengths. It won't be as long as JP and I planned it, but it won't be quite as short as Al wanted. We'll do an 80-minute lead off set and then two 60-minute sets with two 20-minute breaks in between the sets. That'll work. After I got home and had dinner, I started re-working the sets. I finished up a while ago and emailed them out to the guys. We should be good to go. Oh, earlier today I talked to my older nephew, Jesse, and he said he wanted to come down next week. I gave him a couplke outs, but he said he wanted to come down, so that's cool. We should have a blast. I'm still not sure if his brother will be down or not; he's usually ready to go home after a day or two.

Couch Potatoland I went to be around 3am last night and I got up around 12:30pm today (I'd been sort of awake for awhile though). I woke up after I heard someone walking through the house and then, a few moments later, the lawn people started mowing and trimming and shit. It was Mom that I'd heard in the house; she stayed home from work today. I'd actually asked her about taking today off a few days ago, for me, to take me around loooking for a job, but I guess she had her own shit to do because I didn't get to go anywhere. Instead, I watched TV, surfed the net, played "Age Of Empires", did some cleaning in my room, watched still more TV, cleaned some more, took the trash out, cleaned the litter box, surfed the net some more and watched still more TV. What I didn't do today was practice. I have a gig in less than 48 hours, a long one, and I've barely practiced at all. Speaking of the gig, I got an email from Al today (after I'd sent him the set lists for the gig) and he said he didn't plan on playing more than 3 hours total, a 1/2 hour less than what we planned on and agreed to. Apparently he has a long workday that day, plus he doesn't seem to think much of the place we're playing anyway. Oh well, at least we'll be getting paid as well as getting a little more experience. It's getting late and my bed is covered with junk (from my cleaning), so I'm outta here.

More Well I'm feeling a little better every day now; finally getting some of my momentum back. I'm still not sure what I'm going to do about a job yet, but I am pondering several ideas, such as working nights at a restaurant or something. I hate being a "day person" and I really hate dressing up, and I figure if I'm not going to make much money anyway, I might as well be comfortable. I went to bed early last night, around Midnight, and I worked on the set lists for about an hour. I tried to go to sleep, but by 3am, I was wide awake. I got up and watched TV for awhile ("Sherlock Holmes Mysteries" and a documentary on John Gotti). It was about 5am before I made it to bed. I slept until about 9:30am and then I started getting an upset stomach and made a couple of emergency trips to the bathroom. I had a rough time sleeping after that and wound up staying in bed til about 4:30pm. After I got up, I typed up the set lists into an excel spreadsheet and mailed it out to the guys, went out and got the mail (my Maria McKee CD arrived), and then I cooked dinner for Mom and I (steaks with salads and tater tots). That's about the most productive I've been for a week or two. Seriously. I talked to JP tonight and he said he got my paycheck problem taken care of at my ex-job. My next (and last) check should be for 24 hours, about $200 net, which will help me out immensely. I tried to practice a little tonight, but I didn't feel much like playing for some reason. I need to learn "Birthday" by the Beatles (for the gig... I half know it already). I need to re-string my guitar too. I'll probably do that tomorrow. I'm going to try and get to bed early again tonight, like 2 or 3am. I'd like to be getting up by Noon every day, 4:30pm is a little too late. It's still looking like I'll have my nephews down all next week, so I'll need to be up earlier in the day for them anyway. I should have $75 on Friday (from the gig) so I may have a little bit of money for when they're down. I'd like to take them out to the beach or to a park or something. They like riding the bus, so it'll work out fine... if they actually come down. With them, you never know.

A Little More Up I stayed up really late last night playing Age Of Empires II, before I knew it, it was after 6am and the sun was out. I went to bed, but instead of going to sleep, I finished reading the SNL book. It was just before 10am when I finally hit the sack. I thought I'd probably sleep all day, well into the night, but I was back up around 3:30pm. I woke up feeling a little more "up", not happy and refreshed or anything, but not as severely depressed as I had been all week. I'd wanted to go up to my sister's in-law's house today but my Mom said my sister wasn't going. Turns out, they went after all. Nice. I think it would have lifted my spirits quite a bit. Instead, I sat here eating, watching TV, and playing Age Of Empires. This afternoon, I did do something productive though: I started working on the set lists for our upcoming, 4-hour, gig. I haven't finished yet, I was waiting on word from JP about a couple of songs (whether or not to include them). I don't think we have quite enough material. We may have to extend some solos and maybe even do a little jamming... cool with me. Besides having unfinished set lists, I haven't practiced at all lately, not since last Monday's practice, which is not good. I also haven't taken care of my unemployment insurance, also, not good. I haven't cleaned the grill, I haven't finished cleaning my room, nor have I folded and put away my clean clothes yet... I'm a friggin' mess. I'm going to try and go to bed at a decent time tonight, and hopefully, start looking for a job and/or taking care of things at home. I may have both of my nephews down next week, for the whole week, so I'd like to get as much done as possible before they get here. Unfortunately, I don't have any money, so I'll have to be creative and think up a lot of "no-cost fun". By the way, kick-ass "Sopranos" tonight; very intense and exciting. The actress who played Adrianna is on the new "Friends" spin-off, "Joey", so I knew she'd be going soon. Wow.

Lately I've Been... Listening to: Hmmm... well, I listened to the new Los Lobos CD a couple of times, but that was earlier in the week. I haven't been listening to much of anything lately. Watching on TV: Saturdays: "Saturday Night Live"; Sundays: "The Sopranos"; throughout the week: "The People's Court", "The Simpsons", "Everybody Loves Raymond", "Seinfeld", and "King Of Queens". I watched the "Jeff Corwin Experience", "The Croc Hunter Diaries" and "Wild West Tech" (about Native American technology) earlier today, and I watched a movie, "Mary Shelley's Frankenstein", earlier in the week. Downloading: Right now, I'm trying to find some National Lampoon stuff, but I'm not having much luck. Sadly, I've never heard any of the National Lampoon albums. Reading: I've been reading "Live From New York" by Tom Shales and James Andrew Miller... again. I had won the book on eBay awhile back, but I received the older version rather than the newer, expanded, version (which is the one I was supposed to have been bidding on) and read that one off and on in the bathroom. Now I have the expanded version, also won on eBay, and have been reading that for the past few days. I'm about 3/4 of the way through it. Jamming: We practiced on Monday and don't practice again until Wednesday, our last practice before our 4-hour gig on the 28th. I'm suppossed to come up with a set list for the gig, but I just haven't felt much like doing anything lately, so I still need to do that. I haven't practiced at all either, which I also should be doing. Working: No job. I don't even feel up to looking for one. Buying: Nothing. Selling: Nothing yet. Eating: Nothing healthy. We had Sonnys for lunch/supper tonight (ribs, sliced pork, fries, garlic toast, coleslaw). Last night I ate two TV dinners, fish with macaroni & cheese. Snacking on honey-roasted peanuts in between meals. During the week I ate pretty much the same meal for days: a big-ass cheeseburger (no bun) with that green bean/onion/bacon stuff that Mom makes. Feeling: Mentally, depressed as can be. I've totally had the wind taken out of my sails. Physically, tired. Planning: Why bother?

Doom And Gloom I've been spiritless for a few days now, just no life in me at all, just very depressed. Yesterday, I stayed in bed and read off and on all day long. Today, I played "Age Of Empires" most of the afternoon. I was a little productive tonight though, I finally made a list of the tapes I have to sell (about 1,000 of them). That took almost all night to do. In fact, I just finished a few minutes ago. Oh, and it looks like we won't be going up to my sister's in-law's house now... my sister isn't getting along with her mother-in-law and my brother-in-law doesn't get along well with one of his brothers, who'll be there. I guess I'm stuck here all weekend now... *sigh* I don't have much else to say. I guess I'm heading to bed.

Not Much To Say The last two days have been pretty quiet. I've been going to bed around 3am-4am everyday and sleeping past Noon... falling back into my night-owl ways. Last night, I watched "Mary Shelly's Frankenstein", in full, finally (I caught a bit of it before on basic cable, heavily edited), but I can't say it was worth the wait. I don't think DeNiro was right for the part, especially in the physical sense. I swear I heard a little "New Yawk" in his accent too. The book was better. Today, I cleaned a little here and there (in the dining room and in my bedroom), started some laundry (two loads), but mostly I spent my time watching TV and playing "Age Of Empires 2". I don't feel like doing much of anything. I'm still pretty depressed about losing my job. I feel like I've lost the will to live, and I don't necessarily mean dying, I mean just going forward from here, starting all over... again. It all seems so futile anymore. I feel like a plane that's always getting shot down before it even had the chance to get airborne. It'd be nice to have some friends around, someone to talk to or do things with, but all of my friends have either moved away, gotten married, or are too self-absorbed to care about anyone else but themselves. I'm just glad I still have the band, otherwise, who knows what sorry state I'd be in. Mom and I were invited to go up to my sister's in-laws this weekend, I think I'm going to go. Hopefully, that'll cheer me up some. I sure as hell need it.

Bastards! I took a look at my paycheck last night, and to my (unpleasant) surprise, they shorted me 8 hours (my "floating holiday pay", the only benefit I could actually use). They had already shorted me the extra 16 hours severance pay (which was supposed to have been corrected) and now this. Nice. I called up today and the lady that handles payroll said she thought that she'd put the holiday pay on my check, but realized then that she hadn't. I said "I guess the next check will be for 24 hours then" and she said that no one has given her any paperwork on the severance pay yet. What a bunch of assholes. JP went to see her boss last week and he was supposed to have taken care of that. But still, this lady works only 15 feet from the boss' office, all she has to do is ask him if it's ok to pay me the 16 hours severance pay, but no, she said JP (my boss there) has to go through Human Resources and have them fill out paperwork telling her to pay me for the 16 hours. There are only a few people left at the fucking place, what's with all of the goddamned beaurocracy? And speaking of beaurocracy, I am in the process of filing for unemployment... for the first time in my life. I really don't like that I'm having to do it, but I need all the help I can get right now. Between the bank loan for my amplifier (I owe over $800 on that, $173 a month), the Emergency Room visit (I owe over $1,050 for that, part to the hospital and part to the ER doctor), and the guitar that I laid away (I have $588 left to pay on that... by July 1st), all of which I took on before I knew I was going to be laid off, there couldn't have been a worse time to lose my job. They really screwed me good, and they continue screwing me with the paycheck hassles. Bastards.

Monday Night Band Practice I just got back from practice, it went ok. The first hour there was pretty much spent setting up JP's P.A. and trying to get the monitors to work (they never did get workin'). After we got up and running, we ran through all of our newer additions: "Come On Let's Go", "The Breakup Song", "Should I Stay Or Should I Go", "Badge" (we worked on this one awhile, getting the timing down), and "You Wanted More". "You Wanted More" is still pretty rough, not sure if we'll play it on the 28th or not. We ran through some of our older covers like "Before You Accuse Me", "American Girl", "Crazy Little Thing Called Love", "All For You", and "Blister In The Sun". We also did a handful of originals: "Circle", "The Curtain Falls", "Promise You The Moon", and "What She Likes". We also ran through the new one from last week, with the new lyrics and melody I came up with, which replaced JP's. The song is called "Safe In My Arms". I'm not sure whether or not Al gets some of the writing credit for it though. JP said I came up with the whole song and Al just followed, but it seems to me like Al went to Dm after my verse music and I took it from there. Since the song is in Am and it's kind of a blues, going to Dm would be the natural progression, but still, I don't want to take full credit for it if Al deserves some. I'm listening to it right now, on tape (I recorded most the practice), and I think we played it a little too slow tonight. We need to tighten it up a bit in places too and maybe add some stops. I'm hoping we'll have it together in time for the next gig. We also jammed on another one of mine, but it didn't get worked on at all. In fact, JP just kept repeating "fried chicken" over the whole thing. That was about it for jamming tonight. Mostly we got down to business, practicing for the next gig. Well, that's not entirely true, I mean we did goof off between songs and whatnot. On the way there, JP and I stopped at a gas station and I bought a 6-pack of Heineken. I hadn't eaten since early in the day (well, early for me) so it only took 1 beer to get me semi-buzzed. I drank two full beers and had about 1/4 of a third one... that's a lot for me (I'm not much of a drinker anymore). We practice again next Wednesday, last practice until the gig. Oh! JP has to drive to Atlanta this week and he asked about me going along, a mini-road trip. I think he said it'd be from Wednesday to Saturday and all I'd have to pay for is my own food and drinks. I think we'd have a pretty good time but I just don't think I can afford to do it right now. I'm thinking about it though. I'd love to get the fuck out of Florida, even for a couple of days. I guess we'll see what transpires.

Wars & Chores I was only planning on being up until about 3am, but then I started a game of Age Of Empires II, and before I knew it, the sun was out. Ugh! I didn't get to bed until around 7am ! Not good, but at least I won the game. I woke up around 1:30pm this afternoon, cold and cat-bothered. I could've used some more sleep, but I'm glad that I didn't sleep too late (like 4-5pm). So far today, I ate lunch, watched "The People's Court", called JP and asked him to bring my paycheck with him when he comes by tonight (band practice), read the newspaper, perusing the classified ads for a job (nothing for me), and surfed the net a bit. There's a lot of stuff I need to be doing, a huge list of things, but I keep putting it all off. I have about two and a half hours until I leave for practice, so I guess I'd better go and try to get something done.

Holy Cow! A Productive Sunday! Stevie woke me up around 10am this morning and I got up. I gave the cats another worm pill. I haven't seen any all day, on either cat, so it looks like the pills worked. Not too long after I got up, I started working on my eBay store items. I had a lot of updating and editing to do.... very tedious work. I actually just finished a few minutes ago, Man, it's been a long day. I took breaks in between for lunch (Mom and I ran to Burger King and Arbys) and for dinner (I cooked burgers out on the grill for us). Later, I stopped for about an hour to watch "The Sopranos". Very strange episode tonight. It seems like everytime something big is going to happen, Tony has a dream episode like this one. Unfortunately, there's only two episodes left this season, it'll probably end with a cliffhanger, and then it'll be another year or two before they air new episodes again... *sigh* I talked to JP earlier tonight, told him I'd written lyrics and came up with a new melody for the song we started the other night. The only thing I still need to work on is a bridge. I have an idea for it, but it still has to be written. We practice late tomorrow, an extra hour, so I guess I'd better stay up late again tonight; I don't want to start getting sleepy during practice. I have plenty to do, I suppose (laundry, cleaning my room, house cleaning, working on a set list for the 5/28 (4-hour) gig, scanning, pulling, and listing cards and tapes for eBay, etc... Knowing me, I'll probably just watch TV or read until I'm sleepy... The King of Procrastination lives!

Sleepy Saturday I didn't sleep too well last night, too cold (that new fan really kicks ass). I didn't get up until sometime after 11am. I got my mailings ready (a package and a bill), then around Noon, I ate some lunch (leftover Chicken Divan) and then crashed on the couch for a few hours. While I was sleeping, Mom ran out to the post office and to Office Depot, so I didn't have to go anywhere today, which is good, because when I'm out, I tend to spend money and I can't afford to do much of that right now. I don't know if it was the position I was laying in (fairly uncomfortable) or if it was just my allergies/sinusus acting up again (they've been really bad lately), but I started getting a wicked headache. I eventually got up, took some Aleve, and then went to my room and crashed again. I was in bed until well after 5pm. I didn't have a headache anymore, so that was good. I sat out on the couch awhile, watching TV and talking to the cats, and discovered that Stevie has worms again. Ick! I hate that shit! Nasty! Mom made stuffed salmon for dinner (with rice) and after dinner, I made coffee for us. A little later, Mom ran out for worm medicine and I went to my room to start cleaning some more. It's still a big mess. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and met up with a huge fucking roach... again. The lady just sprayed here yesterday, I guess he was immune to it. Anyway, I hauled ass out to the kitchen, grabbed some Raid, came back, and totally douched that sonofabitch with the Raid. I sprayed him so much that it was choking me! Ugh! Worms and roaches, hell of a night so far. Later on tonight, it started raining, pouring (even though all the weather sites I looked at said 20% chance), so I took my guitar out on the porch (I love the rain). Last night, I started working on new lyrics for the new song we came up with the other night at practice. I don't know how well that's going to go over since JP put lyrics to it already. I told him that night that I thought the lyrics didn't seem to fit the music very well. See, he had the lyrics pre-written and when we started jamming, he tried to adapt them to the new song, and to me, they feel forced, like they don't really belong there. I like mine much more, which is rare, because I generally don't like the lyrics I write. I think my melody and chorus are better too, hopefully he'll be ok with what I've written and everything will be ok. I guess Al and I would be credited as the songwriters then. Anyway, I was out on the porch playing that song and I also came up with another new one, another blues. I really need to start working harder on my own stuff. I think I could put together a really good, solid, album of all original material. I know I can do it, but I'm not doing anything to help me do what needs to be done. Besides finishing songs I've started, I'll need to start looking for musicians to play with, which means I will need my own car to get back and forth from practices and gigs, which means I'll need a job to pay for said car. And that's the frustrating part, finding a job that'll pay well, that'll allow me to work days/no weekends, that is on a direct bus route, that is semi-casual, and that will hire an ugly, badling, fat guy. It won't be easy. I'm thinking of taking a couple of weeks off from the job hunt to finally get rid of all of the basketball cards and extra tapes I have lying around here. I'll need to make lists everything I have, then I'll need to start listing everything on eBay. I may put an ad in the paper and just sell off everything I have left in one big lot. I'd like to try and get some decent money for everything, but I'd also be happy to have everything gone, no matter what I get for it. I have a little time now to figure it all out, so that's what I'm going to do. Also, my nephews will be out of school after next Tuesday and then their summer camp won't start for a week and a half, so I may have them both down here for a week or two. It'll be a handful, but as long as they aren't fighting with each other, it could be a lot of fun. I'm looking forward to the exercise I'll get with them down. SNL will be coming on soon, so I'm outta here.

Lately I've Been... Listening to: Not much this week. Watching on TV: About the same as last week, only with more daytime TV in the mix. Sundays: "The Sopranos"; Mondays: "Fear Factor" and "Everybody Loves Raymond"; during the weekday: "People's Court", "Judge Mathis" and "Columbo"; all week long: "The Simpsons", "Everybody Loves Raymond", and "Seinfeld". Downloading: I downloaded a bunch of Pink Floyd stuff during my last day at work, some Billy Connolly and Richard Pryor too. Reading: This week, I started and finished Al Franken's book "Rush Limbaugh Is A Big Fat Idiot", which was both funny and insightful. He points out so many Right Wing lies, dirty tricks, and hypocracies in the book that it's a bit troubling as well. I'm not surprised that that kind of stuff is going on mind you, but that so many people are actually buying into the lies. Very troubling. Comedian Alan King died this past week, which reminded me that I have a book of his lying around, unread for years, called "Help! I'm A Prisoner In A Chinese Bakery!". I started reading it last night. It was probably very funny in 1964 (when it was written), but 40 years later, it just isn't working for me (two chapters in and I haven't laughed yet). Jamming: We practiced yesterday and I blogged about it (see post below). JP is going out of town next week, so we're practicing again on Monday since he won't be around to do it on Thursday. Working: I put in my last two days this week. (*sigh*) I'm still not quite over the whole "getting-laid-off" thing. I think I've kind of been in shock for the past week. And now, to make matters worse, I called there today to ask about me picking my check up on Monday (rather than them mailing it to me) and I learned that they never put the two paid days they promised me on my paycheck. They were supposed to pay me for yesterday and today. I think it was actually JP's responsibility to make sure payroll knew about it, but he didn't tell them and no one else did either. I called him and he said they'll put it on a check and I'll have it in a few weeks. I guess that's ok, I'm sure I'll need it then. Buying: When I get depressed, I tend to spend money, even if I really don't have any extra to spend. This past week I bought two more tape storage cases, a new fan, some more tapes, a CD, and a complete set (Series 6) of Homies. I really don't know why I bought the Homies though. I mean, I like them and all, but I certainly didn't need to buy them, especially now, after losing my job. Besides that, if I'd have looked around, I could've gotten them cheaper than I did. It was definitely an impulse buy and a dopey one at that. Selling: I sold one card this week and I started going through the tapes I have to sell, making a list of what all I have. I'm going to start listing again soon. Eating: Nothing healthy. Chicken Divan, a barbecue chicken/cheesy baked potato TV dinner, cereal (Honeycombs and Sugar Smacks), liver and onions, mashed potatoes and gravy, a delmonico steak, hash browns, oatmeal cookies... like I said, nothing healthy. Feeling: Mentally, worried about the future. Physically, tired as usual. Planning: I need a job. I need a car. I need a life.

Band Practice I got up around 11am today. I'd slept ok last night, for the most part. I watched TV for awhile ("People's Court" & "Judge Mathis") and then I started working on my tapes, mixing in the new additions and the ones I brought home from work, and then making a list of what I have. I plan on listing them on eBay very soon, probably in lots of 10. I did that until about 6:20pm. I ate a small TV dinner for supper, got ready to go out, packed my gear after JP arrived, and then we headed for practice. It was a very productive practice tonight. We even came up with a new song on the spot (Am-Dm-E7... almost blues, almost reggae). I'm not sure whether or not it was Al or I who started it, we both added parts to it along the way and then JP added lyrics, so I guess we all kind of wrote it. We also went over the new covers we're adding to our repertoire: "You Wanted More", "Should I Stay Or Should I Go", "Badge", "Rock 'N Me" (this one may be out of JP's range), "The House Is A Rockin", "The Breakup Song", and "Come On Let's Go". We also ran through a few other covers ("The Way", "I Got Loaded", & "The Authority Song") and a few originals as well ("Better", "Yesterday's Girl" & "We Don't Need Much"). I started playing some of my stuff but it didn't even get jammed on this time, just kind of ignored. That reminds me, I called a drummer/singer last night about an ad he placed in a musician's classified section online and we talked a little. He was looking for a guitar player to form a blues band with and I called to see what was going on with his situation. I was thinking about putting a second band together so I could finally have an outlet for my own music and in hopes that I could work more as a musician, rather than getting another dead end job. I don't think anything will come of it though, he wasn't very interested (he didn't like the idea of me splitting time between two bands) and I wasn't real comfortable with the whole "singing drummer" thing. I think it's going to be hard to find the situation I want anyway, but because I don't have a car and am unable to provide my own transportation, it may be near impossible. Anyhoo... Jimmy got us booked for a gig on the 28th, a Friday. We'll play from 8-12 (four hours!?) and we'll have to supply our own P.A. equipment (JP has a P.A. system), but we're getting $300 for the gig. I suggested we use that money to get a press kit together (photo, info, etc..). JP talked to a booker and she said she needed that stuff to get us more, and better-paying, gigs. The other big news of the night: JP's going to be a dad. I guess the baby's due in January (he said he needed January off from playing out). He'll be a good dad, and I just know his parents are going to spoil the kid silly. Jimmy's taking August off for the same thing, his third child. I hope we start having some success soon, because, even though I'm happy for the guys, I'm worried that they just won't be able to devote the time into the band that they can now (once or twice a week, which ain't much). Myself, I'd love to play 4 or 5 times a week. I need a job and a car... badly.

Liverized Mom called me at work around 4:30pm asking what I felt like for dinner, jokingly I said "liver", and then she said "ok". She picked me up from work and we went back to that place we went to last night (the one I said I was in no hurry to return to) and I had liver and onions for dinner. It was good and I left there with a full stomach. Not bad for $5.99. Man, I burned 9 CDs for myself today, almost all Pink Floyd stuff that I'd always been meaning to check out. I also burned a couple comedy CDs, for myself and for JP. And now, I'm officially unemployed.

Last Day On The Job I slept terribly last night, not sure how much sleep I got, but it didn't feel like much. I started reading Al Franken's book "Rush Limbaugh Is A Big Fat Idiot... And Other Observations" before bed, so I went to bed later than usual, which didn't help my sleep any (funny book though). I got on the bus today and it was completely empty except for this one cute girl who's been riding it the past two weeks. I wish I had the confidence to speak to her, but I'm just not one of those guys. I mean, I still live at home, I just lost my job, obviously I have no car, I'm in debt up to my ears, and I haven't even gotten to the balding, fat guy thing, so I don't have any reason to be confident about anything, you know? Therefore, I said nothing. She probably would have thought I was just some "creepy guy on the bus" if I'd have said anything to her anyway. Oh well. It's been another quiet day again here at work. I am bored to death and ready to go the fuck home. There just isn't shit to do. I've already surfed the net about all I'm going to, I ate already (was supposed to go out to lunch with JP, but he couldn't make it after all), I listened to the O'Franken Factor already, I have music downloading (early Pink Floyd stuff) right now, burned a few already, and I'm sitting here now, typing this. I'm doing all I can from falling asleep at my desk. I talked to the temp staffer here earlier today, and he said he was going to look into this one part-time job for me. It's only 20 hours a week, Monday through Thursday, but he didn't know what the hours were or what the pay is. I'll probably just look for stuff on my own and go to him as a last resort. To be honest, I'd really like to see if I could make a living selling stuff at the flea market or on eBay. I haven't had much luck in the workplace, and I'm tired of starting over again every year. I don't know how I'd do with that though. When I tried selling on eBay before, I slacked too much, but I may not have much of a choice anymore. It's a pretty scary time for me right now, losing my job and then having so many big bills piled up in front of me... very scary, shit. I'm not looking forward to the future at all.

Mother's Day Dinner Well... "The Sopranos" was a bit of a disappointment. It wasn't bad, but I was expecting some major shit to go down this time. I guess they're still building up to it... I think I slept pretty well last night, for a change. I easily could have slept another few hours though. I think the lack of sleep is finally catching up with me. I've been tired all day. Hell, I'm ready for bed now . Today at work was like yesterday at work: boring as can be. I just sat there doing nothing for most of the day. I hate it. I read the classifieds section of Sunday's paper, I watched a sketch from "The Dave Chappelle Show" (downloaded yesterday), downloaded a couple albums and burned them to disc, bullshit with Santana for awhile, ate, listened to the radio, talked to Mom, and surfed the net (a whole lot). I'd much rather have been working my ass off all day, for real. Ah well, only one more day to go. I called Mom to find out where she wanted to go for her Mother's Day dinner (since I couldn't take her Sunday). I thought we'd be hitting Red Lobster, but instead she wanted to go to The Country Skillet (she was jonesing for liver and onions). There were some strange looking people there, especially the no-eyebrow-having waitress who looked like a female version of Divine (a fat guy posing as a fat woman). Creepy. I had a Delmonico steak and Mom had the liver. I tried a bite of her liver and onions and it was pretty good... now I want some. I may have to go back there, though I'd really prefer not to. The prices were reasonable and the food was good enough, but it just wasn't my type of place, with the overly bright and open dining room and of course, the strange-looking people there. After dinner, we stopped at Walgreens and I bought two more cassette tape storage cases ($6.99 each with the raincheck)and a fan that actually blows air out the front of it (I've had it with mine, blowing just a little air out the sides). After we got home, I went to my room and started putting away the tape lot I just got in yesterday. Unfortunately, some of the tapes sound pretty bad. It's turning out to be a pretty bad buy after all. By the way, I thought I'd throw my two-cents out there and say that I also do not like the changes Blogger made. Mother's Day I got out of bed around 11:45am on Saturday morning (I didn't sleep very well all night), and an hour later, after Mom came home and after I was ready to go, we hit the road to my sister's house. On the way there, we stopped at Sam Ash and I paid another $100 on my guitar ($588 left on it). We also stopped off at McDonalds and I grabbed a couple burgers and a fry. We didn't stay at my sister's house too long before we left there for my brother-in-law's parent's house in Brooksville. The boys went with their dad and I rode with my Mom, niece and sister. To my surprise, my niece did the driving! She did a pretty good job too! On the way up there, we stopped at Winn Dixie to get my nephew's ice cream cake. My niece and I went in to get it but we got sidetracked by the vending machine with the Homies in it. My niece bought two of them, then I bought a handful of them. One of the Homies I got looked exactyly like my niece (same hair, clothes, and complexion), everybody else thought so too. It was pretty funny! She really liked it a lot so I gave her it to her. Her grandparents just had their house built for them last year (they've got money) and I hadn't seen it yet (I was supposed to go up last Thanksgiving, but I stayed home for a friend). It's really beautiful (the architecture, the decorating, the furniture... everything), and the house is completely surrounded by woods (they have a nice chunk of property)... really nice. One of the first things I did there was ride a four-wheel ATV through the woods. For some reason, I started off riding with my niece (her idea), but then I asked her why we couldn't each have own own, sine they have two of them. She said we could, so we did. Man! Those things haul ass ! They have a trail out in the woods and I was whipping through there like a mad possessed! It was awesome! We went out on the road too, and I got over 45 M.P.H. out there. I probably could've gone even faster. At one point, I was way down the road coming back towards my niece (who had my younger nephew on her ATV with her by then) and I started coming right at them, really fast. I don't think I got within 100 feet from them before my niece panicked, rode down into the ditch, back up the ditch, and crashed into a wooden fence there. I couldn't believe it! The whole thing looked so ridiculous, like something out of a Three Stooges movie. Me and my nephew were laughing our asses off at her! My nephew came over and high-fived me as soon as he hopped off of her 4-wheeler! I had to get off my ATV and get hers unstuck (it was jammed under one of the slats in the fence). She said "don't tell anybody!"... I think she was worried about how it would look since she's just starting to drive. While out in the woods, I almost bit it myself. I was hauling ass in one area where I shouldn't have been, the trail is very uneven in some parts, and when I hit the brake, the back of the bike went up, I went up, paused in the air, and came back down. Whew! A little more momentum and I would have been eating dirt. Riding that thing made my hands sore. They felt like they were going to blister up, but they never did. They're still a bit sore today too. After we finished riding, I grabbed a baseball & bat and hit balls to my older nephew. After a while, I switched to hitting a tennis ball. My younger nephew and niece joined us eventually and took turns hitting the ball. Even my sister came over and hit a few, which was suprising. Everyone hit pretty good. We all went in for dinner and chowed down on hamburgers and hot dogs, baked beans, and macaroni & cheese. It was good, but I could only eat one burger (with some kick ass muchrooms on it); I just didn't have room to eat any more. After dinner, I went out and shot the basketball with my nephews and their grandfather. Their dad joined us for a little bit too. My younger nephew got clocked by his brother (driving to the basket) and wound up with a black eye. It's always something with those two. We all came in a little later and sat around joking out on their screened-in back porch (that overlooks a wooded hill). It was getting late, and I guess the grandparents were ready for us to leave, so we said our "goodnights" and "thank yous" and headed back to my sister's house. We weren't there too long again. We had some melted ice cream cake there and then we took off. My sister wasn't in a very good mood by then, so it was definitely time to leave. We got home around 11:30pm... I'd accidentally left my Homies in my sister's car, but even worse, I'd missed "The Sopranos". I was going to stay up and watch it at Midnight, or else tape it, but I did neither. I was tired so I went on to bed. I should have stayed up though, because I could not freaking sleep. I was still awake around 1:30am, and I didn't fall asleep until much later. Very frustrating.

On The Chopping Block: Day One I so did not want to go in to work today. There was a lot of grumbling and complaining as well as a bunch of sympathy and well wishes for me, which was nice to hear, but it also made it hard to forget that the shadow of the axe is looming above my neck. An Odd Day I made a big pot of coffee for Mom and I last night, but I probably made it too late at night because I had a hard time falling asleep and was up several times to pee. To make matters worse, Jimmy decided dawn was a good time to seek attention from me. He kept trying to get me to pet him, walked all over me several times, and purred right in my face. He's a good cat, but he's annoying as can be sometimes. I wound up sleeping until about 11am, a couple hours later than I should be sleeping til. I got up, watched TV, ate lunch, and played around on the PC. Man. I downloaded a bunch of songs today. There was a thread on FARK where FARKers listed their urlLink top favorite 5 songs and many of them I hadn't heard before, so I downloaded them. I found a few gems, like Radiohead's "The National Anthem", which is just amazing. When I get working again, that CD, "Kid A", is a "must-buy". UFO's "Love To Love" was pretty great too. Regardless of all the goofing off, I managed to get a few things done today, nothing major though. I brought the trash cans in, did 2 loads of laundry, put the flea treatment on the cats, brought the mail in, helped Mom carry groceries in (after she got home), and cleaned the litter box. One thing I'd hoped to do today, take a bus down the road to apply at this one company that is hiring, I didn't do. It looked like it was going to rain all day and I was still a bit tired from not sleeping well last night, so I put it off. I hope to get there tomorrow. They are hiring for machine operators, office help, and shop help, so I have a decent shot at getting in there somewhere. I just hope the hours and the pay are decent. JP emailed me today. It looks like we're not going to practice until Friday now, but only for two hours instead of the usual three (this, after not playing at all since the last gig). I don't understand why they'd want to practice less, especially since we weren't very good last time. JP also said that Jimmy wants to put the set list together this time, which is no big deal, but I thought we'd agreed to use the same set as last time with just a few changes (since hardly anyone saw us last time anyway). With just two hours practice between the last gig and this coming gig, I don't understand why they'd want to use a different set list. I mean, do we really need to throw in songs that we haven't practiced for a month or more when we did so poorly with songs that we had practiced? I really don't understand these guys sometimes. I don't understand myself sometimes either. I am broke, I'm already in debt to Mom and am due to get further in debt with her, yet... I'm still bidding on and winning auctions on eBay. Tonight, I won a Roy Orbison 4-cassette box set, still sealed, for just $6.50. I probably should have let it go, but it was too good a deal to pass up, even though I don't have the money to pay for it. Understand? I won the set while Mom and I were watching TV tonight ("Fear Factor", "Everybody Loves Raymond", and "King Of Queens"). Mom nearly puked during "Fear Factor". She started gagging after she saw this one guy's face, right after he'd finished transferred hissing cockroaches from one container to another with his mouth. I guess he had some roach parts or feces or something all over his face and that set her off. OK. I've written long enough (about nothing) for one night. Which reminds me... the word counter on my Blogger profile says I've written nearly 300,000 words since I started my blog. Unfortunately, most of it's been me rambling about boring old nothing stuff (see above... and below). So... I'm outta here.

I got paperbacks of "Slapstick" by Kurt Vonnegut, "Thinner" by Stephen King (I have this one already, but it's falling apart), "The Two Towers" and "The Return Of The King" by J.R.R. I found a couple more books there: Bill Flanagan's "A&R" in soft-cover (which got great reviews from both Elvis Costello and Tom Petty), and hardcovers of "How Few Remain" by Harry Turtledove (a Civil War novel) and "Pandora" by Anne Rice. I want to try there before I apply anywhere else. It's the perfect job situation for me. After that disappointment, we headed to my old job so JP could give me my share of the gig money from last weekend. After JP finally got there, he paid me and I was off. I paid Mom back what I owe her, though I'm going to owe her plenty in a few days (to cover some of my bills). They had a shitload of good Monty Python and Python-related VHS videotapes there but they were asking more than I was willingh to pay (they were $3 to $5 each). They had about 4 or 5 "Monthy Python's Flying Circus" tapes, 2 "Ripping Yarns" tapes (Palin, and I think Jones as well), 3 "Fawlty Towers" tapes (Cleese), and 3 "Pole To Pole" tapes (Palin). On the way home, we were talking about dinner and we wound up at Lone Star again. Man, oh man was that a great dinner. I hope I get working soon, because I liked it a lot when I could buy one week and she could buy the next. It worked out really well for us and we had a good time going out to eat every week. I'll definitely fill out an application tonight or tomorrow night. I should get called in for an interview next week, hopefully. From there, I just need some really good luck and if I do get the job, it should be smooth sailing from there. If not, I go to Arbys and continue struggling to survive.
