Bad Gig I knew it. I knew I needed a nap, hell, I tried to take a nap a few times today, but each time, I was unable to fall asleep. It really hurt me later on. Mom and I left here for the gig around 6:45pm. I'd showered, drank some wine, listened to some music, loaded my stuff in her car, and headed on to the show. After we got there, I loaded my stuff onstage, got set up and did a sound check. after that, we waited for people to show up. Very few did. Earlier, I'd called my sister and my friend Rob, both said they were coming but neither did. My sister called us at the bar and said she got halfway there and had to turn back home because my brother-in-law started puking. She said she'd try to show up for the second set at least, but she never made it. It was very disappointing. We probably only had about 10-15 of our people there. There were others there, but they were waiting for the heavy bands to come on. We waited for more people to show up, but by about 8:15pm, when it looked like no one else was coming, we went ahead on. The first song went well, "Love The One You're With", then I came in a little late on "(What's So Funny 'Bout) Peace, Love & Understanding" and got lost on the first chorus. Next was "Something More", a JP original that turned out pretty well, then "The Middle" which was a little off, but not bad. Next was "Badge", which we had problems on. For some reason, I screwed up the bridge riff a few times (I'd never done that before), then JP blew the reprise at the end. He was supposed to start playing on the acoustic, but instead, he waited for me to start playing, which I finally figured out a little too late. It was pretty awkward. Next up was "Safe In My Arms". Al forgot the bass parts during my solo and it threw me off completely because I had no idea where he was going with it. After that we did "Hanging By A Moment", which was ok. "I Had A Girl" turned out very, very well. "Promise You The Moon" was ok, but I don't have the extended solo section worked out completely yet, so my leads there were a little weak. "Wild Night" was not very good. Al kept going to the wrong note during the choruses and Jimmy stuttered on the drums a bit. I blew a line or two on that one as well. "Stuck In The Middle" turned out really well, "Steal My Kisses" was really good, and we did alright on "Fell In Love With A Girl" as well. We took a 5-10 minute break between sets (I sat with my Mom and JP's parents). We only had about 30-40 minutes left, so we cut a few songs from the 2nd set. We played "Better", which was ok, but my solo was weak. "I'm Tore Down" turned out ok, but again, my soloing was pretty weak. "The Breakup Song" turned out pretty well too, but once again, my soloing was weak... see a pattern there? This is where my not having taken a nap became a factor. I felt like I had no energy at all. Between the tiredness I was feeling and the heat onstage, I was just zapped. Still, we went on. We did "Sleeping Forever", which was a bit shaky, but ok, "The Authority Song", which I started in the wrong key and had to re-start. I also blew the first part of the solo a bit. next we did "Come On Let's Go", which JP started flat, then "You May Be Right", which felt lifeless. I blew the end of the solo on it. We did "The House Is A-Rocking", which sounded too distorted. My soloing on it was pretty weak. We ended with "Feelin' Alright", and I blew some of my lead lines on it. For some odd reason, some of the crowd was cheering us on, asking for more. Al was ready to get offstage, so was I, plus there was a band behind us waiting to get on. The manager-guy came up and said we could play two more songs, which we finally did. We did "Old Apartment", which turned out really well, and "Rock This Town", which did not. I was against playing it, I knew I didn't have the energy for it and I didn't, but we played it anyway. It was pretty fucking bad, but again, the crowd was shouting "one more". The manager-guy was supposed to come up and thank us and set up the next band, but he was nowhere to be seen. It was really awkward up there, with the crowd asking for more and us not being sure if we could or should. We were over our timeslot by about 15-20 minutes and we all thought it wouldn't have been fair to keep going on, besides, all of us were pretty much done, so we packed it in and packed up. JP probably should have told the people what was going on, but didn't. Like I said, it was really awkward. After we were packed up and ready to, it was time to collect our pay. As usual, we had to chase the manager-guy down and then we had to wait for him. I told him my Mom was waiting for me in the car and JP told him his pregnant wife was sick (she puked in the parking lot), but the guy took his sweet-ass time. Finally, he came over only to tell us that the registers were down, all the terminals were frozen and he wouldn't be able to pay us tonight. What a load of shit. To make matters worse, he asked JP how much we wanted for the night. He already had an agreement with us for $200, or $250 if we brought in 40 people, and JP reminded him of that, but then he said he'd hoped we'd work with him on it. What a dick. It doesn't look like we're going to play there again. He stuck us there on heavy, heavy metal night and now he's trying to weasel out of paying us what he owes us. Total dick move. JP is going back there on Tuesday, to collect our $200 and to let him know what is what. Very disappointing night. Between the time we finished packing up and the time we talked to the manager-weasel, me, JP, and his wife sat around talking about the band, the direction we're heading, and basically, our futures in the band. I think JP's wife continually reminds him that the band is just a hobby, that it's not a career, and that it never could be. However, JP's music is good enough to take him places, I know it, he knows it, the rest of the band knows it, and pretty much everyone who's heard his music seems to know it too. I just don't think his wife does, and she even told him once, right in front of me, that he has a "slim to none" chance of ever making it. Man. There is no way I could stand to be with a woman who was so unsupportive of something as important to me as my music. It's not that she's necessarily unsupportive, she goes to gigs and helps out sometimes, but she doesn't seem to believe in his music nor in his talent, and that's unfortunate. Anyway, it looks now like we're going to focus on making a decent demo to send out. Other than giving us some extra playing time, the gigs we're getting aren't doing anything for us, not in The Big Picture. We don't seem to be getting much of a following, we're basically playing to the same people all the time, when they bother to show up, that is. Frankly, since the other guys can only play about 3 gigs a month, it isnt likely we'd ever get a real following from playing out. Making a demo and sending it out to people who can do something with it seems like more logical to me. I'm sure we'll still play out for fun and money, but we'll probably start playing places that have their own crowds, where we aren't responsible for supplying a crowd, like tonight. What a crappy night.

Pre-Show Activity I didn't sleep very well last night. I was awake in bed most of the night and I was up and down a few times to pee, as well. By 8am, I knew I wasn't going to be able fall back asleep and I didn't. I had set my alarm for 10am... wishful thinking. I am pretty tired right now. I tried to nap a couple of times earlier today, but that hasn't worked out too well for me. I have got to nap sometime soon or I'll be dragging ass onstage tonight. I still don't know if my sister is coming or not. I talked to her last night and today trying to get her to go. She said she didn't have the extra money, like she couldn't just go to support me, she has to have a reason to go (to drink). I told her I'd give her some money (for her birthday) and she'd get in for free anyway, so who knows what's going to happen. I've also asked her twice to call her brother-in-law and invite him along, but she hadn't done that yet either. He liked us a lot when he and his wife saw us play before (and we're even tighter now). Earlier this afternoon, I did an equipment check and set the levels on my amp and effects pedals. I also made some notes about some of the songs we're a litle iffy on, so we can go over them before we play. Right now, I am listening to last week's practice tape. A couple of the solos I played last week were keepers, so I need to keep them fresh in my mind. Man. It's hot as fuck in here right now. It's over 85 degrees in the house with the AC cranked ! Ugh! I think it might be a good time to go lie under a cool fan and try to take a nap. I'll need to be up by 5:30pm though, so I can shower get packed up and get to the gig by 7pm. I'll probably just grab dinner on the way home from the show. So... that's the plan.

Waiting To Sleep I got up around 2:30am yesterday and, except for the three hours I laid down for a nap this afternoon (I think I got maybe an hour, hour and a half, of sleep), I've stayed up all day. I'm tired as hell, have been ever since I got up from my nap, which was really hard to do (once I finally got to sleep, I didn't want to get back up). I'm going to bed in a few minutes and hope to be on my way to a normal sleep pattern once again. That is, if I don't screw it up tomorrow night. It's always hard to get to sleep after a gig. I stay up for hours with the music going through my head, thinking about mistakes I'd made or about how doing this or that would make the song better... it's hard to get my mind settled down to the point where I can relax and fall asleep. If I can manage to get to sleep by 2am (our set lasts until 10pm), I should be able to get up around 9am or 10am Sunday morning and that would put me right about where I need to be, sleepwise. I'd like to go out and get a haircut Sunday afternoon, so I can start looking for work on Monday. I also need to shave too (I have a beard going again). Tuesday, I'm going to go buy the new Wilco CD and I might buy the new Patti Scialfa CD too (it comes with a bonus disc). If I can get a job and get working this week, I should be okay come the first week of July, when I get hit the hardest with bills, and if I'm ok then, I should be ok for a long while thereafter (which would alleviate a lot of worries for me). They say that a journey of 1,000 miles begins with just a single step, and I'm hoping that going to bed right now is my first step on a new journey, towards a happier existence. Goodnight.

A Ghost Is Born I just discovered that Wilco has a new album coming out (next Tuesday)! It's called "A Ghost Is Born". Even better than discovering that they have a new album coming is getting to urlLink listen to it for free . I don't know how long the link will be good for, but you can listen to the whole album on Wilco's website and it.. is.. awesome . A great album. It's a lot more bare bones than their last album, more raw, sparse. Some of it reminds me of old Neil Young, The Band, and John Lennon, but mostly it's pure Wilco. This is a must-buy CD for me. Good thing our gig tomorrow night is a paying gig. Which reminds me... I just found out that all of the bands that follow tomorrow night are really hard and heavy. Our crowd is going to clear the hell out of there in a hurry. I don't know why he booked us with that lot, it's a really bad fit.

Up Too Early... Again I'm trying to get my sleep patterns normalized again, but I'm not having much luck. This last week has been absolutely insane. One day I'm up at 10pm, the next around 4pm, then 12:30pm, then 8:30am, then 8pm, then 1:30pm, then 2:30am... I'm all over the freakin' place! The last time noted, 2:30am, was tonight (this morning?). I only made it until about 6pm yesterday before I fell asleep (while reading Anne Rice's "The Mummy... Or Ramses The Damned"). Around 2:30am, I got up, ate (more a dinner than a breakfast) and watched "Beavis & Butthead" for awhile. I'm going to try and go back to bed again shortly. I would like to be up around 9am everyday, which means I need to be going to bed around 11pm (if I'm going to read a little) or Midnight. I'm not having much success, but I'm working on it.

Another Sleepless Night Around 2am this morning, I started getting tired, but because I'm a moron, I stayed up playing on the PC and watching TV until about 3:30am. Then, instead of just going to bed, I laid down and started reading a new book, "Creature" by John Saul. Because I'm a special kind of moron, I proceeded to read the entire book . I finished it about 45 minutes ago. It was an ok book, certainly not worth losing a night's sleep over. It started off really strong, kept me interested, but towards the end, it started getting just a bit too hokey for me, and inconsistent. I don't think I'd recommend it to anyone. I feel like crap. Besides being tired as hell, I have a sore lower back (probably from the way I was laying in bed, reading) and I'm starting to get an upset stomach again too. Last night, shortly after I got home from practice, I started getting cold sweats, like I was going to puke. I also felt The Big D coming on. It's a always a tricky situation when you have to contend with both ends at once. I sat down on the toilet, turned the fan on me, took my shirt off, and after a while, the cold sweats and the nausea went away. Whew! A potential disaster, averted. Man. I really need to stay up until Midnight tonight, so I can get up at a decent hour on Friday. Mom is off on Fridays now (she's on her Summer schedule) and can take me around job hunting, but as screwed up as my sleep schedule has been this week, it's pretty unlikely that I'll be up or in any condition to go out. I'll probably be in bed by 6pm tonight, which does me no good at all. Ugh! I still have to call my friend Rob today too, to let him know about the gig on Saturday. I should have called him days ago, but between my weird hours of late and my not wanting to be attached to the phone for hours, I just haven't done it. Phone calls to him are usually a huge hassle and they last way too long. I really don't care to deal with that right now. I'm just too damned tired.

Practice Night I didn't get up until about 1:30pm this afternoon, later than I'd hoped. I had a lot of trouble getting to sleep after I'd gone to bed (for the second time) last night. I watched TV and downloaded music for most of the afternoon (I finally got to hear some early Todd Rundgren... awesomeness), then I showered and got ready for practice. I knew we had a lot to do tonight (running through both sets and working on a couple of the songs) so I was hoping we'd get right to business, but that didn't happen. The other guys talked and smoked and whatnot before getting ready to play. I played by myself for awhile, then finally JP got up and started playing some 2-chord progression and I started improvising some melodies over it. Eventually, Al and Jimmy joined in and then JP started coming up with some words for it while we played. It was really nice, very mellow, and the band sounded really good playing together on it too, with all four parts coming together nicely. Like I told JP tonight, if we played together 4 days a week instead of 4 days a month, we'd be one hell of a band. After that, we worked on the two newest originals, "Safe In My Arms" and "Better", trying to tighten them up some more. I think we'll be ok on them Saturday night, but they both could use some fine tuning. We also ran through all of set 1 and about half of set 2, making adjustments here and there as we went along. Al and JP wanted to make a few changes to the setlets too, so we worked on that after practice. Here are the setlists for Saturday as they stand right now: Set 1: "Love The One You're With", "(What's So Funny 'Bout)Peace, Love & Understanding", "Something More", "The Middle", "Badge", "Safe In My Arms", "Hanging By A Moment", "I Had A Girl", "Promise You The Moon", "Wild Night", "Stuck In The Middle", "Steal My Kisses", "Fell In Love With A Girl", and "Opportunity Knocks". Set 2: "Better", "I'm Tore Down", "The Breakup Song", "Circle", "Sleeping Forever", "The Authority Song", "I Got Loaded", "Free Spirit", "Come On Let's Go", "You May be Right", "Should I Stay Or Should I Go", "The House Is A-Rocking", and "Feelin' Alright". It's a pretty good mix. It should be a really good show (a fun one, anyway). By the way, JP told me tonight that Santana's band, The St. Pete Project (who we used to play with), got booked for a really good gig. They won't be getting paid, but they will be opening for Cheap Trick ! Those lucky bastards. Too bad Santana's band doesn't have any originals, because, pay or not, it'd be some great exposure (not to mention the whole Cheap Trick deal).

The Sleep Misery Continues I only made it until somewhere around 5pm on Tuesday before I just had to go to sleep. I didn't sleep long though. By 8pm, I was out of bed. That didn't last long either, because I crashed out on the couch around 8:30pm and slept off and on for the next two hours or so. I played around on the PC for several hours, half-watching TV, before going back to bed again, somewhere around 2am. I finished reading "Everything's Eventual" and tried to fall asleep, but here I am, back out of bed yet again. I plan on calling Arbys tomorrow, to see if they have any positions available. I need a job, and fast. I can always look around for a better job later... if I can find the time. Or if I have the time. Time feels like it's running out for me. I don't know what it is, but I have a great sense of impending doom... or a feeling of great failure. Whatever it is, I feel an urgency to it, like I just don't have the time left to do all that needs to be done. You know, I was saved from death a couple of times in life. I lived through a ferocious tornado that killed 3 kids not 80 feet away from where I was when it hit (in fact, I saw one of those kids in the bathroom just minutes before he died). Later in life, I walked in on an armed robber just moments after he shot a co-worker of mine between the eyes. I quickly escaped and I almost ran out the back door for help, but I had a bad feeling that there was someone waiting for me back there (I'd seen a strange car pull up in the back parking lot not long before the shooting), and in fact, as the police later confirmed, the robber's partner was out there, waiting. I have been spared an early departure several times in my life and sometimes I feel like I've done absolutely nothing to merit my reprieves... and maybe next time I won't be so lucky. Maybe I'm just depressed still, I don't know. Why is it so hard to be happy? *sigh* I guess I'm going to try and go to sleep again; hopefully I'll be up by Noon.

Screwed Up... Still I thought I was getting back on track, at least I'd been getting up earlier, but I really blew it last night. I went to bed around 2am, after watching "The Three Stooges" bio-pic. I was too tired to read and tried to go right to sleep. Somehow, I managed not to sleep at all. It looks like Mom fucked around with the thermostat again, turned it up, which made it too humid in my room. I think she must've done that the day before, when I was only able to get a couple hours sleep. Around 4am, I finally got up and read some. I pet Jimmy awhile (he's been coming into my room at night lately), and then cleaned my room a little. Around 5:30am, I went out to the living room and watched TV. I watched "Gods And Generals", a very good movie, but also a very long one (it just finished a little after 10am). I wish they had better special effects in this one, too many cannon explosions, not enough blood. The acting and scenery and everything else was great, but the violence just wasn't realistic enough. With the Civil War, the injuries were just so nasty, the fallen must have been in a world of pain, but you don't get that from this movie; as soon as someone gets hit, they seem to drop dead instantly... basically the same thing you'd see at a re-enactment. You don't get the scope of the suffering the injured went through. If it had been shot more like the battle scenes in "Saving Private Ryan", it definitely would have had a much bigger impact on me. I think depicting just how brutal it was only goes to show just how brave those soldiers really were, because they knew what they faced everytime they marched into battle. "Gettysburg" was more honest in that sense. So... I'm on my second huge cup of coffee now. I have to try and stay up as long as possible... again. Obviously, no job hunting today, dammit. The way I feel right now, I might be able to make it until 9 or 10pm, but that can change at any time. I should try and get something done today, before I start getting too tired to stay up. I don't know how many times I've said that, or been in this position. This shit is getting old.

Mixed-Up Days & Nights The last three days, I've gotten up @10pm, @4pm, @12:30pm, and today, @8:30am. I'm all over the place! I'm not getting into any set sleep pattern; I just go to bed when I go to bed and get up whenever I get up. I'm a mess. Last night, I went to bed around 2am (after putting together the set lists for our Saturday gig). I read in bed for awhile, fell asleep for awhile, but then I was up by 8:30am. That's just not enough sleep. I took a nap yesterday afternoon, a long one, so that might be the reason I slept so little last night. That, plus I had/have a headache that won't go away. I need to try and stay up all day today, I certainly have enough stuff to do around the house to keep me busy, but it's supposed to rain again this afternoon and I'm pretty tired, so who knows, I may wind up napping again. Hopefully, I can get into a normal sleep pattern within this week and then I can start job hunting. I need to get some money coming in... as soon as possible.

Lately I've Been... Listening to: I really haven't listened to anything all week. I've been too busy sleeping, reading, or watching TV. Watching on TV: "The World Series Of Poker", "Trading Spaces", "The Sherlock Holmes Mysteries", "The Howard Stern Show", "The Crocodile Hunter Diaries", "Judge Judy", and bits and pieces of a lot of my usual shows and various documentaries on The History Channel and The Science Channel. I also watched a couple of movies, "1984" and "House Of 1,000 Coprses", which was a pretty strange movie. Reading: I finished a couple of books this week, and I just started reading Stephen King's "Everything's Eventual" last night. Playing "Grand Theft Auto 2" and "Bow Man". Downloading: I downloaded some stuff from Velvet Revolver, but wasn't real impressed with anything I heard. I was hoping it would sound a lot like STP or GNG, but it really didn't sound much like either band. Jamming: We practiced on Wednesday, a good practice. We do it again next Wednesday, then we have a gig on that Saturday. Working: I need to get back to being a day person before I can start looking for a day job, which I finally realized I had to have. Even though I really don't want another fast food job on my resume, I may apply at Arby's, or some other restaurant that doesn't serve breakfast, so I won't have to be up too early. By the way, it looks like I''ve been turned down for unemployment benefits, though I'm not sure why. I think they might've made a mistake. Buying: I bought some Fiji waters and some jumbo Hersehy bars at Walgreens earlier in the week and I won an eBay auction for the cassette version of Ray Charles' "The Birth Of Soul" box set. I will have to pay $10.35 for it, which is a little more than I'd normally pay for used tapes, but I took a gamble on it. The seller had listed "St. Petersburg" as their location and I thought I could pick it up in person and save myself $5 in shipping costs, but unfortunately, they live much further away than St. Pete. I used to have the CD version of the set in my collection, but I lost it, along with a whole bunch of my best CDs, to a pawn shop, many moons ago. Selling: Nothing. Eating: A lot more fast food than usual. Mom hasn't been cooking much lately. We had steak hoagies tonight, I had McNuggets and pasta salad yesterday and today, and we had burgers from Checkers and Burger King this past week too. Burgers at home too. I'm about sick of burgers. I've also been snacking on Hershey bars while I read in bed, but I think I'm starting to get sick of those too. Feeling: Mentally, I'm worried about my finances. I don't have any money to put on my laid-away guitar this month and I will squeak by with everything else, but I need $173 on July 5th to pay my bank loan and I still have $500 to pay on my guitar, which should be paid off in early July. I'm in a fix. Physically, my back has been a little sore. I think I strained it a little carrying my equipment out to JP's car the other night. My sinuses/allergies have been bad all week as well, headaches just about every damned day. My feet have also been acting weird, having spasms and stuff. Ahhh... the joy of aging. Planning: I need to get back on day hours so I can go get myself a crappy, low-paying job with no benefits whatsoever. Ahhh... the joy of slaving for our corporate masters.

Late Night/Early Morning Ramblings I'm still up. I went to bed with a book ("Red Dragon") sometime around 9pm. I finished the book around 3:30am, but by then I had a major headache and then I started thinking about my life and getting a job and paying my bills and such and decided to get up. The book wasn't as good as I'd hoped, but it held my interest most of the way through. My main problem with it is that the author built the main investigator up to be somewhat of a phenom and he really didn't do much of anything throughout the story. His one big discovery was revealed much earlier to the reader, so it was no surprise at all, very anti-climactic. I also thought it was annoying that the front cover is taken up with Hannibal Lechter's face (the face of Anthony Hopkins) and he's barely in the book at all. I took 3 Aleves for my headache. So far, it's still here, still aching. Besides typing this, I'm watching "Wild Boyz" on MTV. It's some of the guys from Jackass. They certainly have a lot of balls to do some of the stuff they do, but I can't help but wonder if some of them are a couple beers short of a 6-pack. That new Gene Simmons solo album seems like the audio equivalent of a huge, steaming pile of shit. My sister's birthday was yesterday. Mom had talked about going up, but then later she said she didn't feel like it. I don't have any money left to buy her anything anyhow. I'll make it up to her when she comes down for my next gig (in a little over a week). I'm really starting to worry about my finances and getting a job. I really don't want another day job, but I need to have my nights open for my music. I'd like to work for myself, but I don't know if I'd have any success with that or not, and with no income coming in, it'd be a hell of a gamble, one I couldn't afford to lose. I'm so mixed-up and confused right now, it's not even funny. So many choices, so little time. In the meantime, I need to start working on the set list for our next gig. I'm going to throw a bunch of our newer material in there, most of our more upbeat stuff, and as many originals as I can. It should be a great gig, lots of fun. I really need to start finishing more of my own songs, and soon. It's really starting to bother me. I have so much material sitting around here, on tapes and in my mind, but without lyrics, they stay shelved, unheard. The guys in my band seem to like my stuff when I bring out at practices, I just have to put my mind to working on it, no more excuses. The sky is starting to lighten up. I should have been sleeping hours ago. If I go to bed now, I'll be up too late in the day to get anything done. No job hunting, no nothing. I don't know what to do anymore. I'm lost.

We Lost Another Great One And I'm not talking about that bastard, Reagan. I'm talking about the great Ray Charles. I just heard that he'd passed away last Thursday. What a huge loss. He's one of those guys, like Johnny Cash, that you wish could live forever, so that generations and generations could be a witness to their talent, their genius. He was more than a great musician, he was a national treasure. Sadly, we no longer have the man, but luckily we still have his music. I would highly recommend his box set to anyone, it's called "The Birth Of Soul" and it's absolutely brilliant. Thank you, Brother Ray.

Band Practice I took a nap around 3pm today, or tired to anyway. I just couldn't sleep, my mind wouldn't stop racing, but I guess I got enough of a rest because I played alright tonight. We started off the night jamming on a new song I started today (funky Doobie Brothers-like riff in A) and it sounded prety good once everyone got going. As per usual, no lyrics yet. I started some, just to get a melody down, but they kind of suck. We jammed on my "Safe In My Arms" for awhile too. JP played some lead on it, embellishments, and it sounded pretty good too. I kept waiting for him to start singing, but he never did, which was weird. Later he wanted to play this song, not realizing that we already had. He had no idea what song we'd jammed on! We wound up working on this one a lot. Now, we are using the bridge music as an independant solo section. We made it a little funkier too. We still need to figure out how to get from the solo back to the last verse. I almost had it, but we moved on to something else. We worked on "Better" too, trying to get the chorus part to sound right. It always sounds too cluttered or too forced or something. I think we have it now... sort of. We also worked on Steve Miller's "Rock N Me", but it looks like the key it's in is out of JP's range so we had to move it from E to A, which kind of screws up the bass and guitar parts. We had to try and figure out where to play everything again. We also ran through "Fell In Love With A Girl", "I Got Loaded", "The House Is A-Rockin", "The Breakup Song", and "Come On Let's Go". We spent time tweaking most of them. It was a very productive night, but we also jammed a bit too, and we even rehashed an old song of JP's called "Free Spirit", which we hadn't played for about a year. We didn't do too bad with it. We'll probably put it back in our repertoire since it's fairly upbeat and we need all the upbeat songs we can get. Which reminds me... the guy from the club we've been playing about once a month finally called JP back. It looks like we're on for the 19th, from 8pm to 10pm. Santana's band might even be playing there that night too, which would be really cool, but I'm not counting on it. A little after I got home tonight, Mom ran me to Walgreens and I bought some more Fiji water and some more jumbo Hershey bars (with almonds). I'm set now!

The Too-Early Bird Well... I didn't make it until 10pm last night. Instead, I went on to bed sometime around 5:30pm and forced myself to stay in bed as long as I could, until sometime around 4:30am, when I finally got up again. I hate being an "early bird", I'm much more comfortable being a "night owl". If it wasn't for having to look for a stinking job, I'd still be up all night long, semi-happy. This morning, I watched "1984" (finally), made coffee for Mom and I, made breakfast for myself (a mushroom/cheddar omelette), did some laundry, and helped JP bring his equipment in. He said he still hasn't gotten a call back about our upcoming gig this month. It seems like the guy is ducking us. Maybe he gave our slot to another band or something. Very strange. Besides the exposure, I could certainly use the money from playing out, that's for sure. Speaking of money, I still don't know what I should do about work. I need to find something close by or on a direct bus route, someplace I wouldn't have to dress up too much for, someplace that pays decent wages, where I wouldn't have to do a lot of heavy lifting, and where I wouldn't have to be in too early or leave too late. I'm really limited in options. I keep thinking about starting up something of my own instead. I'm really sick of working for people, most of the folks I've worked for have been total assholes, and I think I have enough stuff here I could sell. There's an indoor flea market down the road here and it would only cost me $149 a month to sell there (five days a week). I could bring in basketball cards and cassette tapes and books and whatnot and see how I do. It might be profitable, or it might not. I guess there's only one way to find out for sure. I just wish I had the $149, so I could try it. I might just list a bunch of stuff on eBay and try to raise it. In the mean time, I need a nap. I'm really tired for some reason. I'd better take a nap this afternoon sometime so I'm not totally useless at band practice tonight.

Up I went to bed with a book, "The Stranger" by Albert Camus, sometime around 2am this morning. By 5:30am, I'd finished the book. I read the entire book in about three and a half hours. Very unique style of writing, but more importantly, a very unique philosophy behind the writing. Sometimes the apathy of the main character was almost too much, but by the end of the story, the apathy seemed almost sensible. It's basically a tragedy, but I found the truth and honesty in it quite uplifting. One very surprising thing I found in this book was a familar-sounding line "it's better to burn than it is to disappear". Obviously, Neil Young borrowed from Camus when he sang "it's better to burn out/than to fade away"... cool! So... I'm still up. I guess I'm going to try and stay up all day. I need to get back on a day schedule again anyhow (to find a job). I may shave my head today too. I need to shave my face, at the very least (it's getting itchy) and I desperately need a shower (I stink). It's been getting hot in the house everyday (even with the air on it's up in the 80's), so I've been sweating a lot more than usual. I'm pretty tired right now, I hope I can make it until 11pm, but I probably won't.

A Voice From The Past I received a phone call tonight from someone I thought I might never hear from again: my old friend Scott. I hadn't heard from him for a couple of years now. The last time I saw him, we were supposed to get together to go see JP's band play out, which was long before I joined JP's band. He never called me back about it, never showed up to pick me up, and seemed to have disappeared altogether, never to be heard from again. Until tonight. He's living in Michigan again (in the past few years, he's lived there, Tennessee and Mississippi), recently re-married (to Jill), and has a new child on the way (a boy, due in October). The most surprising news, however, is that he got his stolen Les Paul gold top back after it had been missing for two years. He just happened upon it in a guitar shop one day, hanging on a wall. It surprisd the shit out of him, to say the least. He'd had that guitar ever since we were teenagers and when it got stolen, he pretty much gave up playing (losing it had broken his spirit). I'm really glad he got it back. Him without his Gibson is like the Yin without the Yang. He said he started playing again too. He was one of the guys that taught me a lot of guitar stuff when I was first starting out, all the basics. Even though his style was always more Heavy Metal and Thrash than me, we used to jam together quite often, usually with me on guitar and him on drums (back in the old abandoned pawn shop). Those were good times. After his first marriage broke up, I was secretly hoping he'd come back and offer to drum or play bass for me, to help me get my own band going. Of course, that never happened. I guess it never will, now that he's officially re-joined the ranks of "those who've settled down". I'm the last of my group not to have gone that route, but I think I could have gone down that road if I had found someone who loved me. That also never happened. I'm glad he's doing well and is happy, but for whatever reason, his happiness sort of amplifies my sadness. When I look back on the last 20 years of my life and see how little I've done, how littel I've progressed... it's just pathetic. For a long time, I'd just given up entirely (too many heartbreaks, too much sorrow), but I've slowly been getting back on my feet again (really slowly). Hopefully, I'm just a late bloomer. Hopefully, I'll make up for all of those wasted years eventually. I feel like I'm ready and waiting to come alive, like a butterfly who's been in the cocoon to long, but I also feel like I can't do it without a helping hand. I think thay call that being "co-dependent". I know what it is, but I can't stop feeling that way. Lonliness is a drag. All in all, it was still good to hear from Scott again.

Lately I've Been... Listening to: I played Rush's "Chronicles" 2-tape set while Jess and I played darts. That's about all the music I've listened to this week. Watching on TV: I watched a handful of movies this week (with Jess): "Jackass: The Movie", "The Master Of the Flying Guillotine", "The Fugitive", "Southern Comfort" and half of "Jaws". I also watched these TV shows this week: "The Sherlock Holmes Mysteries", "Beavis & Butthead", "Ren & Stimpy", "Judge Judy", "The Simpsons", "Home Improvement", "Everybody Loves Raymond", "King Of Queens", and bits and pieces of various other shows. Tonight, I watched the season finale of "The Sopranos". Good episode, but I wish it would've been a bit longer. Reading: I finished reading "Night Shift" this week, and I started reading "Firestarter" (both are Stephen King books). I'm almost done with "Firestarter". It's a really good book. "Night Shift" was ok, kind of hokey in places. Playing: "Grand Theft Auto 2", "Beach Head 2002", and "Bow Man". Downloading: Nothing. Jamming: We didn't practice at all this week and I haven't even picked up mu guitar since our last gig. Not good. Working: No job yet, but I really haven't started looking yet either. I plan on starting this week after I put in for my unemployment insurance. Buying: I bought a bunch of stuff all week, mostly junk food for my nephews and I: Donuts, milks, Slurpees, candy bars, a swimming pool, a mini-air compressor, ice creams, water, cream sodas, wine, underwears, hot dog, etc... way too much stuff. Selling: Still nothing. Eating: A lot of junk food this week, and sodas too. I hadn't bought soda for ages. I usually stay away from it whenever possible. Feeling: Mentally, I feel like my Summer is over, before it even began. I had my fun with my nephews and now I feel like I need to get serious about finding a new job. Physically, not too well the last few days. My allergies/sinuses had been going crazy, which caused my ears to get sore, which gave me some monster headaches. I've been in bed pretty much all weekend (see post below). Planning: I need to take care of my unemployment insurance, then I need to find a job. I also need to get a haircut and play my guitar.

Slumberjack Holy crap. I went to bed around 10:30pm last night and I just got out of bed about 5 minutes ago... over 13 hours in bed. And it's not like I was out of bed much yesterday either. I stayed up until Noon reading "Firestarter" (only about 5 pages left to go) and dealing with my sinus/allergy problems. I got back up around 7:30pm and then, as I already mentioned, I was back in bed sometime around 10:30pm. My ears are really sore now, from all the nose-blowing I did Saturday morning. Of course, I can't afford to go to the doctor's or anything. I may be back in bed before long. I really don't feel very well, and it's not just my ears. I have an upset stomach too and I feel tired and sore all over.

A Day Of Rest I thought I was going to going to bed early last night, but that didn't happen. Instead, I stayed up playing "Grand Theft Auto 2" on my PC and then I went to bed, grabbed a book to read, and read until almost 7am. The book was Stephen King's "Firestarter". I don't remember liking the movie very much (I saw it a long, long time ago), but so far, the book is pretty darn good. I stayed in bed until after 4pm today; I was in no hurry to get up. My fan felt nice and cool and the blankets felt nice and warm; I was really comfy. Both of the cats were sleeping at my feet, so the first thing I did after waking up was give them some attention. I hadn't had much chance to pet them or play with them in the last several days (since I was spending all my time with my nephews). I spent most of the day today on my PC. In fact, I spent about five hours just playing "Grand Theft Auto 2". In spite of all the time I spent on it, I'm really hating my computer... with a passion. It keeps dragging and slowing down when I play games or when I try to download things, or when I'm listening to music on it and then open up a page or try to download something, the music starts breaking up. It's like it has no memory to spare, which can't be the case because I bought and installed extra memory in it a long time ago (it has 319 MB of RAM). I haven't checked, but maybe another capicitor blew. It's not like I can do anything about it right now anyhow; my warranty expired and I'm broke. It's really frustrating. I need a high-power, hi-speed computer that can keep up with me. As soon as I start working again and as soon as my bills are caught up, I am going to buy myself a new computer... and it will not be a Gateway PC this time. I'm guess I'm going to go to bed now and read some more. If only I had me a big ol' Hershey bar (with almonds) to munch on while I read... man, am I jonesing for one of those bad boys right now! D'oh!

All Gone I didn't get to sleep until around 9am this morning. I wasn't sure if I was going to stay up all day or go to sleep. After I finished reading my book, I finally decided it'd be better to go ahead and go to "sleep". I had Mom wake me up at 3pm today (she stayed home again). I got up, showered, and we headed out to my old job to pick up my paycheck. The boys went up with me and got to see JP for a few minutes. It was his birthday today. I alwyas forget, every year. For some reason, I always think it's on the 6th, when it's actually on the 3rd. After we left there, we went to the bank and I deposited most of my check (moneywise, I should be ok for the rest of the month), then we stopped over at Missing Links and I bought everyone ice cream/shakes. I had a hot dog there too (everyone else had eaten already). We stopped off at Walgreens on the way home, then we came home and Jess and I set up the Slip & Slide. He and Austin did that for awhile, Austin was having a blast, but Jess was being jerky about it. He wouldn't take off the long jeans shorts he was wearing, which prevented him from sliding well. He kept landing badly and getting hurt, but he just wouldn't take the damned things off. Instead, he got aggravated because we kept telling him to take them off, then he went off and pouted until he finally decided to come back over. Mom borrowed an air compressor from a friend of hers and sat out on the porch pumping up my pool until she got bored. It's still not pumped up and usable yet. Sean, the kid at the end of the street who almost always comes over when we're doing fun stuff outdoors, came over and wanted to slide too. I had him ask his mother for permission first. He played awhile and had fun with Austin. My sister was heading over to pick the boys up around 7-7:30pm, so I had to pack the Slip & Slide up and bring Austin inside to change clothes and clean up. Jess had showered already. After their Mom arrived, they all ate supper here (Mom and I waited) and then they got packed up and went home. Austin was getting hyper again and started getting on everyone's nerves. He'd been fairly good all week, both of them actually. I told them they could stay down longer, but they wanted to go home and watch hockey with their dad (who, like Jess, was never a hockey fan until the Lightning started winning). I annoyed my sister because I asked her why she's letting the 6-year old play "Grand Theft Auto: Vice City". She got all huffy and pissed. Besides being able to shoot people in a realistic fashion (cops and innocent bystanders) you can also pick up hookers (apparently the car rocks and there are "action" sounds), and there's hidden a porn studio you can stumble upon that features a real porn star supplying the sounds and whatnot. Really proper for a 6-year old, is it not? See, it's easier for her to say "go ahead and play it" than it is to make sure he doesn't play it, less of a hassle for her... isn't that what it's all about? It's just another example of lazy parenting, one of the biggest problems with society today. My sister brought a painting down for my Mom (my sister's in-laws gave it to her). My Mom had to take my sister over to Exxon and buy her some gas (she was broke), and then they went on home from there. Mom and I came home and ate dinner in peace and quiet. I'm pooped. I think I'm going to be heading to bed much earlier tonight... much, much earlier.

Wednesday I didn't get to bed last night until well after the sun came up. I was reading in bed and eating a chocolate bar. It looks like it's going to go exactly the same this morning, because after I finish here, I'm going to bed with a book and some chocolate. I got up a little earlier today, around 3:30pm. I'd wanted to take the boys out somewhere good for dinner after I'd gotten up, but they had been eating all day and weren't really hungry. I had some Count Chocula to hold me over. I watched the boys play video games (Super Mario) and then I watched "The Simpsons" with them. I lost track of time and forgot to call JP about my paycheck until it was too late. I'll have to pick it up on Thusday now. Later on, we watched "The Fugitive". By the time it was over, they were hungry again. Mom took us to Denny's (not my favorite place to eat) and they all had breakfasts while I had a nasty double cheeseburger and a really nasty order of nachos (which I took home). I should've had pancakes instead. After we ate, Mom dropped us off at the ice skating rink near the back of the park and the boys played in the "snow" (actually shaved ice from the rink) for a long while. I played a little bit, but mostly watched and made sure the older boy was playing fair. After they got bored there, I suggested walking up to 7-11 for Slurpees, and the boys were agreeable to that. By the time we got there, it was almost 1am... I didn't realize it was that late! We got our Slurpees (and I bought myself another Hershey bar) and then I walked them over to my (and their mother's) old elementary school, the one that got hit by the tornado (they're fascinated by tornadoes). We sat on a bench out in front of the school and finished out Slurpees. The younger boy said he had to go poop, so we abruptly headed home. It was a long walk. By the time we got home, my feet were killing me. I sat on the couch and really didn't leave it for a long time afterward. We watched TV a bit and then Mom came out to tell the boys that their elderly nextdoor neighbor was dead. He had died sometime this week. Apparently, he'd been dead for days before he was discovered. No one noticed that his mail and newspapers were piling up and that he wasn't putting any trash out... nice. After Mom had talked to them about the neighbor's death, I cheered them up with some classic "Ren & Stimpy". A little later, after he'd been nodding in and out of sleep for awhile, Austin went on to bed. After he'd gone, Jess and I watched some old "Beavis & Butthead" shows and laughed our asses off. I ate some of my gross nachos from Denny's, and then we watched "Southern Comfort" until 5:15am. Jess barely made it through the movie. He went to bed almost as soon as it was over. The eastern sky is starting to get light now and the traffic out on the highway is beginning to pick up; I've got another long day ahead of me, so I'm heading to bed. Besides, I've got a book and a chocolate bar calling my name.

Tuesday I didn't get to sleep until sometime around 8:30am this morning (Tuesday). I laid in bed, with the fan blowing on me, reading "Night Shift" and snacking on a Hershey bar (with almonds). Ahhh... that's the life. Mom was home early from work today, around Noon, so she had the kids most of the day. She took them to the movies ("Shrek 2") while I slept. I got up around 4:30pm and then got showered and waited for them to get home. After they arrived, I hid in the spare room and waited for one of them to come back and wake me up. Austin finally did, so I jumped out of the spare room screaming and scared the poop out of him. I got him good. After we ate "lunch", I played "Beach Head" with Austin and then he played "Super Mario" on my old Nintendo while Jess and I watched "The Simpsons". After a bit, I took the kids outside and started to get the Slip & Slide set up, but there were parts that needed to be inflated and it was taking too long with me trying to blow it up. I went in to get the compressor I bought last night but discovered that it's had to be hooked up to a car's cigarette lighter. Mom had gone swimming, so were had to wait until she got home to do it. After she got back and we'd inflated the Slip & Slide, the boys played on it for a while, until they got bored with it, then we played "Keep Away" out in the street for awhile. Meanwhile, I had Mom inflating my swimming pool for me. She was using the compressor to blow it up, but then she started getting paranoid about her car's battery running out, and decided to take it to a gas station for air instead, which didn't work out very well at all. She only got it partially inflated, so I still am not able to use my pool. Grrrrr!!!! After we came in and got cleaned up and clothes changed, we wound up watching TV the rest of the night. I had on a couple of nature shows (one about a guy living alone up in Alaska and the other about crocodiles and life in a draught-ravaged African riverbed), and then Austin went on to bed. I think that was somewhere around 1am. Jess and I shot darts and listened to Rush, then we watched Jackass and some Bam Marjera stuff before he headed on to bed (around 3:30am). I'm going to be going to bed soon myself, though I'll probably read and snack on my other Hershey bar before I drift off to sleep. One thing I really need to do tomorrow is to get my paycheck from JP (he took it home with him today for some reason). I wish he'd have just dropped it off on his way home. I need to get that money in the bank in a hurry . Oh, it looks like I'll have both boys until Thursday now. That's cool. That'll give me the whole weekend to try and get myself back to "normal hours" so I can start job hunting. Ok... off to bed now.

Memorial Day 2004: A Hot One I stayed in bed extra late today (I'm talking about Monday), not getting up until about 4:30pm when my Mom woke me up. It was nice laying there in bed, with my fan blowing cool air all over me. Mom had taken the kids to McDonalds and she brought me back two Filet-O-Fish sammiches (I could have done without them). After I ate, I goofed around with the boys awhile, on the computer and in my room, and then Mom drove us up to Super Target where I spent a bunch of money I shouldn't have spent (luckily, I have a final paycheck due me tomorrow). It was 91 degrees out when we were leaving, around 6:30pm. Jesse said it was 96 degrees earlier when they were out. There also wasn't any wind blowing. It was a very hot, humid day. At Target, I bought a 6-pack of cream soda, a bottle of wine (I like having wine around but Mom never buys it), some underwear (9 pairs! yay!), and best of all, a big inflatable swimming pool (to cool off in)! My Mom was going to buy Austin a big fireworks pack for $20, but I told her that'd be a bad idea since people around here have to work in the morning and also, it's not really a fireworks kind of holiday (more a day of rememberance). He got pouty and started acting like an ass so I had to yell at him, in front of a lot of people, in Target. He chilled out after that. After we finished at Target, we stopped at some new place calle Jamba Juice to see what they had. I wound up ordering some concoction called a Peenya Kowlada, which was sort of like a Pina Colada, except not. It had pineapple and coconut in it, but it also had yogurt and some other stuff in it too. I wasn't too thrilled with it. Austin was hungry, so went next door to Fatburgers. I wanted to try a Fatburger and did. It was ok. I wasn't really my kind of place though, too noisy. We finally went home after we finished there. We tried to play outside a bit tonight, but it was just too damned hot and humid (have I mentioned that it was hot and humid out?), so we went back in. I played some video games with Austin while Jess, ever the bandwagoneer, watched the Lightning game on TV. After we got bored with that, I went outside and tried to get the pool going, but I realized that the pump I have just couldn't get the job done, so around 11pm, the boys and I walked up to Walgreens. Before we stopped there, we went out behind the Walgreens to check on the cattails. Most weren't ready yet (they have to be soft, falling apart), but some were, so the boys had a mini-cattail fight. Austin was covered in cattail fluff, head to toe! We walked over to Dunkin' Donuts next, and I bought us all milk and eclairs. I don't know why Austin even ordered one though, three bites in and he was done. On the way to Dunkin' Donuts, we passed a small, dark, wooded area where there's and old abandoned house, and I dared Jesse to go in there and yell "I ain't afraid of the Boogeyman!". He went up to the edge of the woods and yelled it, and when he turned to face me, I pretended I saw someone coming at us and hauled ass, which scared him pretty good for a moment. When we passed there the second time, on the way back to Walgreens, I scared Austin by throwing a rock into the woods when he wasn't looking and when it landed, he saw the leaves move and he heard the russling noise. At Walgreens and I bought a mini air compressor for the pool, a water, and two jumbo Hershey bars. We went on home after that. We were pooped after we got home, so we just watched TV for a couple of hours. They watched "Jackass: The Movie" with me (I changed the channel during some of the more adult stuff) and then we watched some of "America's Funniest Animals" before Austin went on to bed (somewhere around 2:30am). Jess and I stayed up watching some hokey Kung-Fu flick, "The Master Of the Flying Guillotine". I ate his leftovers from Lone Star, then we played darts and listened to Rush. It was pretty fun. I'm glad I moved my dartboard out to the living room. He went on to bed around 4:45am. I'm heading to bed now.

Saturday, So Far I was out of bed before 1pm today, so that was good (better than yesterday anyway). I got my mailings packaged up and ready to mail, also good. Mom ordered pizza & wings for lunch and that was very good (except dietwise). We ran out after lunch and I mailed my stuff, then we hit two thrift stores before coming back home. No big finds today. I bought a another 3-drawer cassette tape storage case for $2, a paperback (Ayn Rand "Atlas Shrugged") for $1, and 5 tapes, all for $1.25. Less than $5 spent, not much of a shopping spree. The tapes I got were The Pat Travers Band "Crash And Burn", Lou Reed "Mistrial", Janis Joplin "Greatest Hits" (the insert is kind of messed up), Loverboy "Get Lucky" (plays poorly, but luckily I already had it), and Eddie Money "Playing For Keeps" (I don't think one's going to play very well, looks pretty of old and used). After we got home, I started scanning cards to list tonight. I'd pulled over 125 cards last night and even listed a few of them. I should have over 500 listed in my store by the time I finish tonight. That should keep me busy for the rest of the night... and I still need to practice for tomorrow night's workout with Santana's band.

Stuff I got up around 1:30pm yesterday, and today, 12:30pm. I'm pretty much back to my night owl hours again. *Sigh* I have two leads on jobs that I should check into, both in schools. One is a Cafeteria Attendant at an elementary school but is only 3 hours a day, the other is a Community Involvement Assistant, great pay, but it's way down in St.Pete (two long bus rides every day) and I'm not altogether sure I'd be right for the job (or it for me). My eBay auctions have been moving nicely, so I just may wait until I find the right thing. Something's bound to come up (I hope). I listed almost 100 auctions in my eBay store yesterday. It was up to nearly 450 items in it until this afternoon when this guy in Japan bought 17 cards! I sold a bunch yesterday too. I may pull some cards to list tonight. I would still like to have 500 listed before Sunday. Speaking of Sunday, Santana called today and invited me to practice with his band on Sunday (6pm). He said he'll have another guitar player there too, so I'd like to be in top form (which means I need to practice). He also said they may start practicing during the week too, which would be terrific. The more I play, the better I get, so bring it on! They want to start playing out soon. Their drummer has to undergo surgery in October, so that gives me a couple months playing time with them. By the time he goes in for surgery, my band should be about ready to play out again. My Mom picked up 5 tickets to a pre-season basketball game in Tampa, the Orlando Magic vs. the Miami Heat. I'm especially thrilled about this because the Heat now have Shaquille O'Neal on their team, the most dominant player in the entire NBA! Sweet! It'll be her, me, my two nephews, and probably my brother-in-law. I think she said the game is in October. I talked to my niece last night and again today, it looks like she's going to come down and spend the weekend with Mom and I next week. I think we'll get her on Friday. It was important to me to not let the Summer go by without having her down. She's getting older and will be going to college before long, so I wanted to make sure we got to spend some time together before spending time together becomes a hardship. My back is killing me today. It was bothering me last night too. Maybe I'm sitting too much. I keep thinking about taking walks in the evenings or in the mornings, but I never do. I hate doing stuff alone. John Kerry's speech last night still has me energized some. I still feel very hopeful about the things he said. I just hope he's for real. Talked to JP a few minutes ago, he's having trouble figuring out how to go about drums for the demo. He wants to buy a drum machine, but being recently laid-off himself, he's hesitant about making the purchase. He just doesn't think Jimmy'd have the time to do the demos the way we agreed, with JP sending him a rough track and Jimmy laying a new drum track over it. Very frustrating. I made several suggestions, but it's still up in the air. Neddless to say, our demo is not progressing very far. Speaking about not going very far... the car my Mom gave me is dead. It looks like the battery up and died. I finally have a car and I can't even use it. I need to go get a license still too. I'm so fucking lazy.

John Kerry For Prez! Unless something goes horribly awry, I am going to vote for urlLink John Kerry come November. I just watched his urlLink Democratic National Convention speech and he said everything I needed to hear him say (and I mean everything ). He said he plans on cutting corporate welfare, on stopping tax breaks for companies who outsource, on finally setting up a national health care plan, on repealing Bush's tax cuts for the wealthy, on ending unilateralism, on ending the backdoor draft of our reserve members, on bringing our troops home, on allowing stem cell research, and on and on and on. He also attacked the right people: Bush, Cheney and Ashcroft. If John Kerry accomplishes even a quarter of what he promises, he could end up being one of our greatest Presidents. At the very least, he has given me some hope for the future and that counts for something. Unfortunately, I couldn't get Mom to watch Kerry's speech tonight. She's extremely pessimistic about him, for no apparent reason, which worries me that she's going to do something incredibly stupid and vote for Bush or else not vote at all. It's been said numerous times before by many different people, but at this point, a vote for Bush is a serious character flaw.

Clownin' Around I've had this thing in my mind for years now, a novel or a movie about clowns done in a serious way. I find the notion of a "clown drama" very funny for some reason. Anyway, urlLink Sara asked for people to post silly little stories on her blog yesterday and I complied with a snippet of "clown drama" that I came up with especially for her blog. I added some more to it today too. I also came up with this this clown-themed faux newspaper article last night: Tragedy On Highway 64 by Bill Sherwin POTTSVILLE -- Yesterday afternoon, a speeding Volkswagen Beetle full of clowns drove straight into the back of a fully-loaded 16-ton truck, instantly killing all 41 of the Volkswagens passengers and severely injuring the trucks driver. Witnesses at the scene reported that the beetle had been weaving through traffic, upwards of 110 MPH, and that there appeared to be a massive food fight going on within the car. It is believed that the driver of the VW, identified only as Professor Slappy, may have had his vision impaired by pie or seltzer water just before slamming into the back of the truck, causing both vehicles to explode instantly. The explosion caused by the collision was said to have sent scores of screaming clowns airborne, raining down onto oncoming traffic. It was horrible, said one witness, kind of funny, but mostly horrible. The truck driver, John Holcomb, 46, suffered a broken arm and some minor burns. He had been transporting a shipment for the Ga-Ga Gags company, the Mid-Wests largest supplier of gag gifts, when he had suddenly been struck from behind. Witnesses at the scene said there were chattering teeth, groucho glasses, and clown parts strewn for about a mile down the section of U.S. Highway 64 where the accident occurred. One of the Emergency Response Technicians on the scene said that they were having a hard time figuring out where the victims ended and the gag gifts began. When asked for a comment, Sheriff J.T. Halper said of the tragedy Clowns arent funny. They give me the creeps. I sent it to my Mom at work and she said she was fooled at first, so I guess I did a decent job with it. I don't know if I'll do anymore, but I like writing, so I just might. By the way, comments are welcome (criticisms, critiques, whatever).

Rainy Day, Sleep Away I went to bed late again last night, read in bed before trying to sleep, and then got up late again today (around 11:30am). I had to get up several times throughout the night again too. I got up, played around on the PC, watched TV, and ate lunch. It was raining pretty much all day today, and I was still tired from not sleeping much last night, so I wound up in back bed eventually. I think I went back to bed around 4pm and stayed there until nearly 6pm, when I heard Mom on the phone (sounded like she was bitching about me). She was talking to JP. He said he's going to buy a drum machine and do his rhythm parts (for our demo) with the drum machine and then send the rhythm track to Jimmy so he can record his drum parts. I hope they bust their asses on it. I'd like to be finished with it by the end of August, so we can start working on playing out again. While I was sleeping, I won another auction (for $4.99 total): It's more than what I'd normally pay for used tapes, but...it looks like all 3 tapes are remastered and I don't have that particular Hendrix remastered tape ("Axis:Bold As Love") in my collection yet, and I need the Pink Floyd and Santana tapes, so it's well worth it to me (as long as they arrive in decent shape). I'm going to go watch "Amish In The City" with Mom now. I've been half-watching it for 20 minutes now anyway. The show looks like it could be interesting, but it also looks like they're going to ruin the concept (Amishfolk being introduced to modern city life) with stupid "Real World" type casting and attitude, which is too bad. My grandmother, my Mom's Mom, was Amish, and there were a lot of Amishfolk around where we lived in Pennsylvania.

Bank Yankers I hate my bank. They took me for another $27 today. Not for a bounced check or for anything that would affect anyone else, they charged me $27 because I was unable to transfer money to myself. I didn't realize my Paypal transfer hadn't cleared yet when I transferred money back to my Mom's account (I was in a hurry to pay her back what I could) and I didn't leave enough money in my checking account, which was my error, of course, but how does that merit a $27 charge? I mean, who got affected by it other than myself? For $27 you'd think abank employee had do do some manual labor on my account. Greedy fucks. I just got my insurance premium bill in too, the $6.75 one the bank decided not to clear for me because I didn't have enough funds in my savings (even though there is a mandatory $50 balance at all times and I had money in my checking account that could've covered it), yet, and this is what burns me the most, and yet they took $27 of my $50 to pay their own stinking fee. They can't spot me $6.75 for an account with a $50 balance but they can take $27 out for themselves? I hate my bank.

Pee-Pee-Palooza Last night sucked! I had to get up four times to pee... four times ! What am I, seventy-something ? I had a really time sleeping before and after each trip to the bathroom, I don't think I slept much all night. Naturally, when it came time to get up in the morning, I wasn't ready to do so. I had my alarm set for 9am, then I re-set it for 10am and went back to bed. Then, I slept through an hour of alarm/radio before finally getting up a little after 11am. Ugh! It looks like the getting-up-early thing is slowly slipping away from me again. Two days ago I was up at 8am, the next day 9am, and now, today, 11am. I'm slipping into my natural, night-owl lifestyle all over again. I wish I could just find myself a nighttime job and go with my natural schedule, but I need my nights for my band, so I have to have a day job, so i have to keep trying to keep myself on that schedule. It's hard to get up early when there's nothing to get up for. I mean, if I had a a job, I'd be up early for a reason, to go to work, but as is, I get up early and then I just sit here doing stuff I could do at anytime of the day. I think my life is based on Catch-22.

The Return Of urlLink The Friday Five ! The original Friday Five ended a while back, but it looks like someone else has revived it! It was always one of the better memes out there, so here's my Friday Five, the Monday Edition (better late than never): 1) who was your favorite band/musican when you were younger? That's a tough one for me, because there wasn't just one. In fact, I went through several phases. If I remember correctly, it was these guys first: My KISS phase lasted into Middle School. Then, one Summer these guys showed up on my TV: They made me laugh, the music was pretty good (except for the mushy Davy Jones stuff), so I started collecting their records and stuff. I even met Peter Tork at a Monkees convention nearby and got his autograph (which, sadly, I sold long ago). While I was still in my Monkees phase, I was hanging out with one of the boys from across the street, the oldest one, Billy, who also played guitar. One day I was hanging out in his room and he put on a record which completely blew me away. It was "Smash Hits", by this guy: I've never left my Hendrix phase. 2) why? KISS because I was a kid and the costumes and imagery appealed to me, The Monkees because they were on TV and I thought they were funny, and Jimi Hendrix because I'd never heard anything like him before (it was like stepping into another universe, musically). 3) are they still your favorite/one of your favorites? I still love early KISS, up until "Creatures Of The Night". Everything after that has pretty much sucked consistently. I like a lot of the Monkees stuff still, especially Mike Nesmith's stuff. Hendrix is still my all-time favorite. 4) what is your favorite of their songs? There's too many great KISS songs to name just one, for instance "Black Diamond", "Do You Love Me", "100,000 Years", "C'Mon And Love Me", "She", "Shock Me", "Deuce", and on and on and on... just a ton of killer songs! I love "The Porpoise Song" by the Monkees (from "Head"), and "Circle Sky" is awesome too (it really rocks). I love almost everything by Hendrix, especially "Machine Gun" (from "Band Of Gypsys"), "Pali Gap" and "Hey Baby (New Rising Sun)" (from "Rainbow Bridge", "Voodoo Child (Slight Return)", "Bold As Love" (from Axis:Bold As Love"), "Burning Desire" (from "Loose Ends"), "Ezy Ryder" and "In From The Storm" (from "The Cry Of Love") and his version of Dylan's "All Along The Watchtower", among others. Ask me tomorrow and I might have a totally different list of favorite Hendrix songs. 5) are there any specific lyrics you hold dear? I've never been too much of a "lyric man". If the songs rocks, it rocks, regardless of how good the lyrics are. That's not to say I don't appreciate good lyrics when I hear them, but they usually don't stay in my mind for long. I don't know why that is.

He picked me up around 1:30pm today and then we headed on over to Jimmy's. Once we got there it was slow starting. There were problems getting Jimmy's electronic drums to go through JP's 4-track recorder without the drums peaking out, causing sonic breaks and static. We wasted at least an hour working on it. Finally, after we got a workable drum sound, we decided to just record the best we could and then Jimmy could re-record his drums at a later date using the scratch rhythm tracks we put down today. JP wound up doing all of the rhythm parts (it was easier that way since he had to sing along anyway), for the most part, I wasn't really even needed. We got about 5 or 6 rough tracks laid down before we had to pack up and go. We were only over at Jimmy's for less than three hours. I was hoping for more time than that. Since Jimmy's taking off all of next month, I was hoping he'd make more time for us this month, today even. It looks now like what we got today is pretty much it for getting together and working on a demo. JP and I will have to work on laying down rhythm tracks alone on ACID and then JP will send those files over to Jimmy to work on whenever he can. I have a feeling we're not going to be ready to play out come September, having taken nearly two full months off. I'm thinking about getting JP, Al, and I together to jam. Both of them can play drums, Al and I can switch off on guitar and bass, it would be fun. JP could even bring in his keyboard. We could work on new material and try out new cover songs without any pressure whatsoever. I really don't want to go another month without us playing; two months is just too long. And then, we lose another month in December or January when JP takes off. Ugh! I'll probably play with Santana's band next Saturday, just to be able to play, if he still wants me there. I think he was disappointed I wasn't going to make it tonight, but hey, working on a demo for my band has priority over jamming with his band. Besides, he never officially asked me to join his band or made it clear exactly what kind of situation I'd be walking into, so I don't feel like I did him wrong or anything by not playing tonight. I've made no commitment with him. In fact, if JP buys the recording studio he's thinking about buying, I may not be playing with Santana at all. I'm sure I'd be spending as much spare time as possible at JP's studio. JP and I are pretty creative, especially when it comes to music, and I know we would have an absolute blast there, recording our asses off. He seems pretty serious about doing it too (my fingers are crossed). I'm about ready for bed now, very tired. I still need to check out the Jobs section (from today's paper) yet though. What to do, what to do...

Rainy Day, Jam Away For some odd reason, I slept horribly last night. It was raining and usually I'd snuggle up and sleep like a baby, but last night I kept waking up, over and over again. After lunch, Santana called me and said he'd be over to pick me up around 4:30pm. I talked to JP earlier and he said he wasn't going (not a surprise). I got showered, dressed, and ready for Santana to come pick me up. He arrived a little early and we wound up waiting a long time (an hour and a half)for the other guys to show up and get set-up. We had Jon on keyboards, Mike on drums, Page on rhythm guitar, Angus on bass, Ronnie on sax and flute, Santana on percussion, and me on lead guitar. At one point there was some lady singing too (just on "Chain Of Fools"), I guess she used to sing with their band. I was familiar with most of the covers they played (we do several of the same ones in my band), but they do things a little different than I'm used to, so I still had to play it by ear a lot. I think I did okay on just about everything. We played "Long Train Running", "Blues Before Sunrise", "Before You Accuse Me", "Feelin' Alright", "Three A.M.", "Chain Of Fools", "Crossroads", "Can't You See", "Old Time Rock & Roll", "I'm Tore Down", "I Can't Stand It", "Proud Mary", "Mustang Sally", "Wild Night", "Black Magic Woman", "Brick House", and "Hey Joe". Mike mentioned he like CCR a lot, so I threw out "Born On The Bayou" and "Who'll Stop The Rain". Some stuff sounded pretty good, some of it kind of rough. I'll have to work on learning some of their material, to cut down on the percentage of the rough stuff. We only played until 9pm, which kind of sucked. We started at 6pm and they took a 1/2 hour break in the middle. I would've liked to have played longer. I guess I'm going to sit in with them again next week, which works for me (the more practice I get, the better). It sounds like they want me to play with them all the time, but nobody put it that way, so I'm still not sure what's going to happen with these guys. Santana mentioned playing some gigs, though. We'll see. I may be playing in two bands, neither of which are playing the kind of stuff I really want to play. Oh! Dig this: Angus, the bassist (who's really, really good), said he has a gig coming up over in Tampa with (now get this) Randy Jackson (from Zebra)... holy shit! How fucking cool is that? He said they're going to be playing all Led Zeppelin material... sweet! He also said something about playing with Joe Lynn Turner (from Rainbow), but I'm not sure if it's the same show or not. I'll have to find out next week. In other news, one of my cats, Stevie, is sneezing a lot. He's been doing it for a couple of days now. I'm afraid he'll have to go see the vet. Steve won't like that very much, and knowing how Stevie reacts to stuff like that (he freaks ), I know I won't enjoy it very much either. Also, since I have no money, Mom will probably have to pay for it, so she also won't like it very much. Jobs And The Jobbed I thought I was going to stay up all day today, but somewhere around 10am, I laid down on the couch to watch TV and that was it for me. Eventually, I got up and went to my bed, where I slept until nearly 5pm. The rest of the day was spent playing on the computer and watching TV... pretty sad. You'd think I was living the high life, but there is very little happiness to it. I don'trowing money and I don't like not knowing how or if I'll get through each week, each month. I need a job, badly . I'm going to try and hit the sack shortly. I'd like to be up around 9am tomorrow. I have a lot of job hunting ahead of me and I've decided not to settle for a crap job, no matter what. I'll sell or pawn stuff if I have to, but I refuse to work for less than $7 an hour ever again. I used to think people on unemployment who refused to take any available job, were bums, abusing the system, but now I understand: The corporations have won and you either surrender and work for crap wages or you buck the system. Wages have not risen accordingly with the cost of living, and minumum wage? What a joke! Compared with the economy 40 years ago, minimum wage should be $10 an hour. Sounds like a lot perhaps, but when you compare it to how much CEOs and other big executives are taking home, it's a mere pittance. Consider these facts: urlLink The average CEO pay went up 35 percent in 1997 to $7.8 million, according to Business Week's new executive pay survey. That comes to $150,000 a week. Average worker pay went up 3 percent last year - all the way to $424 a week. Workers still earn less in wages, adjusting for inflation, than they did in the 1970s. The average CEO made 326 times the pay of factory workers last year, up from 209 times factory workers' pay in 1996. Back in 1980, when many more workers were unionized, the wage gap was much smaller: CEOs made 42 times as much as factory workers. Like a bunch of pigs at the trough... The corporations are exploiting us, plain and simple. And it's not just us, but workers worldwide. They ship our jobs overseas, good, solid jobs, and then hire people who will work for much less than American workers. This is one of the problems I have with voting for John Kerry this election; we've gotten to this point in the hands of the Republicans and Democrats. Both parties are in the pockets of corporate America, which is why we have no universal health care in the U.S., the wealthiest country in the world. Every election year they hold healthcare in front of voters like a carrot before a mule and as always, it never becomes reality. I'm really thinking hard about voting for Ralph Nader again. Only a strong third party can break the grip these two parties have on our country, and the only way to get a strong third party is to support and vote for it. Unfortunately, Nader has distanced himself from the Green Party and is running as an independent, but being tied to a party doesn't really matter, his election would still have the same effect on our political system. I think it would cause massive reforms and the lock the two major parties have on our government would be broken. Ahhh... can you hear the freedom calling?
